title: Rockefeller Attends Funeral for Brydges
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. April 2 (UPI)Hundreds of political figures and friends, including Vice President Rockefeller, attended a funeral today for Earl W. Brydges, former State Senate majority leader. The service was held in the 157yearold St. Mary of the Cataract Church, the oldest Roman Catholic church here.

title: Snow Puts Off Game
description: CHICAGO, April 2 (AP)The scheduled National Hockey League game between the Kansas City Scouts and Chicago Black Hawks tonight was postponed and rescheduled for tomorrow night because of a snowstorm.

title: Court Bars Nuclear Reactor in Densely Settled Area
description: CHICAGO, April 2Builders of nuclear power plants and the newly created. Nuclear Regulatory Commission were given an emphatic warning yesterday that they could not build reactors in densely populated areas.

title: Imperfect Amnesty
description: To describe the outcome of President Ford's amnesty for draft evaders and deserters merely as disappointing would ignore the program's intrinsic flaws, which made it virtually certain from the first that only a fraction of those eligible would avail themselves of the offer. Even under its inadequate provisions, the plan might well have attracted more than the final total of 22,500 of an estimated 126,000 eligibles had Mr. Ford agreed to another extension of the deadline, as recommended by Charles E. Goodell, chairman of the Presidential Clemency Board.

title: COURT UPSETS BAN ON MAIDEN NAMES
description: TRENTON, April 2, (AP)A state appeals court declared today that women in New Jersey might not be barred from resuming the use of their maiden names.

title: Coal Industry Is Thriving As Use in Recession Gains
description: Despite a recession that has affected many industries, the coal industry appears to be enjoying continued high sales and profits brought about by rising coal prices and diminshing availability of fuels, such as oil and natural gas, and the unreliability of nuclear plants.

title: PLAN IS SET FOR CUT IN RATES IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, April 2 (Reuters)Finance Minister JeanPierre Fourcade said today in a news interview he planned to take concrete measures shortly to lower interest rates and to extend the system of special credit facilities for specific sectors.

title: Prosecutor, in Summation, Calls Killing of Officer in Attica Prison Revolt Cowardly, Unmanly Attack
description: BUFFALO, April 2  Calling the killing of Correction Officer William E. Quinn a Cowardly and unmanly attack, Louis Aidala, the prosecutor in the Attica trial here, summed up his case today and asked that the two defendants, John Hill and Charles Joseph Pernasilice, be found guilty.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 2 (UPI)A business regulation board advisory committee said today that the state should buy and run the five thoroughbred racing tracks it had raped and plundered through taxation. The board scheduled a public hearing April 16 in Miami on proposed legislation to create a nonprofit thoroughbred racing trust of Florida tp be governed by a fivemember authority. It would be patterned after the New York Racing Association and could sell bonds to buy the tracks, which would be exempt from local taxes. The tracks are Calder, Tropical, Hialeah, Florida Downs and Gulfstream.

title: Colonels Keep Pace
description: LOUISVILLE, April 2 (AP)  The Kentucky Colonels won their eighth game in a row tonight with an 8881 victory over the Virginia Squires that enabled them to keep pace with the New York Nets.

title: Miss Nadig Ski Victor
description: PORDENONE, Italy, April 2 (UPI)MarieTherese Nadig of Switzerland won a women's European Cup giant ??om today, beating Claudia Giordani of Italy and Dagmar Kuzmanova of Czechoslovakia.

title: Aston Martin Sale To Group Is Possible
description: LONDON, April 2 (Reuters) Britain's troubled car maker, Aston Martin, Ltd., may be sold to a group of American, Canadian and British businessmen for $2.3million, a company spokesman said tonight.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SIX'S BAG Although he was a key jazz innovator of the nineteentwenties, the music of Bix (Leon) Beiderbecke is rarely heard in concert now, as it will be tonight at Carnegie Hall. Except to collectors of rare recordings and to jazz musicians and scholars, the cornetistpianistcomposer remains best known as the prototype for Dorothy Baker's famous 1938 novel, Young Man With a Horn. Mr. Beiderbecke died seven years before, leaving an influential legacy of style and harmony.

title: Poor Administration Is Snarling Huge Ethiopian Land Reform
description: ADESSE, Ethiopia, March 27 We must plant soon, now that it has rained, a peasant said as he sat with some neighbors in a rounded straw hut. But, he went on, we cannot.

title: Text of Vietcong's Statement Calling for a Transfer of Allegiance
description: PARIS, April 2Following, as translated from the French by The New York Times, is the text of a Vietcong statement entitled Policy in Seven Points Promulgated and Applied by the Provisional Revolutionary Government of South Vietnam. It was distributed today by the South Viettnamese Communist delegation here.

title: Retreat
description: LONDONThere are two fashionable myths about the current North Vietnamese offensive in South Vietnam that the South has more men and more guns than the North, and that the North is more highly motivated than the South.

title: Hubert Heffner, Physicist At Stanford and U.S. Aide
description: Prof. Hubert Heffner, deputy director of the White House Office of Science and Technology from 1969 to 1971, died of cancer Tuesday at Stanford (Calif.) University Hospital. He was 50 years old.

title: TV Coverage Planned Of Ford News Parley
description: The three television networksCBS, NBC and ABC and the public television system have scheduled live coverage of this afternoon's Presidential news conference from. San Diego beginning at 3 P.M.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: EVERETT ESTES
description: Everett Estes, a vice president of the Valley Bank of New York, Valley Stream, L.I., died Tuesday evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 50 years old and lived in Garden City.

title: U.S. Staff Starting To Leave Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 2The United States Embassy announced today that it would begin evacuating diplomatic and other personnel from the Cambodian capital tomorrow and would also take members of other allied missions.

title: Ford Reported Undecided On Tax Cut Bill Until End
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 President Ford was reportedly so undecided about the big antirecession tax cut bill passed by Congress last week that he had two speeches prepared before he announced his decision Saturday nightone for use with a veto and the other for signing the legislafi tion.

title: Planeload of Vietnamese Orphans on Way to U.S.
description: TOKYO, Thursday, April 3A plane carrying 57 orphaned Vietnamese children to new homes in the United States left Saigon without official clearance and reached Japan early today on the first stage of the 8.000mile flight.

title: Offensive Against Saigon Foreseen Within 5 Days
description: The timing and tactics of a battle for Saigon are now in the hands of the North Vietnamese high command, according to United States military sources. The Communists, with six divisions in the Saigon area, are in a position to exploit their momentum and the confusion in the city and launch a major attack where and when they wish.

title: CON EDISON SEEKS INCREASE OF 21,7% IN ELECTRIC RATES
description: The Consolidated Edison Company asked the State Public Service Commission yesterday for the largest electric rate increase in the commission's history  a 21.7 percent rise. It would add $4 to $5 a month to the utility bills of most city residents and give Con Edison $456million in additional revenue.

title: Saudi Hints Easing on Issue of Jerusalem
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, April, 2The new head of Saudi Arabia's Foreign Ministry, while stressing continuity in Saudi policies, has suggested that Jews have a right to worship at their sacred sites in Jerusalema view that had not been heard publicly in this passionately antiIsraeli city in recent memory.

title: Americans Still Can't Top Those Fine Italian Hands
description: For almost 20 years the best American teams have been trying to defeat the best Italian team, but with total lack of success. Another effort took place a month ago, with no preliminary fanfares but no change in the result.

title: Registration for Draft At Birthday Is Ended
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)The 27yearold rule requiring young American men to register for the draft within a month of their eighteenth birthdays was abolished Tuesday. Selective Service officials said it would soon be replaced by a onceayear registration system.

title: Anker Says Board in District 1 Chose Acting Head Improperly
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker ruled yesterday that members of the community school hoard for District 1 on the Lower East Side had failed to follow proper procedures when they recently named an acting superintendent.

title: Voodoo Cultists Sought By Police in Ridgefield
description: RIDGEFIELD, April 2 (AP) The police here are trying to catch a group of fertility rite and voodoo cultists who are using an old church cemetery to dump the remains of animals they have killed.

title: Contrasts in Song By Mabel Mercer And Morgana King
description: The upstairs and downstairs entertainment rooms at the St. Regis Hotel are offering a provocative contrast in singing styles.

title: State of the World
description: At a moment when the current of world events is running against us, the President is working on a formal address on foreign policy to a joint session of Congress. Scheduled for prime TV time Thursday of next week if the Speaker and minority leader of the House can be induced to return from their wanderings around Chinathis speech is Mr. Ford's attempt to stem the tide of despair and to reinstill a sense of purpose in our dealings with the world.

title: Protecting the Elderly
description: The job of cleaning up and restructuring the nursing home business is difficult because so much of rot and corruption have pervaded the industry. It is made even more difficult because the status quo is enormously profitable to many operators; and candor about the past could be dangerous to a number of powerful politicians.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: 11 IronOre Producers Form Association
description: GENEVA, April 2Exporters of iron ore  both developing countries and industrialized nations  agreed today to establish an association free of cartellike arrangements.

title: H.E.W. ASSAILED BY HEALTH AIDE
description: NORTH BRUNSWICK, April 2The Executive director of the nationwide Association of State and Territorial Health Officials charged here today that the Department of Health, Education and Welfare suffered from a definite lack of understanding the country's health services.

title: U.S. Auctions Home To Satisfy Tax Bill Of War Protesters
description: FREMONT, Mich., April 2 (AP) Paul Snyder and his wife, Addie, saw their home sold today for the taxes they refused to pay to support the wars they opposed.

title: OhioSealy Wins Suit
description: CHICAGO, April 2 (UPI)The OhioSealy Mattress Manufacturing Company said today a Federal court jury in Chicago had returned a verdict in favor of the company in its antitrust suit against the licensing company, Sealy, Inc., for $20.44million, representing triple damages. The appeal for injunctive relief against the licensing concern still is to be argued.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Junior Sportsmen's Group Opens Wildlife Show
description: At the 28th annual Junior Sportsmen's Show in the Rutgers University Field House in New Brunswick, Joyce Brazdovic made friends with a baby chick. John Mulcaby and William Conti, left, studied ?? models of ducks common to the state. Show of hunting, fishing and conservation gear will run through Saturday.

title: 4 OPEC MEMBERS NOW BORROWING
description: PARIS, April 2  Although vast amounts of money are flowing to the oilexporting countries, some  because of their own pressuresare now becoming important borrowers of funds, international bankers reported today.

title: Midtown Explosions Hit 4 Buildings at Midnight
description: Four time bombs exploded within minutes of one another at about midnight last night in midtown Manhattan, shattering plateglass windows in a bank, two insurance company buildings and a restaurant, Two pedestrians were slightly injured by flying glass, the police reported.

title: REDLICH IS CHOSEN LAW DEAN AT N.Y.U.
description: Prof. Norman Redlich, who served as the city's Corporation Counsel under Mayor John V. Lindsay and as an assistant counsel to the President's Commission on the Assassination of President Kennedy, has been appointed dean of New York University's School of Law.

title: Suburban Transit Strike
description: UPPER DARBY, Pa., April 2 (UPI)  A strike against the suburban division of the area's transit authority began at 12:01 A.M. today. Some 350 drivers of the Red Arrow Division of the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority voted last night to strike

title: Lawyer Presents a Case for Ridgebacks
description: So confident is D. Jay Hyman, a lawyer from Barnesville, Md., that buyers will like his Rhodesian ridgebacks, whippets and greyhounds that he gives a guarantee with each sale. If the purchaser is not satisfied with the dog within a couple of weeks it may be returned.

title: Business Briefs
description: SAIGON, April 2 (UPI)Two major American oil companies drilling for oil off South Vietnam have halted work and are pulling out immediately because of the country's uncertain military and political future.

title: Pistons Clinch Berth
description: DETROIT, April 2 (AP)Detroit rode Bob Lanier's 26 points and a balanced scoring attack into the National Basketball Association playoffs tonight as the Pistons scored a 9789 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

title: Ashe First to Get Playoff Spot
description: Will this be Arthur Ashe's year? The man with the whiplash serve and cool temperament has become the first to qualify for the $100,000 World Championship Tennis singles playoff in Dallas on May 7, which winds up the 84player tour that started in February. Winner of three tournaments and with a match record of 28 victories against 4 defeats, Ashe is blowing opponents off the court with his highvelocity attack. He has qualified for the playoffs four times before, but has never won the W. C. T. championship, regarded as one of the world's major titles.

title: Books of The Times
description: In a brief foreword to his Thurber: A Biography, The New Yorker staff writer Burton Bernstein makes a point that echoes throughout his book and lingers long after one has finished reading it. When I finished my final draft of the biography, he writes by way of explaining the role that Thurber's widow, Helen, played in the project, I presented her with a copy for her emendations and comments, in conformity with our agreement. Her emenda tions were comparatively few but her comments were numerous. The gist of her complaints was that I had treated her husband's life in too negative a fashion. I am sorry she felt that way. What I did was simply take the facts as they were revealed to me from letters, personal papers, published matter, interviews, and, with a minimum of preconception and using Thurber's own words as much as possible, set them down. In biographya more profound form of journalismpatent truth can have no surrogate. What this reader wondered was: How could Mrs. Thurberclearly a woman of integrity, to judge from the portrait of her that emerges from these same pagespossibly have thought otherwise? What could she have had in mind when she complained of Mr. Bernstein's negativity? After all, the unhappy aspects of her husband's life seem plain for anyone to see in this the most comprehensive and threedimensional portrait of Thurber yet to be rendered. How his childhood was disrupted not only by the famous bowandarrow accident that cost him one eye (and doomed the other) at the age of six, but alsoand more subtlyby family tensions that led to his virtually boarding with a favorite aunt from the of 10 to 15.

title: Knicks Going for Clincher in Cleveland Tonight, but Cays Want Same Reward
description: Bill Fitch, who used to mock his Cleveland Cavaliers when he coached them to some of the worst records in the National Basketball Association, says success hasn't changed him. My life style is the same, said the man who leads the league in funny oneliners. I still walk down the same alleys and take the back streets home and hide.

title: New Museum Site Picked
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 2 (UPI)A new site, at the corner of Seventh and Arch Streets in the downtown area, has been chosen for the black history museum, an official of the city's bicentennial agency said yesterday. A site in the Society Hill section was abandoned because residents organized opposition. Ground will be broken for the $2.5million structure on April 9 and construction is scheduled to be completed by May, 1976.

title: 2 Brothers Are Arrested In $20,000 Extortion Effort
description: Two brothers who reportedly sought to extort $20,000 from a Queens bank manager by threatening to harm his wife were arraigned in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday after their arrest by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 5 Murdered and Left in Buffalo Fire; Theft of Welfare Money Is Suspected
description: Buffalo, April 2Five elderly people were savagely murdered here today, then left in A burning slum building after what the police suspect was a robbery for their welfare money.

title: Americans Failed to Help Nha Trang Staff Escape
description: NHA TRANG, South Vietnam, April 1 (UPI)If one Vietnamese is allowed on the aircraft, we'll never be able to stop them, an American said to a South Vietnamese Army lieutenant pleading that children be put on a mercy flight.

title: World Airways Seeks CutRate Fare
For a Young Upstater, The Way It Used to Be Is the Way It Is Again
description: A time machine would have been the more appropriate vehicle in which to have traveled on that recent wet afternoon. Or, at the very least, a covered victoria for this journey into the pasta charade created and lived by an unsmiling young man named Laurence G. Broadmoore.

title: TROOPS EXHORTED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 3The number of coastal towns reported abandoned to Communist forces without resistance by collapsing Government troops continued to swell yesterday.

title: ASA B. GIBBS, HEADED CANAVERAL CENTER
description: Asa B. Gibbs, the first commander of the spacevehicle launching center at Cape Canaveral, Fla., died of cancer Tuesday evening in Melbourne, Fla. He was 63 years old.

title: Cocaine Ring Here Broken With Arrest Of Six in Yorkville
description: The Drug Enforcement Task Force announced that it had broken up a $60milliona year cocaine ring with the arrest of six men on a Yorkville street corner early yesterday.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Halting a downward trend, prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday as volume rose slightly. Similar conditions prevailed in the overthe counter market.

title: CON EDISON SEEKS INCREASE OF 21.7% IN ELECTRIC RATES
description: The Consolidated Edison Company asked the State Public Service Commission yesterday for the largest electric rate increase in the commission's history  a 21.7 percent rise. It would add $4 to $5 a month to the utility bills of most city residents and give Con Edison $456million in additional revenue.

title: Blames Subdue Leafs, 30, and Keep Playoff Hopes Alive; Rockets Beaten
description: TORONTO, April 2 (UPI)Ray Comeau, Tom Lysiak and Tim Ecclestone scored goals and Dan Bouchard turned in a shutout performance tonight to give Atlanta a 30 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs, keeping the Flames' flickering playoff hones alive.

title: NISSAN MAKES AUTO WITH LOW POLLUTION
description: TOKYO, April 2 (Reuters)Nissan Motor has produced a lowpollution car meeting Japan's 1975 emission controls, which came into force this month.

title: 8 More Nations Agree To Extend Coffee Pact
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 2 (UPI)Eight more countries have signed the protocol extending the 1968 International Coffee Agreement to Sept. 30, 1976, it was announced today.

title: Key Witness Is Slain on Eve of Extortion Trial
description: On the eve of the trial of three former detectives charged with extorting $100,000 from five suspected narcotics dealers, it was disclosed that a key witness had been found shot to death on a weedcovered lot in the Midland Beach area of Staten Island on Monday.

title: MADISON MAYOR BEGINS NEW TERM
description: MADISON, Wis., April 2 (AP) Mayor Paul Soglin, Madison's mustachioed onetime hippie alderman, said today that his easy reelection victory proved a majority of this city's voters were willing to trust a political activist in office.

title: U.S. Charges Footprints Of Payoff Led to Connally
description: WASHINGTON, April 2A Goyernment prosecutor told the jury today in the bribery trial of John B. Connally that there was documentary evidence to prove that the former Secretary of the Treasury had solicited and received a $10,000 payoff for helping the dairy industry.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, APRIL 3, 1975

title: The RightWing Life Line Program, Lacking H. L. Hunt's Aid, Has Lost Radio Outlets and Revenues
description: DALLASLife Line, whose rightwing advocacy of traditional American values, boomed forth daily from more than 500 radio stations fivel years ago under the aegis of, H. L. Hunt, the oil billionaire, has fallen on hard times.

title: U.D.C.'s Ripple Effect
description: While state officials are striv ing to salvage the financially stricken Urban Development Corporation, and a special commission seeks the causes of its insolvency, housing experts taking a longer view are concerned by a grim reality: The spectacular troubles of the superagency have dealt a major blow to the future of subsidized housing in New York State, as well as to the growing efforts of other states to combat urban blight.

title: CAREY TO EXPAND WOMEN'S DIVISION
description: ALBANY, April 2An expanded Women's Division will be set up in the state government and Mary Burke Nicholas, a former Federal economist, will head it, Governor Carey's office announced today.

title: U.S. PanAm Team
description: Maralyn West, head manager of the 1968 Olympic team, will serve in the same capacity for the women's track and field team. Miss West is an assistant principal in the Cleveland school system.

title: Aeros Set Scoring Mark
description: HOUSTON, April 2 (UPI)Frank Hughes scored two goals and picked up an assist tonight to lead the Houston Aeros to a W.H.L. season scoring record of 918 points as they topped the Cleveland Crusaders, 76. The previous league record was 902 held by Minnesota.

title: U.S. Routed in Soccer
description: ROME, April 2 (AP)Italy crushed the United States, 100, in an exhibition soccer match at Rome's Olympic Stadium today. The Italians scored five goals in each half against Bob Rigby of the Philadelphia Atoms of the North American Soccer League.

title: U.S. Charges Footprints Of Payoff Led to Connally
description: WASHINGTON, April 2A Government prosecutor told the jury today in the bribery trial of John B. Connally that there was documentary evidence to prove that the former Secretary of the Treasury had solicited and received a $10,000 payoff for helping the dairy industry.

title: City Opera Tote Stadt Exploits Film Technique
description: It has been over 50 years since the oncefamous Die Tote Stadt by Erich Wolfgang Korngold has received a major stage presentation in New York. Last night the New York City Opera took the dead city in hand with a production conceived by Frank Corsaro and Ronald Chase. That means, as it did in A Village Romeo and Juliet, projections, films, montages and the entire new apparatus of the new age that has come into being since Korngold composed his opera in 1920.

title: Music Hall Mural Going to Museum
description: A major painting by Stuart Davis, one of the leading American modernists of the generation that came to prominence in the period between the two. World Wars, will soon be accessible to a sexually unsegregated public for the first time since it was completed in 1932.

title: Companies Reducing Dividends on Increase
description: The number of United States corporations that reduced or omitted dividends during the first quarter of the year was the highest in at least a decade, according to Standard's & Poor's Corporation.

title: U.S. Staff Starting To Leave Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 2The United States Embassy announced today that it would begin evacuating diplomatic and other personel from the Cambodian capital tomorrow and would also take members of other allied missions.

title: Federal Aid Gets 20,000 Jobs Here
description: Accelerated hiring for federally financed public  service jobs for city agencies led Lucille Rose, Commissioner of Employment, to forecast yesterday that 20,000 formerly jobless people would be at work by April 30. This could double the number working under the program at the end of March.

title: 5 Slain in Buffalo
Two in Congress Act to Block Shipments of Plutonium Here
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Two members of Congress sought today to block shipments of plutonium through New York City.

description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Following are questions and answers, as prepared by the Internal Revenue Service, about the tax rebates:

title: Diarrhea Outbreaks on 2 Ships Linked to Contaminated Seafood
description: Federal medical detectives have traced large outbreaks of diarrhea among passengers aboard two cruise ships to a bacterium that lust two decades ago doctors did not know was harmful to man.

title: Goodrich Recalls Tires
description: AKRON, Ohio, April 2 (UPI) The B. F. Goodrich Company announced today a recall of 3,671 steelbelted radial snow tires, saying that the tires involved could fail through separation of the two steel belts. The Silvertown Trailmaker tires bear the serial numbers BCYYLO1304, 1324, 1134, 13344 and 1354. Some others produced under the Hood, Diamond, Brunswick and Miller trade names were also involved in the recall. Their serial numbers are BCYYLOJ304, 324, 334, 344, and 354.

title: Federal Program is Providing Funds for 20,000 Public Service Jobs in City by End of This Month
description: Accelerated hiring for federally financed public  service jobs for city agencies led Lucille Rose, Commissioner of Employment, to forecast yesterday that 20,000 formerly jobless people would be at work by April 30. This could double the number working under the program at the end of March.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. LEMUEL L. FOSTER
description: Netta Mae Mosely Foster, wife of Lemuel L. Foster, volunteer personnel and racerelalions consultant, died Tuesday at her home. She was 85 years old and lived at 246 West 150th Street.

title: A Soviet Weather Satellite
description: MOSCOW, April 2 (UPI) The Soviet Union orbited a Meteor satellite yesterday to gather weather information, the Tass press agency said today. The satellite is transmitting pictures of clouds and snow cover on the day and night sides of the globe and information on heat radiation, Tass said.

title: T .W .A. Held Liable For Raid Damages At Athens Airport
description: A Federal judge ruled here yesterday that Trans World Airlines was liable for damages sought by passengers who were injured during an Arab terrorist attack in an airport lounge in Athens.

title: A FearSwept Saigon Is on Brink of Chaos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2This capital is on the brink of chaos. The streets are humid and eerily silent at night as soldiers cluster on street corners or sprawl on the pavement and sleep beneath tamarind trees.

title: EMPLOYE INQUIRY IS PLANNED BY AMEX
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it was inquiring into the activities of certain exchange employes who may have violated its policies covering securities transactions by personnel.

title: Personal Finance: System Urged For Expediting Consumer Claims
description: Legislation has been proposed in different parts of the country to provide the public with a faster and easier way to settle grievances against merchants and manufacturers.

title: Tribunal Rules Rhodesia Had Right to Detain Sithole
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 2 (Reuters)A special tribunal ruled today that the Rhodesian Government was fully, warranted in detaining the black nationalist leader Ndahaningi Sithole last month.

title: FOREIGN NEWSMEN ASSAILED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2With panic spreading in Saigon, the South Vietnamese Army newspaper has demanded that the Government take strong, hard measures against foreign correspondents because they are in major part responsible for the Communists' successes.

title: STANDARD & POOR DROPS A RATING FOR CITY'S BONDS,
description: Standard & Poor's, one of the two foremost creditrating agencies in the country, anlounced yesterday that it had suspended its A rating of New York City bondsan action that was seen as a severe setback in the city's battle to remain solvent.

title: PEACETALK OFFER
description: PARIS, April 2Vietcong officials issued a series of statements here today calling for an uprising against the Saigon Government of President Nguyen Van Thieu and a negotiated end of the fighting.

title: Music Hall Mural Going to Museum
description: A major painting by Stuart Davis, one of the leading American modernists of the generation that came to prominence in the period between the two. World Wars, will soon be accessible to a sexually unsegregated public for the first time since it was completed in 1932.

title: Lawyer Presents a Case for Ridgebacks
description: So confident is D. Jay Hyman, a lawyer from Barnesville, Md., that buyers will like his Rhodesian ridgebacks, whippets and greyhounds that he gives a guarantee with each sale. If the purchaser is not satisfied with the dog within a couple of weeks it may be returned.

title: CITY REMAINS FIRM ON NEW FIRE CODE
description: City officials warned yesterday that there would be no extension of the January deadline for installing a complex, expensive and essentially untried fire safety system in every office building more than 100 feet tall.

title: Busing Issue Stirs Disputes Upstate
description: BUFFALOI know these people and I know you'll never see their children bused, Joseph Hillery, a member of the Board of Education, was saying the other day. They just won't let it happenthey'll have another Boston first.

title: A BIKERS INMATE FOUND STRANGLED
description: A 56yearold inmate at the prison hospital on Bikers Island was strangled in his cell Tuesday night by two young men whom he had asked to help him cornsnit suicide, the police and prison authorities said yesterday.

title: RUTGERS BUDGET IS TERMED FAIR
description: TRENTON, April 2 (UPI)The president of Rutgers University said today that the proposed $89.7million budget for the institution was fair and equitable in view of. New Jersey's severe financial crisis.

title: Met Engages First Woman Conductor
description: Sarah Caldwell, founder and director of the Opera Company of Boston, will become the first woman to conduct at the Metropolitan Opera. She will lead 11 performances next season of Verdi's La Traviata, with the first one scheduled for Jan. 13, 1976.

title: Ruth Duncan McDonald In Rousing Ives Sonata
description: Ruth Duncan McDonald, a pianist with experience in both jazz and classical performance, gave a recital of American music at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night that included a rousing display of her multiple talents in Ives's Concord Sonata.

title: Waldheim Bars U.N. Plea on Refugees
description: ROME, April 2Secretary General Waldheim said today that the fate of Vietnamese, refugees In areas occupied by Communist forces was a very controversial political problem that the United Nations should avoid.

title: Stage: Ibsen's Ghosts at the Public
description: There are many and unaccountable ways of being shocked in the theater, but they can all be summarized under two headings: good shocking and bad shocking. Good shocking can involve a reappraisal of ideas or even ideals; bad shocking is usually the result of theatrical ineptitude. The latter is the shock value provided by the Shaliko Company's production of Ibsen's Ghosts, which last night opened at the Little Theater in the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater complex.

title: DHJ SUES TO BAR DOMINION OFFER
description: DHJ Industries, Inc., said yesterday it had filed suit in United States District Court here to prevent Dominion Textile, Ltd., of Montreal, from offering to purchase its stock.

title: About the Yankees ...
description: The Yankees expect a sellout of 7,200 for Mets' game at Fort Lauderdale tonight, which will be televised in New York (Channel 11, 8 P.M.) After that it's on to Florida's west coast for games against the Pirates in Bradenton Friday and Sunday; against the Phillies in Clearwater Saturday; a workout in Tampa next Monday and then north to Cleveland for Tuesday's opener. ... The new catcher from the White Sox, Ed Herrmann, is to be used primarily as a lefthanded pinch hitter and also for protection behind the plate or at first base.

title: PATROLMAN KILLED BY SNIPER IS BURIED
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 2 (UP1)A Mount Holly, N.J., patrolman fatally shot by a ?? was buried today as his pregnant widow and 1,445 police officers watched.

title: Temple Will Coach
description: Edward S. Temple, for the last 25 years the head coach of women's track and field at Tennessee State, was chosen yesterday to direct the United States team in the PanAmerican Games in Mexico, Oct. 12 to 26.

title: JOSEPH F. M'HENRY
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 2 (UPI)Joseph F. McHenry, a sportswriter for The Providence JournalBulletin, was found dead yesterday at his home after apparently having suffered a stroke. He was 60 years old.

title: In Memoriam
description: FARRINGTONRichard. Happy birthday in Heaven, Father. Children, Jewel, Geraldine and Parnell.

title: American Couples Besiege Agencies for Vietnamese Orphans
description: American couples have been swamping telephone lines of key adoption agencies in the United States, urging officials to speed delivery of South Vietnamese orphans while time remains, before attacks by North Vietnamese troops foreclose evacuation efforts.

title: People in Sports
description: Gene Bartow, whose Memphis State basketball team lost to John Wooden's U.C.L.A. team in the National Collegiate final two years ago, won the job as Wooden's successor yesterday. The 64yearold Wooden retired last Monday after capturing his 10th national crown in the last 12 years at the University of California, Los Angeles.

title: Ford Reported Undecided On Tax Cut Bill Until End
description: WASHINGTON, April 2President Ford was reportedly so undecided about the big antirecession tax cut bill passed by Congress last week that he had two speeches prepared before he announced his decision Saturday nightone for use with a veto and the other for signing the legislation.

title: RaceSteward Structure Ruled Unconstitutional by State Court
description: Regulation of thoroughbred racing by officials from private organizations such as the New York Racing Association and The Jockey Club was declared unconstitutional yesterday.

title: The Late Arrival of John Gianelli
description: From the beginning, the New York Knicks had to wait for John Gianelli to arrive. As a rookie he was late in reporting to Madison Square Garden for a physical exam before attending training camp and Jimmy Wergeles, the Knicks' business manager, wondered if the 6foot10inch center somehow had become lost in the confusion of the midtown wilderness. Wergeles dispatched another member of the Knicks' stiff, Carl Martin, as a searching party of one.

title: Planeload of Vietnamese Orphans Arrives in U.S
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 2A plane carrying 57 orphaned Vietnamese children to new homes in the United States landed here tonight after leaving Saigon without official clearance.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BERGAMINIReverend Joseph B. The family of the late Rev. Joseph B. Bergami?? would like you to know that your kindness at this time is more deeply appreciated than any word of thanks can express.

title: Miller's Aim: Patch Image For Masters
description: GREENSBORO, N.C. April 2 (AP)The surprise entry of Johnny Miller provides an added dimension to the $225,000 Greater Greensboro open golf tournament starting tomorrow at the Sedgefield Country Club.

title: Kennecott Opposing F.T.C. on Peabody
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation said yesterday that the Federal Trade Commission's order extending until Oct. 1 the time within which it must file its plan for divestiture of the Peabody Coal Company was unacceptable.

title: TROOPS EXHORTED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 3The number of coastal towns reported abandoned to Communist forces without resistance by collapsing Government troops continued to swell yesterday.

title: Cowens Paces Celtics
description: BOSTON, April 2 (AP)Dave Cowens's 6point burst in the last three minutes tonight gave the Boston Celtics a 9592 N.B.A. victory over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Missile Site Operating
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI) The United States Army has announced that the nation's only antiballistic missile site is now in operation, protecting the Minuteman missiles in northeastern North Dakota. The missile system was envisioned as a nationwide network.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Trade Group Backs Shoe Maker's Claim Of Import Damages
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The International Trade Commission handed down its final decision today under the Adjustment Assistance provisions of the 1962 Trade Expansion Act.

title: Soybean Futures in Chicago Oil By as Much as 17c a Bushel
description: Soybean futures prices dropped as much as 17 cents a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, following a report that Brazil had sold some 25,000 tons of soybean oil in the world market. The deal had been, hinted at earlier in the week when traders noted that Bunge Corporation, an export firm with major Brazilian connections had been a large seller of soybean oil for July delivery. This indicated that the export firm had sold for hedging purposes against purchases of oil.

title: U.S. Sends Satellite Gear To Replace Vietnam Cable
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2 (UPI)United States military communications specialists delivered space satellite communications equipment to Vietnam today after the evident loss of the Vietnamese terminal of an underwater cable to the United States, military sources said.

title: Burmah Oil Plans to Sell 2 U.S. Units to Pay Debt
description: The Burmah Oil Company, Ltd., of London announced yesterday that it had decided to sell its two United States subsidiaries, the Burmah Oil and Gas Company and Burmah Oil Development, Inc., as part of its program to pay off its large debt guaranteed by the Bank of England, the British central bank.

title: Shakespeare Festival To Open With Hamlet
description: The New York Shakespeare Festival, which under the guidance of Joseph Papp has made it possible for more than a million people to see free Shakespeare at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park, will open its 19th consecutive summer June 18 with Hamlet. Sam Waterson will play the title role, continuing through July 19. Michael Rudman will direct.

title: THIEU CRITICIZED ALONG WITH U. S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2The South Vietnamese Senate overwhelmingly approved today a resolution calling for the formation of a government of national union to end the war.

title: 140 Survivors Reach Phnom Penh in Small Boats After Fall of 2 Towns on Lower Mekong River
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 2After a harrowing night evading mines and fire from shore batteries, 12 small river boats docked here this morning with all that the Government had managed to salvage from the loss of its last two outposts on the lower Mekong River.

title: STANDARD & POOR DROPS A RATING FOR CITY'S BONDS
description: Standard & Poor's, one of the two foremost creditrating agencies in the country, announced yesterday that it had suspended its A rating of New York City bondsan action that was seen as a severe setback in the city's battle to remain solvent.

title: JOHN E. MULHERN
description: John E. Mulhern, who retired in 1961 as treasurer of Sterling Drug, Inc., after 37 years with the concern, died Tuesday in Tucson, Ariz. He was 79 years old. A former resident of New York, he lived in Tucson since 1965.

title: A.I.D. Sets Airlift Of 2,000 Orphans From Saigon to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Some 2,000 Vietnamese orphans will be flown from Saigon to the United States in an airlift scheduled to begin in the next two days, the United States Agency for International Development announced tonight.

title: Report of Robbery Leads to Indictment For Tax Evasion
description: Joseph Valentine, a Bronx gasoline station owner, filed routine tax returns for the year 1970 through 1972 and reported an income averaging less than $10,000 a year.

title: Medich, Yankees Sparkle
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 2The sea, the sand, the condominiums and the Yankees glistened today on a brilliant afternoon along the Sun Coast.

title: Tung Piwu, Chinese Leader, 89, Dead
description: HONG KONG, Friday, April 4 China's former chief of state, Tung Piwu, a founder of the Chinese Communist party whose revolutionary career spanned more than six decades, has died in Peking at the age of 89.

title: Contract Awards
description: Two Air Force contracts, totaling $42.7million for an improved Minuteman missile warhead and 30millimeter aircraft gun, have been awarded to the General Electric Company.

title: Richard Grossenheider, 66, A Wildlife Illustrator, Dies
description: ST. LOUIS, April 3 (AP)Richard P. Grossenheider, a wildlife artist, died Tuesday in Shrewsbury when his car struck a tree. He was 66 years old.

title: Backed on Evacuation
description: WASHINGTON. April 3President Ford, at his news conference in San Diego, contended that he had authority under the 1973 War Powers Act to use troops to rescue endangered American citizens. Congressional aides who drafted the law said the legislative history of the act supported that view.

title: Ski Conditions
description: (Reports are supplied by resort owners.)

title: PRESIDENT URGES CONGRESS IMPOSE OWN BUDGET CURB
description: WASHINGTON, April 3President Ford, warning of a possible resurgence of doubledigit inflation, asked Congress today to put the new budget control law into effect a year early so it could impose on itself a spending ceiling for the forthcoming fiscal year.

title: Woman to Get Food Job After Battle Over Bias
description: A woman's place, the City Commission on Human Rights said yesterday is in the kitchen

title: Yankees Down Mets and Take Series After Naming Medich for Opening Day
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 3George (Doc) Medich, the lanky medical student, and not Catfish Hunter, the wealthy farmer, will have the honor of being the Yankees' openingday pitcher in Cleveland on Tuesday. Bill Virdon, the manager, mate that announcement today in advance of the team's final game here this year, one at night against the Mets, and the breaking up of the spring training camp.

title: President Upholds The Warren Report On Oswald's Guilt
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 President Ford told newsmen today that he had seen no evidence that would contradiet the Warren Commission's conclusion that Lee Harvey Oswald was President Kennedy's assassin.

title: Cambodians Reinforcing Defenses of Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Friday, April 4The Cambodian command has started moving reinforcements to the southern flank of this beseiged capital in, preparation for an increase in pressure by the Communistled insurgents expected in a matter of days.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of 3 million common shares of the Gulf States Utilities Company, at $12 a share, was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc. Net proceeds from this offering, as well as those from a scheduled $40million bond offering, would be used to pay a portion of outstanding shortterm notes, the company had said.

title: The Malpractice Crisis
description: Physicians and hospitals are taken so much for granted in the United States that a most serious threat to the present availability of medical care is passing almost unnoticed by the general public. That threat is embodied in the malpractice crisis, which has assumed national proportions.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, April 3 (UPI)The dollar turned upward on all European money markets today, a trend that according to dealers was aided by repeated American Government predictions that domestic interest rates may rise. Gold dropped $1.25 an ounce to close at $176 in both Zurich and London.

title: HighPriced Power
description: Consolidated Edison's application for a new increase of 21.7 per cent in electric rates on top of the 22.3 per cent increase approved just five months ago is a stunning blow to the pocketbooks of New Yorkers and to the whole metropolitan economy.

title: Fischer Loses Chess Title To Russian, 23, by Default
description: Bobby Fischer, who won, the world chess championship in 1972. with a display of brilliance over the board and shenanigans away from it, let his clock run out yesterday and lost his crown without even lifting a pawn to defend it.

title: People in Sports
description: Fred Stolle, who took orders from Billie Jean King when she was the playercoach of the Philadelphia Freedoms, the World Tennis team entry last season, will be telling her what to do this year. The 36yearold Stolle was named playercoach of the New York Sets yesterday. The Sets has acquired Mrs. King earlier. Store, a native of Australia, who recently moved to Dallas, is expected to play doubles or mixed doubles for the Sets.

title: LEVI TELLS OF LAG ON HOOVER FILES
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Attorney General Edward H. Levi indicated today that the existence of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's secret files on Presidents and members of Congress was not made known to the Justice Department until shortly before he took office last Feb. 7.

title: A Good Buy
description: Moody's Investors Service has thrown a life buoy to a floundering city, with its decision to maintain an A rating for New York municipal bonds. Moody's insistence that city securities remain a good buy should help ease the shock of a previous decision by Standard & Poor's, the other leading creditrating agency, to suspend its A evaluation of the city's bonds.

title: City's Big Apple Image Polished for Democratic Convention Bid
description: WASHINGTON, April 3New Yorkers, in an unblushing burst of boosterism, made an allout appeal here today for the Democratic National Convention next summer.

title: Ali to Meet Lyle May 16; Home TV Gets Title Fight
description: Muhammad Ali, George Foreman and Joe Frazier all started swinging promotional punches yesterday as boxing reached for attention with a flurry of announcements.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: National Review Seeks Funds, Calling '74 Its 'Toughest Year
description: National Review, the fortnightly of conservative opinion, is having financial troubles once again.

title: 1976 Finals Sold Out
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 3 (UPI)Less than a week after completion of this year's finals, the 1976 National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championships scheduled here next March 2729 have been sold out. A spokesman for the Spectrum, where the finals will be played, said today the approximately 18,000 seats available were sold out and no more mail orders would be accepted.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up 4%
description: WASHINGTON, April 3The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.06billion, up 9 per cent from the year earlier $969million. Total retail store sales were about $10.49billion, up 4 per cent from last year's $10.13billion.

title: More Power for Council Urged in Charter Study
description: The State Charter Revision Commission recommended yesterday the continuation of a strongMayor form of government for the city, but urged that the City Council be given more power to advise and consent on the restructuring of municipal agencies and on appointments to important boards or commissions.

title: College Results
About Real Estate
description: EDISON, N.J.  Joseph Goldman has done a little building in his day.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE GOOD EARTH Now is the time to gravitate toward greenery and blossoms, and the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx has both. Today through Sunday, in its first rhododendron airlift, the Garden's conservatory will be displaying 100 cut blooms flown from Scotland. The scarlet, pink and white blossoms, best known here in the moderate climates and acid soils of eastern America, are the pride and joy of Brodick Castle, a National Trust edifice on the isle of Arran off the southwest coast of Scotland, which has exported the rhododendrons from its famed 250yearold garden.

title: Champlain Fights to Keep Its A. & P.
description: CHAMPLAIN, N. Y.  The local A. & P. is on the chopping block as one of the 1,250 stores the chain plans to close this year, and the people of this tiny rural village nudged against Canada are up in arms about it.

title: LESLIE A. WHITE, ANTHROPOLOGIST
description: Prof. Leslie A. White, former chairman of the anthropology department at the University of Michigan, died at Lone Pine, Calif., on Monday. He was 75 years old.

title: Pillsbury Buying Weight Watchers
description: The Pillsbury Company, makers of a wide range of food products, announced yesterday that it was acquiring Weight Watchers International, Inc., a company that franchises and operates classes that aim at helping people curb their appetites and reduce waistlines. Under terms of the tentative agreement, shareholders in Weight Watchers would receive 795,000 shares of Pillsbury common stock, valued at a total of $43million, baSed on Pillsbury stock's closing price of 54 yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Ohio Town That Lost 7 Men in Vietnam Now Worries More About Economy
description: BEALLSVILLE, Ohio, April 2Beallsville has perhaps more right than most places to speak its mind about what's happening in Vietnam.

title: Kentucky GrantinAid Accepted by Willoughby
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., April 3Three days after failing to capture college basketball's biggest prize, the University of Kentucky came up with a large consolation today when it signed Bill Willoughby of Dwight Morrow High School to a grantinaid agreement.

title: PRICE INDEX DOWN 4TH MONTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, April 3In a further sign of abating inflation, the Government's wholesale price index declined in March for the fourth consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Boston Gtobe Raises Price
description: BOSTON, April 3 (AP)The Boston Globe will raise its price to 20 cents a copy on Monday. In announceing the increase today the newspaper said dramatic increases principally in the price of newsprint, ink and gasoline.

title: Mary Britton Miller Dies at 91; Wrote Novels as Isabel Bolton
description: Mary Britton Miller, a poet who became a novelist after her 60th birthday, died yesterday at the DeWitt Nursing Home at 211 East 79th Street after a long illness. She was 91 years old.

title: Strong Winds Display Venturi Effect Here
description: A number of New Yorkers learned last night  sometimes to their dismayof an effect defined two centuries ago by an Italian physicist named G. B. Venturi.

title: NEPHEW OF FRANCO JOINS IN PROTESTS
description: MADRID, April 3 (UPI)A member of Generalissimo Francisco Franco's family joined the nationwide protests today against the lack of political freedom in Spain.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC DECLINE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the OvertheCounter market fell yesterday in desultory activity.

title: A Primer For Capitol Hill
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger want to stop Congress from interfering in the making of foreign policy.

title: Princeton Teacher Accused of Shooting Head of Day School
description: A 41yearold language teacher at the Princeton (N.J.) Day School, was accused yesterday of shooting and slightly wounding the school's headmaster Wednesday afternoon after being told that his contract would not be renewed in the fall.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 1975

title: PRICES FALL LIMIT FOR SOYBEAN OIL
description: Soybean oil futures set the pace for the grain markets in Chicago yesterday when they dropped the daily limit of a cent a pound, to close at 28.22 cents for May delivery on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Death Camp Survivors Dead
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 3 (UPI)A 66yearold rethree, who survived the Nazis' World War H Auschwitz death camp, fatally shot his wife, a survivor of the BergenBelsen concentration camp, and then killed himself, the police said yesterday. The victims were David Schneider and his wife Irene, 50.

title: Tensions Grow in Saigon; New Coup Plot Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 4Little military action was reported yesterday, but with tension increasing in Saigon over the fate of the remaining territory in South Vietnamese Government hands, the Interior Ministry announced that a new plot to overthrow the Government had been uncovered and a number of people arrested.

title: BUGS DESCRIBED BY EXDETECTIVE
description: TRENTON, April 3A former New Jersey state police detective said today that he had been ordered to find a way to break into a Paterson night club so an electronic bug could be planted there and that a false affidavit bearing his name had been used to obtain a court order for a wiretap in the same investigation.

title: Champlain Fights to Keep Its A. & P.
description: CHAMPLAIN, N. Y.  The local A. & P. is on the chopping block as one of the 1,250 stores the chain plans to close this year, and the people of this tiny rural village nudged against Canada are up in arms about it.

title: Matteo Dances Capture Folk Traditions
description: The Matteo Ethno American Dance Theater is presenting a new work, America Has Many Facesa Celebration of America's International Heritage in Dance and Music, at the Riverside Church Theater through Sunday.

title: Art to Powder a Nose By
description: The attention focused yesterday on a mural by Stuart Davis in a men's smoking lounge of the Radio City Music Hall should not lead women to think that the Music Hall has scanted on restroom art for them. The Davis mural, now removed from the lounge and given to the Museum of Modern Art, has its counterpart in a sprawling mural called The History of Cosmetics, painted by Witold Gordon in 1932.

title: SMUGGLING PLOT LAID TO AUSTRIAN
description: A wealthy Austrian businessman accused of attempting to smuggle a sophisticated gunsight camera system for fighter planes out of the country Wednesday night was arraigned in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of violating the Munitions Control Act.

title: Pentagon Expects Drive To Isolate Saigon Region
description: Senior Defense Department officials say they expect the North Vietnamese to try to isolate Saigon by mounting offensives into the Mekong Delta land toward Vung Tau on the coast.

title: Bridge :
description: A sciencefiction episode at the start of the Spring Nationals in Hawaii last month was reminiscent, in a minor way, of The Time Machine of H. G. Wells.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Is Off
description: WASHINGTON, April 3The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week, which included the Good Friday holiday, totaled an estimated 13.8 billion tonmiles, 20.1 per cent below the corresponding non  holiday week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 415,745 cars, 21.5 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 29 cent below last year.

title: 2,600 Workers Recalled By McDonnell Douglas
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.. April 3 (Reuters)  The McDonnell Douglas Corporation announced today the recall of 2,600 workers at its Douglas aircraft plant here starting Monday.

title: Four Die in Collision
description: SUTTON, Mass., April 3 (AP) Three young Rhode Island men and a young woman were killed today and a fourth young woman was critically, injured when the car in which they were riding collided with a trailer truck on State Route 146. One of the dead men was identified as David R. Brown of Greenville, the driver of the car. Identifications of the other victims were withheld until their families could be notified.

title: Agreement Signed For an Association Of IronOre Nations
description: GENEVA, April 3  An agreement for the formation of an association of ironore exporting countries was signed today by delegates of 11 nations. The association, which is to be a purely consultative agency, will be established as soon as seven nations have ratified it.

title: Knicks Lose to Cavs, Miss Chance to Clinch
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, April 3 Before the largest crowd ever to witness a National Basketball Association game, the Cleveland Cavaliers beat the New York Knicks tonight, 10095. Thus the Cays held off elimination from the playoffs and made it extremely dubious that the Knicks would qualify.

title: CONNALLY PAYOFF ALLEGED AT TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Jake Jacobsen, a former dairy industry lawyer, testified here today that he gave John B. Connally a $10,000 gratuity in 1971 and joined the former Secretary of the Treasury two years later in a plan meant to cover up the payoff.

title: Burke to Teach a Week As Practical Experience
description: TRENTON, April 3 (AP)The State Education Commissioner, Dr. Fred G. Burke, thinks administrators should have practical experience, so he is going to spend a week teaching history and black studies at Trenton High School.

title: TV News Has ShowBusiness Side
description: Few things upset television news executives more than having a news broadcast referred to as a news show. They feel that the label lacks dignity, that it smacks too strongly of show business. There is only one difficulty: TV news, no matter how lofty its pronounced aims, is rarely able to escape the clutches of show business considerations.

title: VERMONT ASSEMBLY GETS APLANT ROLE
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., April 3 (AP)Gov. Thomas P. Salmon signed into law today a bill giving the Vermont General Assembly the final decision over construction of nuclear power plants in the state.

title: First Orphans Arrive to Begin a New Life
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 3Their papers read orphan boy and orphan girl, and there were 52 of them, silent children in sandals and Tshirts.

title: The Pop Life
description: Jerry Garcia, best known as the lead guitarist for the Grateful Dead, is in the New York area for a number of performances in the next few days.

title: Where Death Delights Mystery Buffs
description: Meet me at the morgue read the invitation from Murder Ink, the bookshop on the Upper West Side that specializes in literary mayhem in any direction.

title: Goolagong Erratic Winner
description: LOS ANGELES, April 3Happygolucky Evonne Goolagong, trailing by a service break in each set, produced some superb shotmaking to win from Olga Morozova, 75, 63, as the top four seeded players advanced in the $150,000 Virginia Slims tourney at the Sports Arena last night.

title: EARNINGS DECLINE AT CARTER HAWLEY
description: Carter Hawley Hale Stores, Inc., which operates the Bergdorf Goodman and NiemanMarcus specialty stores in its chain, reported yesterday a profit drop for the quarter and fiscal year ended Feb. 1.

title: Students Stage Violent Protests in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 3 Students at three universities here staged violent demonstrations today, demanding that the Government allow campus protesters recently freed from prison to be readmitted to schools.

title: Storm Reaches East Coast
description: Hurricane winds roared through Atlantic Coast states from North Carolina to New England yesterday, leaving at least five dead, causing heavy property damage, uprooting trees and snapping power lines.

title: Arafat Says Israel Possesses Nuclear Arms and Plans War
description: DOHA, Qatar, April 3 (Reuters)Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, said today that he had conclusive evidence Israel had at least three nuclear weapons.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Pick up your menu at the House of Tu, a new Chinese restaurant at 322324 East 44th Street, and you flounder in what amounts to an inexhaustible list of choices. I counted 146 dishes, and on the basis of the ones we triedassorted hot appetizers and six entrees I'd like to sample them all Pending completion of that life work, I'd say the restaurant could make a go of it on the basis of a single dish, listed simply as Crisp Fish at $5.95.

title: COAST GROUP BLENDS JAZZ,SOUL AND BLUES
description: Power is certainly something that Tower of Power possesses as three saxophones, two trumpets, organ and rhythm lumber clown music's highway, picking pieces and styles from here and there. Thus, in one number at the Bottom Line on Tuesday the group managed to echo a blues band of the nineteenforties, a honking jazz tenor saxophone style of the fifties and a soul group of the sixties, as well as adding a dash of Blood. Sweat and Tears. No musical stone was left unturned by this 10piece San Francisco group, and any number of musical clichs were also paraded with such enthusiasm as to blind one to their familiarity.

title: SHELL CANADA SETS TAR SANDS PLANT
description: OTTAWA, April 3 (Reuters)Shell Canada, Ltd., said today it hoped to build a synthetic oil plant on the Alberta tar

title: Books of The Times
description: It's sometimes hard to know In the interminable arguments about multinational corporations these last few years whether the topic under discussion is one novel form of business organization or rather the whole condition of capitalism in the later decades of the 20th century.

title: A.B.A. East FirstPlace Battle
Theater: Period Classic
description: The opening on Broadway in 1930 of Once in a Lifetime is the curtain of Moss Hart's Act One and the beginning of Mr. Hart's career and his long, eventful collaboration with George S. Kaufman. To see Once in a Lifetime in the ETC Theater Company production is to be reminded, for one thing, of the goodnatured quality of the KaufmanHart humor. There is no meanness at most there is acerbityin this spoof of Hollywood at the turning point.

title: THEY PLAN TO ASK NEW DEFENSE VOW
description: TOKYO, April 3Senior Japanese officials said today that they were disturbed and divided by the failure of the United States to help South Vietnam and Cambodia in their crises.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Tips on Shad
description: Although the opening of the trout season attracts a great deal more attention, light tackle anglers in the Northeast should not forget the shimmering, prolific, pollutiontolerant and athletic shad, which, shortly before the joys of the Fifth Month are upon us, will be rushing up such rivers as the Delaware and the Connecticut to spawn.

title: Notes on People
description: After 20 years at Sutton Place, his estate in Surrey, England, J. Paul Getty is going to live at his Malibu estate on the California coast north of Los Angeles. The 82yearold oil multimillionaire told a British Broadcasting Corporation interviewer yesterday that he had always intended to return to his own country in his declining years. Observers noted that the British Government  which previously taxed Mr. Getty only on his relatively modest British profitsrecently decided to tax all residents, including foreigners, on their worldwide earnings.

title: PRESIDENT URGES CONGRESS IMPOSE OWN BUDGET CURB
description: WASHINGTON, April 3President Ford, warning of a possible resurgence of doubledigit inflation, asked Congress today to put the new budget control law into effect a year early so it could impose on itself a spending ceiling for the forthcoming fiscal year.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Buffalo Inquiry Pressed
Town's Business District Is Sealed Off After a Tank Car Carrying Benzene Is Derailed
description: HIGH BRIDGE, April 3The business district of this rural Hunterdon County town was sealed off and a dozen families were evacuated from their homes today after a Jersey Central tank car carrying 21,000 gallons of benzene jumped the tracks and the toxic and explosive liquid began leaking onto the roadbed near the center of town.

title: Phil The Bill In Pace Event
description: WESTBURY, L. I., April 3 By a mere matter of $278, Norman Dauplaise will have a shot at the Sagamore Hill Pace Series for 3yearolds, which starts at Roosevelt Raceway tomorrow night. The race is for horses that have not won $25,000 and Phil The Bill, whom Norman Dauplaise will drive, has fallen short of that mark with earnings of $24,722.

title: A City Where There Is Help for the Criminal's Helpless Victim
description: ST. LOUISBack in 1972, Carol Vittert, a wealthy young suburban housewife with both a social conscience and time on her hands, decided she wanted to do something to help people. Just what, she didn't knowexcept that she wanted it to be in an area where nothing had really been done before.

title: N.F.L. Players Cite Loss From Strike
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (AP)The 42day strike by the National Football League Players Association last summer cost the union from $400,000 to $500,000 and left a deficit of about $200,000 for the fiscal period ended last Nov. 30, Ed Garvey, executive director, said today.

title: STATE TO ADVANCE FUNDS TO THE CITY TO PAY APRIL BILLS
description: Governor Carey, with a smiling Mayor Beame standing beside him, said yesterday afternoon that the state would advance the city money from the state budget to ease its critical April cashflow predicament.

title: Potatoes on L.I. Are a Gamble for Growers
description: WATER MILL, L.I., April 3Farming is the biggest gamble this side of Las Vegas, Tom Halsey said. But around this time of year, you start being jumpy.

title: FORD CALLS UPON ALLIES NOT TO MISTAKE VIETNAM. AS SIGN OF U.S. WEAKNESS
description: SAN DIEGO April 3President Ford declared here today that neither the friends nor the adversaries of the United States should interpret the losses in South Vietnam as a sign that American commitments would not be honored anywhere in the world.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, April 3, 1975

title: British Golf Squad Helped by Sponsor
description: LONDON, April 3 (AP) Britain's golf stars will each be paid $2,400 for playing against the United States in the Ryder Cup, the British Professional Golfers' Association said today. In the last Ryder Cup match two years ago, the British team received $840 each.

title: CHAMBERLIN TO HEAD CAPITAL'S PUBLIC TV
description: Ward B. Chamberlin has resigned as senior vice president of the Public Broadcasting Service to become president of WETA in Washington, which operates public stations WETATV and WETAFM and the National Public Affairs Center for Television (NPACT).

title: Aqueduct Jockeys
Coast Study Center Split By Threat of Insolvency
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., April 2Having spent the last 16 years battling for the preservation of democratic ideals with ideas hurled from the intellectual ramparts, the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions now faces the imminent threat of its own demise.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The American Symphony Orchestra will perform at a benefit featuring the expatriate Soviet ballet stars Galina and Valery Panov, the Garden State Arts Center announced yesterday. The center said the Eliot Feld ballet would also perform and Seymour Lipkin would conduct the orchestra at the July 2 performance, which will benefit the center's ethnic and cultural events series.

title: Jury Starts Deliberations in the Case Of 2 Accused in Death of Attica Guard
description: BUFFALO, April 3The jury in the Attica murder trial began its deliberations here this afternoon after Justice Gilbert H. King spelled out the charges to be considered in the case of the two defendants, John Hill and Charles Joseph Pernasilice.

title: Article 1  No Title
Rangers' Scoring
description: FIRST PERIOD1, Rangers, Ratelle (35), 0:15. 2, Philadelphia, Clarke 126) (Harris, Leach); 11:27. PenaltiesDupont (0:53); Jim Watson, maiorminor (4:19); Schultz, maiorminor (8:03); Middleton, maior (8:03); Lonsherry, maim (15:15); Stem. kowski, major (15:15); Dupont (12:26); Clarke, major (20:00); Sanderson, major (20:00); Dornhoefer, misconduct (20:00).

title: Dr. Harry H. Shilkret Dies; Allergist and Musician, 77
description: Dr. Harry H. Shilkret, a retired specialist in internal medicine and allergy, who had also been a musician, died here Wednesday. He was 77 years old.

title: 2d Officer Slain by Sniper Is Buried
description: LUMBERTON, April 3 (UPI) The flagdraped coffin of a Hainesport patrolman slain during a Mount Holly shootout with an alleged sniper, was accompanied on a threemile motorcar procession today by more than 1,300 police officers.

title: Transit Strike Curb Sought
description: MEDIA, Pa., April 3 (AP) A hearing is scheduled tomorrow on a request to force striking transit operators back to their jobs on the Red Arrow line, which runs buses and trolleys into Philadelphia's western suburbs. The walkout by 350 members of the United Transport Workers is affecting 35,000 commuters in Delaware, Montgomery and Chester Counties.

title: Marijuana Seized on Boat
description: MIAMI, April 3 (AP)  Six men were arrested and about two tons of marijuna seized when a boat from Portsmouth, N. H., was stopped in the Atlantic Ocean about 450 miles southeast of Miami, Coast Guard officials says. The 60foot vessel, the Rayono, was boarded Sunday during a routine patrol between Cuba and Haiti, a Coast Guard spokesman said last night.

title: CONNALLY PAYOFF ALLEGED AT TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Jake Jacobsen, a former dairy industry lawyer, testified here today that he gave John B. Connally a $10,000 gratuity in 1971 and joined the former Secretary of the Treasury two years later in a plan meant to cover up the payoff.

title: Peyser Severs All Ties To Conservative Party
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Peter A Peyser, a Westchester County Republican Representative who had Conservative party support when he was reelected last year, has severed whatever ties he had with that party and tartly rebuked the Young Americans for Freedom, a conservative organization.

title: Nets' Box Score
description: minMinutes played. fgmField goals made. fgaField goals ??tempted. ftmFree throws made. ftaFree throws attempted. rebRebounds. aAssisls. ptPersonal fouls. ptsTotal points.

title: Demand for Bank Loans Reported Still Sluggish
description: Growth in the nation's money supply continued to pick up last week while corporate demand for bank loans remained unseasonally sluggish, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Sheldon Gold Is Named Head of Hurok Concerts
description: Sheldon Gold has been appointed president of Hurok Concerts, it was announced yesterday. He had been an executive vice president, along with Walter Prude and George Perper. They have been running the organization since the death of Sol Hurok in March, 1974.

title: Snow in April Sends Skiers Northward
description: Midwinter conditions were reported by most of Vermont's ski  area operators yesterday as the biggest snowstorm of the season struck many regions in that state.

title: Lockheed Is Seeking Delay In Filing Its Annual Report
description: BURBANK, Calif., Arpil 3 (UPI)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation today asked the Securities and Exchange Commission for a 30day delay to April 29 for filing its certified 1974 financial results. The company made a similar request to the New York Stock Exchange.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 4, 1975

title: Phone Number Listed For Refugee Adoption
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 3 (UPI)The Red Cross has announced that the United States Agency for International Development has established a tollfree telephone number for American citizens seeking adoption information in the event that homeless children are airlifted from South Vietnam.

title: Stage: Once in a Lifetime at the ETC
description: The opening on Broadway in 1930 of Once in a Lifetime is the curtain of Moss Hart's Act One and the beginning of Mr. Hart's career and his long, eventful collaboration with George S. Kaufman. To see Once in a

title: LibraryMuseum Hums With Activity
description: Tucked away in the northwest corner of Lincoln Center is a building so modest in appearance that it seems more an appendage to the Vivian Beaumont Theater or the Metropolitan Opera House than an independent enterprise.

title: Jersey City Sues P.U.C. on Authority Over Incinerators
description: NEWARK, April 3 (UPI)Jersey City challenged the Jurisdiction of the Board of Public Utilities Commissioners over its Incinerator Authority in a suit filed here today.

title: U.S. Woman Doctor Leaves Vietnam After 16 Years
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 3 (AP)Dr. Patricia M. Smith, forced to abandon her hospital for montagnards in the Central Highlands after 16 years, left South Vietnam today for Seattle. She could no longer find refugees to treat.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 2.7 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 203.5 from 200.8 last week

title: OPEC FAVORS END OF DOLLAR FOR OIL
description: VIENNA, April 3 (Reuters)Economic experts from oilexporting countries today decided to recommend that the dollar no longer be used as the basis for calculating petroleum prices, informed sources said here.

title: EDWARD E. FISCHER
Market Place
description: It's a fairly common lament in a business conducted by, telephone. The customer calls a broker and gives instructions and later learns that the instructions have not been carried out.

title: Playoff For Nets, Colonels
description: NORFOLK, Va., April 3 (AP)Julius Erving, Brian Taylor and Wendell Ladner led a New York comeback from a 16point deficit in the fourth period tonight and the Nets pulled out a 116111 American Basketball Association victory over the Virginia Squires in overtime.

title: Textile Group Warned on Isolationism
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., April 3Frederick B. Dent, President Ford's new Special Representative for Trade Negotiations, warned here today that any return to trade isolationism will reduce raw materials and supplies and tend to disrupt Government action to restore economic stability at home.

title: F.T.C. to Approve Cash Refund Plan By Retail Stores
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission announced today it intended to accept' a compromise settlement under which four department store chains will pay back some of the money they were accused of taking from customers' charge account balances.

title: Big Board Seat Is Sold
British Football
description: ENGLSH LEAGUE

title: Hicks & Greist Gets Both Tea and Coffee
description: Hicks & Greist, a New York agency with $23million in billings and a lot of strength in the grocery area, has been named to handle Tetley tea and Martinson coffee, two regional brands with combined billings of $1.5million.

title: A Vietnamese Salvage
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 3 (UPI)Among the thousands of refugees and soldiers entering the Saigon area today was a woman from Da Nang carrying a 21inch television set, all she had managed to save.

title: Other Chains Gain
description: March sales at Sears, Roebuck & Co., Chicago, the country's leading retailer, declined 2.9 per cent from the year before in its sharpest sales reversal in more tan 15 years

title: About New York
description: In 1942 Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia pushed a bill through the City Council prohibiting pinball machines. He said they were gambling devices that snared hardearned nickels and dimes for the benefit of the underworld. Schoolboys, he declared melodramatically, were being started on the road to crime by stealing money from their mothers' pocketbooks to play the game.

title: MARY URE DEAD; ACTRESS WAS 42
description: Mary Ure, a leading British stage and screen actress who won her first critical acclaim for Look Back in Anger in 1957 and an Academy Award nomination in 1961, died in London yesterday ony hours after opening a run in a new play, The Exorcism. She was 42 years old.

title: Moody's Keeps A Rating In Endorsing City's Bonds
description: In an endorsement of New York City's credit status yesterday, Moody's Investors Service said it would stand by its A rating of city bondsone day after its competitor, Standard & Poor's Corporation, suspended its A rating on the bonds.

title: Weiskopf Leads Windy Golf on 64
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., April 3 (AP)Tom Weiskopf mastered biting cold and sometimes dangerous winds with a sevenunderpar 64 and took a threestroke lead today in the first round of the $225,000 greater Greensboro open golf tournament.

title: Antiquarians Revel In Variety and Price At Plaza Book Fair
description: The 1975 International Antiquarian Book Fair, which opened ed with a preview Wednesday evening at the Plaza and will continue there through Saturday, sounded yesterday more like a gathering for friends than a meeting of dealers and buyers.

title: End of FairTrade Laws Sought on Many Fronts
description: The nation's fairtrade laws, which were devised during the Depression as a way to protect leading brandname manufacturers, small businesses and mom and pop stores from pricecutting competition, are now under attack as unfair to consumers and as inflationary.

title: Article 3  No Title
ELLEN KLEIN DANCES IN A CHANGED STYLE
description: Ellen Klein used to favor clown makeup, costumeparty clothes, lots of performers and glittery Minnie Mouse shoes for her dances.
