In her first public concert in several years, Wednesday evening at the Paula Cooper Gallery, she danced alone, abandoned motley for casual street clothes and changed the tone of her dancing from frenzied to floating.

title: A Correction
STATE TO ADVANCE FUNDS TO THE CITY TO PAY APRIL BILLS
description: Governor Carey, with a smiling Mayor Beame standing beside him, said yesterday afternoon that the state would advance the city money from the state budget to ease its critical April cashflow predicament.

title: Market Summary
description: Thursday, April 3, 1975

title: Jersey NursingHome Rates Based on New York's
description: TRENTON, April 3  The State Commission of Investigation said today that it had established that the reimbursement schedules covering Medicaid payments to nursing homes in both New Jersey and New York were based on inflated figures provided by nursinghome operators in the area.

title: London Magazine Closes
description: LONDON, April 3 (UPI)Value Today, a magazine designed to help people combat inflation, is ceasing publication after only six issues, a spokesman said today. Increasing costs were given as the reason.

title: OFFICIALS EXPRESS DOUBT ON U.S. HELP
description: WASHINGTON, April 3President Ford declared today that the United States has been doing and will continue to do its utmost to help the refugees in South Vietnam. But officials here expressed doubt that the Administration's efforts would markedly improve a deteriorating situation.

title: MIMI HINES OFFERS SONGS AND COMEDY
description: Mind Hines, who has moved into the Grand Finale, at 210 West 70th Street, is letting herself fall into an entertainment limbo by taking herself too seriously as a singer and too lightly as a comedian.

title: Why City Fell $10 Million Short on PayrollTrims Goal
description: In a series of moves from November through March to reduce personnel costs, the city has cut $104.8million, according to the Bureau of the Budget, falling $10million short of the goal set by Mayor Beanie for that period.

title: F.A.A. to Overlook Use Of Nonregulation Plane
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI)The Federal Aviation Administration consideredand rejectedthe possibility of filing charges against World Airways for using a cargo plane in its mercy flight of 55 South Vietnamese orphans to the United States, it was learned today.

title: Article 4  No Title
Relief Units Look to Future in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 3The private relief agencies, reviewing their operations here, have begun efforts to carry on if a government is formed by the Communisted insurgents.

title: Newsgirl's Killer Sentenced
description: DETROIT, April 3 (AP)A Highland Park man was sentenced yesterday to serve seven to 21 years in prison for killing a 12yearold newsgirl, who he said he thought was a hired killer. Rurolph Acosta 24 years old, admitted during his trial that he killed Edith Perchman in early morning darkness last August as she delivered his morning paper. He said he believed she was a hit man sent to kill him.

title: Red Smith
description: Jack Nicklaus hit into the water on the 18th hole of Miami's Doral course, took a doublebogey 6 and still finished four under par with 68. This was three weeks ago the opening round of the DoralEastern open, the nexttolast tournament he would play before the Masters. Up to that point he had done nothing much on the winter tour, but this day he attacked the course they call the Blue Monster with the controlled fury sometimes seen in a good fighter when he reaches the fine edge of fitness just before a title bout. In the clubhouse a man said to him: Something I've been wondering about. What is the best way for Jack Nicklaus to get ready for the Masters? Not necessarily the best way for Gary Player or Arnold Palmer or Johnny Miller, but the best way for Jack Nicklaus?

title: Girl Scout Toothbrush Stirs F.D.A. Warning
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration announced today the recall of 1,601 Girl Scout toothbrushes that it said have handles that can break, causing possible injuries to the user.

title: City's Big Apple Image Polished for Democratic Convention Bid
description: WASHINGTON, April 3New Yorkers, in an unblushing burst of boosterism, made an allout appeal here today for the Democratic National Convention next summer.

title: DepressionLevel Prices Hit Potato Farmers
description: Back in the Depression years of the nineteenthirties, Eddie Cantor sang that potatoes are cheaper... tomatoes are cheaper.. now's the time to fall in love.

title: Dr. Herschel Walker Dies; Did Relief Work in Europe
description: Dr. Herschel Carey Walker, a retired surgeon who took a leading part in relief work in Europe after World War I, died here Monday. He was 84 years old and lived at 510 Park Avenue.

title: Number of Persons Getting Jobless Pay Drops in 31 States
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) Thirtyone states reported decreases in the number of persons receiving regular unemployment insurance benefits in the the week ending March 15, the Labor Department said today.

title: Transcript of President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Following is a transcript of President Ford's broadcast news conference from San Diego yesterday afternoon, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Safety Panel Staff Opposes Warning on Aerosols
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) The staff of the Consumer Product Safety Commission has concluded that there is not enough evidence against aerosol sprays for the agency to warn Americans to stop using them.

title: Spending Rules at U. of Massachusetts Revised After Alleged Mismanagement
description: AMHERST, Mass., April 3 (AP)Strict new rules governing spending at the University of Massachusetts have been issued by Robert C. Wood, president of the university.

title: Trade Practices of Schlitz Are Studied by Grand Jury
description: MILWAUKEE, April (AP) Possible unfair trade practices by the Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company in the distribution of its beer are reportedly under investigation by a Federal grand jury here.

title: C.I.A. Asked Tax Assessor's Aid on Ship
description: LOS ANGELES, April 3The Los Angeles County tax assessor said today that four men purportedly representing the Central Intelligence Agency tried to enlist his aid in covering up the mission of the Glomar Explorer, the vessel built by Howard R. Hughes for the C.I.A.

title: Not Victory But at Least Pity
description: The most significant fact that came out of President Ford's press conference on the tragedy of Southeast Asia is that the Saigon Government decided to abandon twothirds of the country to the North Vietnamese troops without even informing the United States of this decision in advance.

title: Yields of Some N. Y. Bonds Rise to a Record
description: Yields of some New York City bonds rose to record levels yesterday in light, nervous trading as a result of the suspension of the city's A rating by Standard & Poor's. Moving down by about  point in price, certain of these bonds yielded around 10 per cent or approximately the same peak levels reached in midDecember when the City suffered from a rash of actverse publicity and budget problems.

title: Hope Brown Acquavella Is Married
description: Hope Brown Acquavella and Edward B. Perlberg were married at noon yesterday. Judge Arthur E. Blyn of the New York Civil Court performed the ceremony here at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis H. Lapham, friends of the bride and bridegroom.

title: FORD CALLS UPON ALLIES NOT TO MISTAKE VIETNAM AS SIGN OF U.S. WEAKNESS
description: SAN DIEGO, April 3President Ford declared here today that neither the friends nor the adversaries of the United States should interpret the losses in South Vietnam as a sign that American commitments would not be honored anywhere in the world.

title: CAMBODIAN PREMIER ASKS NEGOTIATIONS
description: TAMPAKSIRING, Indonesia, April 3 (Reuters)  Premier Long Boret of Cambodia called on leaders of the insurgents tonight to hold peace negotiations.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: New Books Today
description: FICTION

title: ...and the U.N.'s Mission
description: Secretary General Waldheim has refused to involve the United Nations in the very controversial political problem of trying to evacuate refugees from territory occupied by the North Vietnamese. Admittedly, the effort to separate such an evacuation from continuing military action is made most difficult by the intermingling of soldiers with civilians in the mass of fleeing and displaced persons.

title: Eastbound Snowstorm Paralyzes Upper Middle West
description: A storm system dumped more than a foot of snow in some parts of the upper Midwest, contributing to 25 deaths in the Chicago area, as spreading rain and more snow churned eastward yesterday.

title: CORRECTION
CORRECTION
PRICE INDEX DOWN 4TH MONTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, April 3In a further sign of abating inflation, the Government's wholesale price index declined in March for the fourth consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Chinese Assert U.S. Violated Agreement By Barring a Song
description: HONG KONG, April 3China accused the United States today of interference in her internal affairs by objecting to a Chinese troupe's intention to sing a work about Taiwan. As a result of the objection, the visit of the troupe to the United States was canceled.

title: Otto Soglow, Cartoonist, Dies; Creator of Little King Was 74
description: Otto Soglow, the cartoonist who created The Little King and other characters, was found dead yesterday in his apartment at 330 West 72d Street. Death was ascribed to emphysema or a heart attack. He was 74 years old.

title: 6 Divisions' Broken Remnants Land at a Port Close to Saigon
description: VUNG TAU, South Vietnam, April 3Shattered, leaderless remnants of six South Vietnamese divisions from the northern twothirds of the country straggled ashore today at this small port.

title: U.S.Rumanian Trade Pact
description: VIENNA, April 3 (AP)The United States and Rumania signed a trade agreement in Bucharest yesterday, the United States Embassy in the Rumanian capital said today.

title: Advertising
description: Cleon T. (Budd) Knapp, a 37yearold Los Angeles magazine publisher who has been eminently successful in repositioning one magazine, is about to try his hand again.

title: Mr. Ford's Confusion
description: President Ford set out in the right direction when he confined his opening statement at yesterday's news conference to South Vietnam's great human tragedy. Americans will eagerly support his humanitarian proposals aimed at aiding the mass of the displaced and at finding homes for thousands of children orphaned by the war.

title: Xerox and Litton Settle Patent and Antitrust Suit
description: STAMFORD, Conn., April 3 (UPI)The Xerox Corporation said today it had settled its patent and antitrust litigation with Litton Industries. ?? over copying and Xray machines. The litigation involved three suits pending in the Federal Court in Connecticut.

title: SUSPECT IS SEIZED IN CITY BURGLARIES
description: A young man who the police said had been specializing for about two years in burglaries of middleclass and affluent homes in the St. Albans and Addisleigh Park sections of Queens was arrested yesterday.

title: Sellers to Stay at Rutgers for Senior Season
description: Phil Sellers, who grew up in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, opted yesterday for another year of basketball at Rutgers instead of declaring himself a hardship case and leaving college for professional basketball. This will assure Rutgers ofa strong team returning from the 197475 season, during which the Scarlet Knights reached the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament for the first time.

title: 2 in Women's Gang Seized In Attack on Old Man Here
description: Two members of a gang of young women who, the police say, have robbed and beaten 25 aged persons in the Coney Island section of Brooklyn in the last four monthstwo of whom later diedwere arrested yesterday after being identified by, a hospitalized 90yearold man they allegedly attacked last March.

title: F.B.I. Notes Haircut By Patricia Hearst In Explaining Raid
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that Patricia Hearst had cut her hair.

title: Saudis to Form a Council In Step to Political Reform
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, April 3Saudi Arabia has decided to set up a national deliberative body, called the Consultative Council, to plant the seeds of a parliamentary system in the kingdom, senior officials said this week.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: N.H.L. Battle for Two Playoff Spots
description: REMAINING GAMES

title: N.B.A. East WildCard Battle
description: If Cleveland beats Kansas City and New York loses one more game, Cleveland makes the playoffs.

title: ANACONDA TO CLOSE PERTH AMBOY WORKS
description: The Anaconda Company announced yesterday that it planned to close its Raritan Copper Works at Perth Amboy, N. J., this month. Leonard C. Powell., president of Anaconda's Montana mining division, said the move was made necessary because of general economic conditions adversely affecting the copper industry and a lack of feed material.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: EFFECTIVE MAY 3, 1975 ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:20 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: 6 Divisions' Broken Remnants Land at a Port Close to Saigon
description: VUNG TAU, South Vietnam, April 3Shattered, leaderless remnants of six South Vietnamese divisions from the northern twothirds of the country straggled ashore today at this small port.

title: CONFERENCE ENDS ON ENVIRONMENT
description: More than 300 urban and environmental specialists conchided a twoday conference here this week by drafting a list of 140 suggestions for solving urban problems, including the freeing of money in the Federal highway trust fund to help cities meet masstransit needs.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 1975

title: Rangers Battle Flyers to 11 Tie
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 3Brawling for 30 minutes, skating for 10 and playing defensively for 20, the New York Rabgers and Philadelphia Flyers finished in a 11 tie tonight at the Spectrum.

title: Article 2  No Title
End of FairTrade Laws Sought on Many Fronts
description: The nation's fairtrade laws, which were devised during the Depression as a way to protect leading brandname manufacturers, small businesses and mem and pop stores from pricecutting competition, are now under attack as unfair to consumers and as inflationary.

title: Weyand, Leaving Saigon, Says Communists Can Be Defeated
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 4General Frederick C. Weyand, the United States Army Chief of Staff said today that he as confident the South Vietnamese army still has the spirit and the capability to defeat the North Vietnamese.

title: Coast Study Center Split By Threat of Insolvency
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., April 2Having spent the last, 16 years battling for the preservation of democratic ideals with ideas hurled from the intellectual ramparts, the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions now faces the imminent threat of its own demise.

title: Limon Dancers Offer Homage and There Is a Time
description: The Jos Limn Dance Company is settling down very well in its season at the Harkness Theater. It was suspected from the beginning that this theater, with its moderately small proscenium opening, would prove particularly appropriate for the smaller companies, especially the modern dance troupes. And the relatively large capacity of the house, about 1,100, is also an advantage, although it does seem, so far, that the costs of a season run much the same as those for any other Broadway theater. Still, its proximity to Lincoln Center and its special facilities for dance companies could nevertheless give the theater a productive and useful life.

title: Carey Forecasts Democratic Victory In Nation Next Year
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., April 3Governor Carey told 400 Democrats here tonight that his victory in 1974 could forecast a national Democratic victory in 1976.

title: Tensions Grow in Saigon; New Coup Plot Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 4With tension increasing in Saigon over the fate of the remaining territory in Government hands, the Interior. Ministry announced early today that a new coup plot had been uncovered and a number of people arrested.

title: Cypriote Talks Called Set For April 25 in Vienna
description: ATHENS, April 3 (Reuters)The talks between Greek and turkish Cypriotes will resume in Vienna on April 25, the Athens press agency said today.

title: U. of Pennsylvania Plans Cuts in Graduate Education
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 3 (UPI)The University of Pennsylvania's Graduate School of Education will cut some programs but the school will not close, university officials said yesterday.

title: Moody's Keeps A Rating In Endorsing City's Bonds
description: In an endorsement of New York City's credit status yesterday, Moody's Investors Service said it would stand by its A rating of city bondsone day after its competitor, Standard & Poor's Corporation, suspended its A rating on the bonds.

title: School Gets One Fine Day of Opera
description: MATAWAN, April 3Grand opera came to the high school here this morning transported by five young professional singers from the Metropolitan Opera Studio in Lincoln Center who sang excerpts from Puccini's Madame Butterfly.

title: Pan Am Cutback in Caribbean Approved
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (UPI) The Civil Aeronautics Board gave approval to Pan American World Airways today to discontinue most of its Caribbean flights for up to two years.

title: Big Board to Sell Bid and Asked Data If S.E.C. Approves
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday it would start selling bid and asked price quotations on May 1 or shortly thereafter, subject to the approval of the Securities and Exchange Commission of the prices it plans to charge. The exchange presently provides such quotations only to members.

title: M'CARTER PLANS ITS '7576 SEASON
description: PRINCETON, April 3In observance of the nation's Bicentennial, the McCarter Theater will present an allAmerican repertory during the 197576 season.

title: I.R.S. TAX WARNING GIVEN TO 2 GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Two groups of taxpayers are in serious danger of having too little income tax withheld under the new tax law and should check with their employers to see whether they ought to change their withholding authorizations, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: One Man's View of All Those Traditional Exercises
description: Thirtyfive years ago, Dr. Laurence E. Morehouse, a physiologist at the University of Iowa, started an exercise class for faculty members who wanted to get into shape. Within weeks, he had made a discovery that was to influence the direction of his life, and a lot of others.

title: Puerto Rican Terrorists Vow to Press Violence Here
description: A communiqu in the name of a terrorist Puerto Rican independence group taking responsibility for the four latest midtown bombings here threatened yesterday to continue revolutionary violence against corporations at the heart of Yanki imperialism.

title: 2 AT GURNEY TRIAL TELL OF DONATIONS
description: TAMPA, Fla., April 3 (UPI)Two south Florida builders testified today that they had made cash contributions to a political campaign fund for former Senator Edward J. Gurney and to the Republican party in exchange for favorable consideration of applications for Federal mortgage Insurance.

title: Soviet Is Proudly Pushing Rail Line Across Untapped Region in Siberia
description: USTKUT, U.S.S.R.  The Russians hail It as the construction feat of the decade if not the centurya railroad to be carved through 2,000 miles of Siberian wilderness from the Lena River to the Amur River.

title: State Is Urged to Reduce DrunkenDriving Penalty
description: TRENTON, April 3 (AP)The, state chapter of the Automobile Association of America proposed today that the state reduce penalties for drinking drivers and concentrate mare on rehabilitation.

title: POLICY WEIGHED ON IMPORTED OIL
description: WASHINGTON, April 3Aware of strong Congressional opposition to any floor price for imported oil, some Administration energy planners are expressing interest in exceptions that would let a substantial but limited volume of oil enter the United States below the floor price.

title: Dent Hits Isolationism
Ford's Defense of U.S. Policy in Indochina Runs Counter to General Political Attitudes
description: WASHINGTON, April 3President Ford positioned himself today, contrary to conventional political wisdom, as a defender of two decades of American policy in Indochina. We were right said the President in his San Diego news conference; the fact that Indochina is in shambles does not invalidate what we tried to do.

title: Saigon, at U.N., Berates And Appeals to the U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 3 (AP)Saigon's observers at the United Nations said today that even though, as they put it, the American people had closed their eyes, ears and consciences to the plight of South Vietnam, they should help Vietnamese refugees.

title: The Opera: Magda Olivero Sings Tosca in Her Debut at Met
description: It wasn't Magda Olivero's evening, as it turned out. It was an evening that belonged to the opera buffs who have been having an affair with the veteran soprano for decades. Magda made her Metropolitan Opera debut last night as Tosca (42 years after her debut in Turin in 1933), but the story was largely in the buffs and their exquisite behavior.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Charter Revision Commission recommended yesterday the continuation of a strongMayor form of government for New York City, but urged that the City Council be given more power to advise and consent on the restructuring of municipal agencies and on appointments to important boards or commissions.

title: People and Business
description: Some corporate executives took pay cuts last year, but a number of senior oil company executives instead received increasessome of them substantial.

title: Cosmos Win Tourney
description: PORT  AU  PRINCE, Haiti, April 3Before 24,000 fans, the New York Cosmos defeated Victory, one of the top teams on this island, by 10, tonight and won the threeteam Eastern Airlines international tournament. Johnny Kerr, a midfielder, got the goal after 70 minutes. New York defeated the Miami Toros, 10, Tuesday night.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: A New York mother called the Raritan Bay Mental Health Center in New Jersey the other day, urgently asking for advice.

title: Critics See Tocks Restudy As Biased in Favor of Dam
description: TRENTON, April 3Critics of a proposal to dam the Delaware River at Tocks Island charged today that a restudy of the plan for Congress was superficial and biased in favor of a dam.

title: 4 in NATO See U.S. F16 Holding Edge Over Rivals
description: BRUSSELS, April 3Four Atlantic alliance countries planning a joint purchase of 350 jet fighters said here today that the new F16 of the United States had some undeniable advantages but that they had not made a final decision.

title: Sam Goody Dividend
description: Sam Goody, Inc., operators of a chain of 20 retail home entertainment centers in the Metropolitan New York area, and other states, declared yesterday a special dividend of 15 cents payable May 1 to holders of record April 18. It reflects the gain in 1974 net to $1.04 a share from 54 cents a share earned the year before. The last payment was 6 cents in March, 1971.

title: Nadjari Upheld on Nigrone Indictment
description: The State Court of Appeals yesterday rejected an attempt to prevent the special state prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, from prosecuting a lawyer who was indicted on perjury charges along with Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of the United States Custom Court and his son Paul Jr.

title: Death Penalty Bill Advances
description: BOSTON, April 3 (AP)The Massachusetts House gave final approval today to a bill that would reinstate the death penalty for nine categories of firstdegree murder. The Senate is expected to approve the measure also, but Gov. Michael S. Dukakis has promised to veto any death penalty bill and legislators do not expect the House and Senate to be able to override such a veto.

title: Jobs and Crime
description: LOS ANGELESCrime was sharply up in 1974, according to Federal Bureau of Investigation statistics, and Attorney General Edward Levi thinks that bears out his prediction that rising unemployment would cause more crime. With unemployment generally above 8 per cent and as high as 41 per cent for black teenagers, there is little reason to doubt Mr. Levi's analysis.

title: Market Continues Down; Dow Jones Declines 8.37
description: The stock market registered its fourth consecutive decline yesterday in the second slowest trading session of the year.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The police were still seeking clues to the murder 41yearold Ernest Nixon, also known as Ernest Solomon, a key Government witness in the Federal trial of three former detectives charged with shaking down suspected narcotics dealers for about $100,000.

title: Lisbon Parties to Decide Today On Plan to Retain Military Rule
description: LISBON, April 3Portugal's political parties have been given until tomorrow afternoon to accept or reject a plan to guarantee the armed forces essential political power for at least three to five years.

title: Corporate Profile
description: MONTREAL, April 3The Power Corporation of Canada, one of the nation's largest holding companies, made formal today its previously announced bid for its principal rival, the Argus Corporation, in the first step toward what could be one of the most impressive consolidations of financial and industrial power in recent Canadian history.

title: Pentagon Expects Drive To Isolate Saigon Region
description: Senior Defense Department officials say they expect the North Vietnamese to try to isolate Saigon by mounting offensives into the Mekong Delta and toward Vung Tau on the coast.

title: LIBYAN OIL BUILDING SEVERAL REFINERIES
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, April 3 (Reuters)The Libyan National Oil Corporation is building a number of oil refineries to reach a capacity of one million barrels of locally refined oil a day by the beginning of 1978 the Arab Revolution News Agencyreported today.

title: March Car Purchases Dip; Sears' Sales Decline 2.9%
description: DETROIT, April 3New car sales by the domestic auto concerns fell slightly in March but the postrebate slump predicted by some executives and dealers failed to materialize.

title: ANDREW WEST
description: RENO, April 4 (AP)Andrew West, whose onthescene radio reporting of Robert F. Kennedy's assassination gained him national fame, died of cancer at his home here Wednesday. He was 50 years old.

title: CORRECTION
Police Rescue L.I. Youth After Fall Into Air Shaft
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., April 4A 14yearold Oyster Bay High School student who fell 30 feet into an air shaft at the fourstory brick school today was rescued by the police after having been trapped for three hours.

title: H.U.D. Plan Ends Any Rent Ceilings In Federal Housing
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) The Federal Government proposed today that landlords for federally insured or federally owned housing projects be permitted to raise rents to tenants above ceilings fixed by local rent controls.

title: ENERGY PLAN SOUGHT FOR NEW ENGLAND
description: DEDHAM, Mass., April 4 (AP) in the face of what they said was unfavorable treatment by the Tedbral Government, the six New England Governors agreed today to draft a plan for partial selfreliance in energy.

title: Panel Aide Discounts Evidence of C.I.A. Link in Kennedy Death
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Rockefeller Commission investigating the Central Intelligence Agency has received no credible evidence that the C.I.A. had any involvement in the assassination of President Kennedy or that Lee Harvey Oswald was not, as the Warren Commission found, the lone assassin, the panel's executive director said today.

title: $100,000 Houses Are Selling Fast Despite Recession
description: VILLA PARK, Calif., April 4One of the hottest items on the real estate market these days is the $100,000 house.

title: Economic Woes in Greek Town Are Key Issue in Local Election
description: MEGARA, Greece, April 2This time a year ago, Constantine Stamoulis had 15 crews working on construction projects. Today, the building contractor employs only one crew of five men.

title: Music: Bernstein and Dybbuk Suite
description: There were two United States debuts on the New York Philharmonic program to Thursday night and they shared some qualities in common. Leonard Bernstein, who conducted, introduced his own Suite No. 1 from Dybbuk, the ballet that he and rerome Robbins produced last year. In telescoped form the score had immediate audience appeal while at the same time leaving the impression of lacking the substance required for a long popular run.

title: Democrats Decide to Push For StateOperated Bank
description: ALBANY, April 4Formation of a state bank to compete with commercial banksa suggestion that was thought to be no more than a tactical threat when state officials believed that banks were too slow in helping the Urban Development Corporationwill be pressed by Democrats in the Legislature.

title: Thursday's Fight
description: Los AngelesJose Torres, 129 pounds, Arondas, Mexico, knocked out Carlos Becerril, 128, Mexico, 4 rounds.

title: Nominee for Interior Stanley Knapp Hathaway
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Admirers of Stanley K. Hathawayand in his home state of Wyoming even grudging Democrats describe him as the most popular political figure in the 85 year history of the Equality State tend to picture him as A sorcerer's apprentice.

title: 5 SEIZED WITH DRUGS WORTH $1.5MILLION
description: Five men were arrested and drugs valued at more than $1.5million in street sales were seized Thursday night in a raid at a Harlem apartment and garage storeroom, the New York Drug Enforcement Task Force announced yesterday.

title: STATE ACTS TO END PLUTONIUM CARGO
description: Governor Carey and two other top state officials have begun action to halt any future shipments of plutonium through the state in general and Kennedy international Airport in particular.

title: RONAN TOLL PLAN WOULD PROMOTE USE OF CAR POOLS
description: Commuters driving their cars between New Jersey and New York City each day will probably have to pay higher bridge and tunnel tolls soon unless they participate in car pools, Dr. William J. Ronan said yesterday.

title: Sirica Refuses to Release Coverup Tape Immediately
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI) United States District Judge John J. Sirica refused today to order the immediate release of the White House tapes played at the Watergate coverup trial

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, APRIL 5, 1975

title: 1,000 Tested at East Side Health Fair
description: The young and the oldof Chinese, Italian and Puerto Rican backgrounds  crowded into Old St. Patrick's Youth Center on the lower East Side yesterday to sample a broad range of health tests.

title: To Save the Future
description: As the Battle of Britain began in June, 1940, and his nation stood perilously near to defeat, Winston Churchill told the House of Commons: If we open a quarrel between the past and the present, we shall find that we have lost the future.

title: Pentagon Favors a Delay on Arms Aid
description: WASHINGTON, April 4In policy discussions in the Ford Administration, the Defense Department is arguing against further largescale arms shipments to Saigon until the South Vietnamese forces demonstrate a will to fight.

title: Weeden Quarter Profit Up
description: Weeden & Co., stockbrokers, said yesterday that profits in the quarter ended Man?? 31 rose to $4.4million from a yearearlier loss of $4.5million. March produced a profit of $638,000 against a loss the prior March of $2.6million. Weeden said. It said trading profits doubled. The firm added that it also paid off $4.5million in notes, placing its debt to capital ratio at 5 to 1 well below the 15 to 1 maximum permitted.

title: Taxicabs in Police Network
description: BROOKLINE, Mass, April 4 (AP)Residents of this Boston area community who are in trouble or spot a crime being committed may reach the police through cab drivers under a new program announced yesterday. Capt. John Griffin of the police department said that under the new Civilian Radio Taxi Patrol program, any of the community's 125 cabs can be flagged down and the driver asked to contact dis dispatcher, who will in turn notify police headquarters.

title: Buffalo Police Find Weapon Possibly Used in Slaying 5
description: BUFFALO, April 4 (UPI)The police said today that they had recovered a weapon that might have been used to slay five persons in a home on the city's Near East Side on Wednesday.

title: Missing Girl Found Dead; Brother, 5, Is Still Sought
description: SECAUCUS, April 4The Hudson County Prosecutor's office today identified the body of a girl found lying nude next to the Hackensack River this morning as that of 11yearold Elsa Hall, who disappeared with her 5yearold brother, Robert, two weeks ago, as they were walking to school in Union City.

title: StomachBulge Defense
description: BALTIMORE, April 4The difference between barbarity now and in other times is that now everybody sees it on television.

title: Communist Units Probe Defenses Around Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, April 5A vast southward movement of North Vietnamese troops was reported yesterday as Communist units carried out probing actions along the Government's defense lines in an arc around Saigon.

title: Three Arrested in Murders of Elderly
description: The police arrested three teenagers yesterday who they said had collectively murdered two elderly men, blinded an elderly woman in one eye and robbed two other elderly men in Brooklyn.

title: 4 U.S. CARRIERS SET FOR RESCUE ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Four United States Navy aircraft carriers are standing by in the Western Pacific to evacuate American citizens and some Vietnamese from South Vietnam, but President Ford has not issued orders for these carriers to proceed to Vietnam waters, according to Administration officials.

title: Ft. Lee Mayor Links Graft to Apathy
description: FORT LEE, April 4Mayor Burt Ross, whose report to Federal authorities of a bribe offer resulted last week in the conviction of six men and two corporations on corruption charges, said today the public usually gets the kind of government it deserves.

title: The CambodianBloodbath Debate
description: Our national leader has forecast an unbelievable horror show, and his opponents have adduced opinions and facts to show it isn't truethat there will not be any semblance of a bloodbath if Communist forces win in Cambodia and then in Vietnam. The dialogue resembles a shouting match in which one man accuses the other of lying, and neither has the final evidence to prove his point.

title: E.P.A. Acts to Ban Throwaway Bottles At U.S. Installations
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI) The Environmental Protection Agency is drawing up rules that would ban the sale and use of throwaway cans and bottles at all Federal installations in the country.

title: New U.N. Office Formed
description: UNITED NATIONS, April 4 (Reuters)  Secretary General Waldheim tonight announced a new United Nations office to coordinate all forms of assistance to Indochina.

title: For Many Seniors at College, the Job Outlook Is Grim
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., April 2The clock said 6:15 last Monday morning when Gene Dombrowski came in from the cloudly cold and took his place as No. 17 in a line of Michigan State University seniors waiting for the glass door marked Placement Services to open. When it did, the students would rush to sign up, not for their first postgraduate jobs but simply for a preliminary screening interview, the thinnest of promises of a job.

title: U.S. Is Saying Nothing of New Vietnam Talks
description: WASHNGTON, April 4The United States, which for years actively pursued a negotiated settlement of the Vietnam war, has said nothing about any new talks at this time of disaster for the Saigon Government and top officials see little prospect that diplomacy can play a useful role now.

description: BOSTON, April 4 (AP)Suffolk Downs' thoroughbred racing program was called off today because of snow flurries.

description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) A rush to take advantage of the final month of industrywide automotive price rebates prompted consumers to increase their indebtedness for the first time in four months, the Federal. Reserve Board reported today.

F.A.A. Announces Immunity Program To Improve Safety
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI) in a reversal of past policy, the Federal Aviation Administration announced today that it would soon offer limited immunity to pilots and ground controllers who report unsafe conditions or rules violations.

description: MEXICO CITY, April 4Guadalajara's controversial medical school has decided to tighten further its controls over young Americans who are studying there but who still hope to enter medical school in the United States.

title: Rumors of a Beheading Draw Crowds in Riyadh
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, April 4Thousands of grim Arabs crowded the main square here today after reports had spread through the Middle East that King Faisal's assassin was to be beheaded there at midday.

title: 'Chac,' a Glossy View of Mayan Culture
description: 'Chac," is officially identified as a Panamanian film though it was made in Mexico by a young Chilean-born film director, Rolando Klein, who studied cinema at the University of California at Los Angeles. The film itself is equally eclectic, a sort of Museum of Natural History movie about Mayan culture, put together with all sorts of slick, elaborate, sophisticated film techniques.The camerawork is as glossy as a layout in the National Geographic and the movie, though sincerely intended, just a bit patronizing towards the Mayan descendents it means to appreciate. The film was shown yesterday at the Museum of Modern Art in the New Films-New Directors series and will be shown there again this evening at 6.Though the movie's glossy, picturesque look has the effect of denying the depth of the director's interest in the primitive culture he is studying, Mr. Klein does show real ability in obtaining simple, direct, unselfconscious performances from his Indian actors. They all perform with that kind of natural absorption that often elludes amateurs, including those women secretly photographed in supermarkets touting their favorite brand of detergent."Chac" has a story of sorts. It's about the members of a contemporary Mayan tribe who, when their own shaman fails to produce rain, seek the help of a possibly evil hermit called the Diviner. Mr. Klein incorporates many Mayan legends into the movie and gives us what ultimately has the effect of a fairly posh, all-expenses-paid weekend in the primitive Yucatan.

title: Atlantic Shelf's Oil Program Begins, But Production Remains Years Away
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Administration's program for a vast acceleration of oil leasing in the frontier areas of the outer continental shelf, a key part of its Project Independence, is finally under uncertain way.

title: Texas Inmate Sentenced to Die In Killing of Hostage in Shootout
description: HOUSTON, April 4A jury voted today to impose the death penalty on a Texas state prison inmate for causing the death of a hostage in an attempted prison escape last Aug. 3 in Huntsville.

title: Weiskopf Ahead by 5 Shots
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., April 4 (AP)Tom Weiskopf, battling cold, high winds and slick greens, carded a par 71 today and widened his lead to five strokes in the $225,000 Greater. Greensboro open golf tournament. His tworound total is 135, seven under oar.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: 17 IN HUDSON FREED ON GAMING CHARGES
description: JERSEY CITY, April 4 (UPI) All 17 persons on trial for various gambling charges in Hudson County were acquited today after the jury deliberated 10 hours.

title: Roosevelt Reported Seeking Increase In Takeout on Daily Doubles, Exactas
description: Roosevelt Raceway reportedly has begun campaigning secretly for a legislative deal that would Increase the parimutuel takeout on daily doubles and exactas to 19 per cent plus breakage.

description: It may surprise some fans of I.B.M., but for seven years now the Burroughs Corporation has carried a priceearnings ratio higher than the world's largest computer company.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TOKYO, April 4 (AP)Jenny Turrall of Australia won the women's 400meter freestyle today in 4 minutes 22:25 seconds and a countryman, Stephen Holland, captured the men's 400meter freestyle in 4:07:96 in the Japan indoor swimming championships. The 14yearold Miss Turrall, who broke the world record in the women's 800meter freestyleher fourth world recordthree days ago in London, finished fifth in the women's 200meter backstroke 2:31:89. The race was won by Suzuko Matsumura of Japan in 2:23:62.

title: While Polemics Flourish Portugal's Path Remains Unchanged
description: LISBONThe language of the early days, after the coup last April, spoke only of opening Portugal to democracy. It put no limits on the way that democracy would go.

title: Disconnection
description: With a cash assist from the state and a moral lift from Moody's Investors Service, the city has gained a little more time to try to persuade a reluctant Federal Government to help it through its acute liquidity crisis.

title: Information System Introduced
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Reuters, the international news agency, has introduced an information system that combines television, computer and cable communication. It is already supplying brokers, bankers, commodity traders and other business houses on the lower half of Manhattan with news and market information.

title: 10 Subway Stations Evacuated After Suspect Warns of Bombs
description: Ten major Manhattan subway stations were evacuated and hundreds of thousands of riders were delayed for an hour in the homebound rush last night by the bomb threats of an alleged bankextortionist who had set off a device earlier as authorities seized him on a crowded corner at Herald Square.

title: Philippines Opposition Leader Begins Hunger Strike in Prison
description: MANILA, April 4An opposition leader began a hunger strike today in protest against the martial law Government, which has kept him in prison for30 months.

title: Khalid's Health Called Fine, Heart Restored
description: CLEVELAND, April 4 (UPI) Two American doctors say that King Khalid of Saudi Arabia is excellent health and his heart is rehabilitated from a 1970 heart attack.

title: SEND THE MARINES, ROSTOW PROPOSES
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP) The United States should land two Marine divisions in North Vietnam and keep them there with air and naval support until the Communists agreed to abide by the 1973 Paris peace accords, in the view of Walt W. Rostow, who was national security adviser to President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: A Slice of Cake in Every Hamlet
description: PIPERSVILLE, Pa.One of the most perceptive intellectual concepts developed during the last two hundred years has been the theory of rites of passage. Anthropologists and sociologists have inspected many societies and have found that in most the great, salient moments in a human being's passage through life are best appreciated if they are celebrated with ritual.

title: Marjorie Williams, 92, Dies; Led Film Stars' Y.W.C.A.
description: Marjorie Brackett Williams, director of the Hollywood Studio Club of the Young Women's Christian Association in Los Angeles from 1922 to 1945 died Tuesday in Pomona, Calif. She was 92 years old.

title: Opera: Magda Olivero Sings Tosca in Met Debut
description: It wasn't Magda Olivero's evening, as it turned out. It was an evening that belonged to the opera buffs who have been having an affair with the veteran soprano for decades. Magda made her Metropolitan Opera debut Thursday night as Tosca (42 years after her debut in Turin in 1933), but the story was largely in the buffs and their exquisite behavior.

title: Ford Sends Condolences

title: Art: In Grosz's Work, a Look at the Hurts of Home
description: George Grosz as a young span took on society singlehanded. The society in question was the Germany of Kaiser Wilhelm II, and Grosz had the strongest possible opinions about it. To be a German, he wrote in the middle of World War I, is to be illmannered, stupid, ugly, fat and the worst sort of reactionary. (And unwashed, he added, just to finish the job.)

title: A WARM SALUTE FOR BEIDERBECKE
description: A glimpse of living history and crisp recreations of some classic jazz performances created a warm, sentimental glow that made the New York Jazz Repertory Company's presentation of the music of Bix Beiderbecke at Carnegie Hall on Thursday evening unusually affecting.

title: A Dominoes Expert In Peking
description: PARISThe world now opens a new chapter in the bloody book of Southeast. Asia and nobody can sayfor certain what it will disclose. China is uneasy because of pronounced Soviet influence in North Vietnam. The Kremlin has been discreet but Peking never forgets its fear of being outflanked by Moscow across India and Indochina. As for the United States, its influence in the area is at its lowest ebb in twenty years.

title: Longtime jobless Worn Down by Plight
description: A 50yearold bachelor talks of those moments when you feel like jumping out the window. A 24yearold prospective father speaks of wanting to go out and rob someone. A 29yearold mother, separated from her husband, describes herself as a woman losing her courage. Another bachelor, 35, and still living with his mother, makes the shy admission that he thinks of fashioning a shoeshine box, like the one I had when I was a kid.

title: Income Tax Plus Austerity Urged to Meet State Deficit
description: TRENTON, April 4The Joint Legislative Appropriations Committee, in a final public hearing, today heard appeals for State economy and enactment of an income tax as it prepared for the return of the State Legislature on Monday.

title: Six Cities Make Bid To the Republicans For '76 Convention
description: WASHINGTON, April 4The Republican National Committee heard today the bids of six cities for the party's national convention in August, 1976, but it still awaits word from the man whose preference could be decisive, President Ford.

title: One Dead, 35 Rescued as Tanker Splits in Heavy Seas
description: One crewman died and 35 others were plucked by Coast Guard helicopters yesterday from an oil tanker that split in two in angry waters 165 miles southeast of here.

title: Cheng ManChing Is Dead at 73; Calligrapher, Painter and Poet
description: Cheng Manching, a Chinese painter, calligrapher and poet, died March 26 in Taipei, Taiwan, according to word received here yesterday. Mr. Cheng, who was also a grand master of Tai Chi Chuan, the ancient Chinese system of exercises practiced for health and as a martial art, was 73 years sold.

description: Premier Yitzhak Rabin of Israel, in an interview for American television, says that his country has asked the International Red Cross to try to bring about an agreement under which Israel, Egypt and Syria would refrain from striking at lone another's population centers if a new war erupts.

Edie & Co., has taken a skeptical view of some current concerns that have arisen over a rising Federal budget deficit and its possible impact on the credit markets and interest rates. In a special analysis released yesterday, Mr Cox questioned the validity of fears surrounding these matters.

title: 8,000 Refugees Seize Control of U.S. Vessel
description: WASHINGTON, April 4About 8,000 South Vietnamese refugees seized control of an American rescue ship yesterday and forced a change of course, the Pentagon announced today.

title: 3 Held in Slayings

description: PHOENIXAs cities go, Phoenix has gone far and wide. It has grown in the last 30 years from a modest desert outpost of 17 square miles and 45,000 people into a metropolitan giant of 248 square miles and 750,000 people.

description: A 50yearold bachelor talks of those moments when you feel like jumping out the window. A 24yearold prospective father speaks of wanting to go out and rob someone. McKinley, senior vice president for economics of McGraw Hill, Inc., said here today. Dr. McKinley predicted a business recovery by the middle of 1975 that would set the stage for a full year of prosperity in 1976.

Hughes last June 5 has told The Los Angeles Times that he picked up a $100,000 certificate of deposit and a memorandum on a topsecret Central Intelligence Agency project that the burglars must have dropped.

title: Bridge:

description: MIAMI, April 4 (AP)  A former Miami mortgage broker who contends the Central Intelligence Agency was behind his selling of counterfeit mortgages sued the agency today for $10million.

title: The Screen: Pirosmani, Russian Study of Painter

title: Planning for New York...
description: The State Charter Revision Commission has taken several steps forward, one step back and one step sideways in its recommendations for land use planning for the City of New York. If it does not trip itself up on the way, it is clearly headed toward the right goala more rational, unified procedure for carrying out the kind of physical development that determines the city's appearance, function and style. In essence, what is being dealt with is New York's future, through the disposition of its most valuable resource.

title: Vietcong Denounce U.S. Evacuation of Refugees as Interference
description: PARIS, April 4 (Agence FrancePresse)The chairman of the Consultative Council of the South Vietnamese Provisional Revolutionary Government today denounced the Uhited States Government's evacuation of refugees as a maneuver allowing it to continue interfering in South Vietnam.

title: Couple Follow Unconscious Urge, Find Farming a Good Way of Life
description: DAYTON, Ohio When John Peterson and Joanna Redfield were students at the University of Chicago he in English, she in artneither could have predicted that they would make a life together as farmers in Ohio. This spring, however, as the mild weather coaxed the yellow and purple crocuses from the muddied grass on their farm outside of Dayton, the Petersons celebrated the, fifth anniversary of their commitment to the land.

title: Transporting Alaskan Gas Poses Threat to Its Sale

The Flames' loss eliminated them from the Patrick Division race and also gave a playoff berth to the New York Islanders.

description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (UPI)  Pan American World Airways announced plans today for a mercy airlift of 400 South Vietnamese orphans and 50 adult attendants out of Saigon tomorrow.

description: In presenting a collaborative program with the Laura Dean Dance Company joining forces with Steve Reich, and Musicians, the Brooklyn Academy of Music's experimental series came up with a winner Thursday night. title: Angela Bambace, 77, Officer Of I.L.G.W.U. 16 Years, Dies
description: BALTIMORE, April 4 (UPI)Angela Bambace, a retired vice president of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union who, combined her career with strong advocacy of women's rights, died at her home here yesterday. She was 77 years old.

title: JOBLESS RATE UP TO 8,7% IN MARCH, HIGHEST SINCE '41
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Unemployment rose substantially in March to 8.7 per cent of the labor force, and the number of discouraged workers who have dropped out of the labor force altogether reached a record of 1.1 million, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Philadelphia Electric Wins Approval of Nuclear Plant
description: WASHINGTON, April 4 (AP)  The Philadelphia Electric Company has received approval to obtain a construction permit to build a $1.5billion nuclear power plant in southern Lancaster County.

title: Dance: Mexican Tribute
description: Jos Limn was Mexican by birth, and he was properly proud of that heritage. As a result, it was perfectly appropriate that on Thursday night a special gala benefit should be held by the Jos Limn Dance Company during its current season at the Harkness Theater called simply A Mexican Tribute. Mayor Beame declared it Mexican Dance Day, and there was a benefit reception afterward that was Mexican in both mood and food.

title: Morton's Contract In N.F.L.'s Hands
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., April 4Craig Morton reasserted today that he had honored his contract with the World Football League and should be allowed to play for the New York Giants in the 1975 National Football League season.

description: LAKELAND, Fla., April 4 The New York Mets lost yet another pitcher tonight when Bob Apodaca, a relief specialist, was placed on the 21day disabled list.

title: Machinery for Appeal
description: But the proposal to abolish the Board of Standards and Appeals for a Zoning Administrator within the City Planning Department merely sidesteps what is wrong with zoning administration now. It is not the existence of an independent body to determine hardships imposed by the zoning law that is at fault, although the board's frequent misuse or misinterpretation of its power makes abolition a tempting solution. There may well be a better way of dealing with variances and hardships, and in the light of the board's flagrant abuses of zoning objectives that way must be found.

title: Judge Says F.B I. Withheld Data on Indians
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Federal Judge Fred J. Nichol, who presided last year over the trial of two militant Indian leaders involved in the takeover of Wounded Knee, S.D., has accused the Federal Bureau of Investigation of withholding information from Federal prosecutors on the bureau's use of informers during the takeover.

title: Blaze at Brennan's Closes Restaurant In French Quarter
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 4A raging fire swept through Brennan's restaurant last night, severely damaging the elegant 19thcentury mansion that houses the famous French restaurant, but injuring none of the 450 customers who were evacuated during the peak of the dinner business.

title: 10 Subway Stations Evacuated After Suspect Warns of Bombs

Manhattan subway stations were evacuated and hundreds of thousands of riders were delayed for an hour in the homebound rush last night by the bomb threats of an alleged bankextortionist who had set off a device earlier as authorities seized him on a crowded corner at Herald Square.

More than 100 of the children and at least 25 of the adults accompanying them were believed to have been killed.

title: For Childless Couple, Three Instant Sons
description: DENVER, April 4Larry and Linda Moritz got the son they long wanted. Dave and Bobbie Johnson became instant parents of three boys after six years of childless marriage. Tony and Denise Ingram found a new playmate for their two previously adopted Vietnamese girls.

title: TAX CUTS UPHELD FOR 2 HOUSING UNITS
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday upheld the constitutionality of an amended propertytax law enacted last year by the Legislature, granting a continuing tax abatement to the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company's Stuyvesant Town and Riverton housing projects.

title: Few Vietnam Orphans Eligible to Come to U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 4There are 25,000 orphans in institutions in South Vietnam at the moment. Untold thousands more are cared for by Vietnamese families. Only about 1,500 are eligible to emigrate to the United States.

title: J.F.K. F.D.R. Y.O.U.?
description: A recurrent theme in the press is that it is absurd for the United States, a nation of 215 million people, thousands of them wise, disinterested and illustrious, to confine its Presidential choice to the score of men whom the conventional political process has thrown up as Presidential candidates.

title: Cambodia Expels Newsman
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 9The Government ordered today that the Phnom Penh bureau chief for Agence FrancePresse, Charles de Nerciat, be expelled. The bureau will remain open. The action was officially described as due to tendentious reporting.

title: ALEXANDER FRASER, HEADED SHELL OIL
description: Alexander Fraser, former president of the Shell Oil Company, died yesterday in Jacksonville, Fla. His age was 85.

title: People in Sports
description: Dick Kimball, University of Michigan diving coach, was named yesterday to coach the United States diving team for the 1976 Olympic Games in Montreal. The announcement was made after a joint meeting of the Amateur Athletic Union and the United States Olympic Diving Committee in Cleveland.

title: Colonels Down Nets for First
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 4  Kentucky had a healthy center in Artis Gilmore tonight and that was the difference as the Colonels defeated the New York Nets, 10899, in a playoff for the American Basketball Association. Eastern Division title.

title: 4 U.S. CARRIERS SET FOR RESCUE ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, April 4Four United States Navy aircraft carriers are standing by in the Western Pacific to evacuate American citizens and some Vietnamese from South Vietnam, but President Ford has not issued orders for these carriers to proceed to Vietnam waters, according to Administration officials.

title: Communist Units Reported Probing Saigon's Defenses
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, April 5A vast southward movement of North Vietnamese troops was reported yesterday as Communist units carried out probing actions along the Government's defense lines in an arc around Saigon.

title: The Cast
description: CHAC, directed, written and produced by Rolando Klein; director of photography, Alex Phillips Jr.; editor, Harry Keramidas; music, Victor Fozado and Elizabeth Waldo; a Cientifilm Aurora production. Running time: 95 minutes. At the Museum of Modem Art, 53d Street west of Fifth Avenue.

title: Kienbusch Paints Maine Coast
description: There are painters for whom the geography of a particular locale assumes a commanding esthetic importance. It becomes an essential component of the imaginationa home for the artist's spirit as well as the source of a specific visual vocabulary. From time to time, such painters may turn their attention to other terrains, but only as a holiday from their true center of feeling. As artists they are rooted to special ambiance.

title: W.G. Perry, Architect, 95, Dies; Colonial Williamsburg Restorer
