description: PENZANCE, England, April 13 (Reuters)The granddaughter of the late Bertrand Russell set fire to herself in a quiet country churchyard and died after running into a village with her clothes blazing, the police said today.

title: S.E.C. IS TENTATIVE ON UNITED BRADS
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission granted tentative approval yesterday for the resumption of trading in stock of the United Brands Company today, unless unforeseen developments occur prior to the 10 A.M. opening of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Ending World War II
description: WASHINGTONIn case you hadn't heard, World War II will soon be corning to its official end. The Russians won.

title: About Half the 103 Congressmen Who Lost in '74 Work in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, April 13Thirty years ago, it was said of David Worth Clark, a Democratic Senator from Idaho who spent a decade in Congress and opened a law office here after his defeat, that they never go back to Pocatello.

title: Corporate Pricing Critical After Last Week's Sellout
description: The corporate bond market, after a prolonged price retreat, finally found a trading range last week. This provided sellout status for new offerings and a period of brisk activity.

title: ABORTION BACKERS DENIED EUCHARIST
description: SAN DIEGO, April 13While heated arguments took place outside, at least 80 members of the National Organization for Women were turned away from the communion rail in Roman Catholic churches here today when they refused to renounce their support of abortion.

title: Soccer Results
description: GERMANAMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Political Evolution
description: Appeals at this late hour for international diplomatic efforts to enforce a ceasefire in Indochina have a fatuous ring about them.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
Roundup: Luzinski Hits 3d Home Run As Phils' Rookie Shuts Out Cardinals
description: A week into the baseball season Greg Luzinski already has hit three home runs and survived five games without an injury, both of which may be personal records for the Philadelphia Phillies' left fielder.

title: Antonioni Pauses Herein His Search
description: Michelangelo Antonioni's lastest film, The Passenger, deals, in part, with a journalist who stops being an onlooker and becomes a doer, even though he is not sure what he is doing.

title: EDWARD A. MORGAN
description: Edward A. Morgan of 35 Garfield Avenue, Avon, N. J., retired secretary of the Monmouth County Purchasing Department, died yesterday at the Jersey Shore Medical Center in Neptune, N. J. His age was 73.

title: City Warns Police on Salary Demands
description: The city, caught in a critical fiscal bind, has warned that granting the demand of policemen for higher pay than fire fighters would result in job losses, a costly burden for taxpayers and unstabilized labor relations.

title: Article 1  No Title
Muskie Foresees Economy Reviving By the End of 1976
description: WASHINGTON, April 13 (UPI)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, predicted today that Congressional efforts to cut taxes and set a spending ceiling would help bring the unemployment rate below 7.5 per cent and the inflation rate under 7 per cent by the end of 1976.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, April 13 (AP)China seems to be nearing a place in the Olympic Games, although Peking has made no application for recognition. We are still waiting for the Chinese to approach us, says Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Committee. Clearly there are moves going on. But until we receive an application, there is nothing we can do. The Chinese are slowly winning recognition from one international sports federation after another, ousting Nationalist China's representatives in the process.

title: Procaccino's Mother Dies
description: Rosa Procaccino, mother of Mario A. Procaccino, former State Commissioner of Taxation and Finance, died Saturday at the Mother Cabrini Nursing Home, Yonkers. She was 90 years old. Surviving also are two other sons, Dr. Anthony Procaccino and Prof. John A. Procaccino, and five grandchildren.

title: Videotape Replaces Canvas for Artists Who Use TV Technology in New Way
description: Frank Gillette's new work for television is not the sort of thing that's geared to peddle soap. The 14minute videotape shot on Cape Cod has as its sole subject the flow water into and around a cove.

title: MENTAL HOSPITALS FOR CRIMINAL ONLY URGED BY MEROLA
description: The establishment of forensic hospitals for the segregation and treatment of mentally ill criminals and defendants in a secure setting was urged yesterday by Bronx District Attorney Mario Merola, to correct a state system that he called a charade.

title: About New York
description: When I was a kid I used to conic down here at 10 o'clock at night, City Councilman Sam Wright said, driving a visitor down Pitkin Avenue. The lights were on, stores open, people shopping.

title: Welfare Roll in City Reaches 991,300; Drop Held Unlikely
description: Human Resources Administrator James R. Dumpson said yesterday that the city's welfare rolls grew to about 991,300 persons in March in the continuing recession with no sign of a turnaround.

title: Cross Section
description: The selection committee for the Museum of Modern Art's current New Directors/New Films series was obviously hard put to find American entries. There is no other way to explain this disappointing program of four shorts under the umbrella title, Cross Section: An American Film Program.

title: Coalition in Laos Shows Strains
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 12The Defense Minister of Laos barely speaks to his deputy. At the Ministry of Public Works, the Deputy Minister privately calls his boss intellectually inferior. The Health Minister says he has little time for the talents of his deputy. And the Ministry of Information people seldom attend the same parties and speak contemptuously of one another.

title: RENTAL LISTINGS UNDER SCRUTINY
description: State and city officials have begun an attackincluding a move for legislationto curb alleged widespread abuses and the victimization of consumers here by unlicensed apartmentreferral services.

title: Morgenthau Reorganization Is a Long, Uphill Struggle
description: When Robert M. Morgenthau became the Manhattan District Attorney on Jan. 2, he found the officeone of the largest and most respected in the countryusing decadesold methods to cope with a criminal caseload that had increased threefold in 20 years.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Troubled Children Touch The World Through Animals
description: BREWSTER, N. Y.The fat curly sheep with their little lambs, the black and white goat stretched out in the sun, the somnolent turkeystheir heads plumped down inside their awkward bodies, had all been taking a kind of afternoon siesta in, the bright April sun.

title: Experts Voice Some Hope Despite the Vast Global Scope of Disease and Malnutrition
description: The vast scope of disease and malnutrition, chiefly in the developing countries, and how to deal with the problem were assessed last week by specialists meeting in Atlanta.

title: Bridge:
description: Whether to double the opponents in a game contract simply because the declarer will face a terrible trump break is always a tricky point. Every expert can remember occasions when a greedy double has helped him to bring home a gameor when he has been the unwary doubler.

title: I.R.S. Trained Its Agents in Drinking
description: WASHINGTON, April 13The Internal Revenue Service operated a secret school for undercover agents in which it tested them with liquor and women to see if they could resist disclosing their identities.

title: 40Foot Birdie Putt at 16 Helps Nicklaus Win His 5th Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 13 Jack Nicklaus, who likes to live dangerously and has a sense of show business, set up one of the most exciting finishes today in the history of the Masters golf tournament.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Texan Loses in Korea Golf

title: Theater: Noel Coward
description: It was a great day for the Worthingtons (remember Mrs. Worthington?) at the Cornmodore Hotel yesterday when Lolly's Theater Cluban organization that appears to be bivouacking rather clumsily, in a musty, pseudoTudor ballroom there  presented with no apparent modesty or misgivings something called: A Short. Visit Only: A Salute to Noel Coward. Even Sir Noel's bitterest enemy should have been turning over in his grave in curmudgeonly sympathy.

title: CAR EXHAUST LAW REPEALED IN VOTE
description: LOS ANGELES, April 13 After four years of public disputation, the California Legislature has voted to repeal a controversial law requiring special fumecontrol equipment on older cars in the state's most densely populated area.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: Islanders vs. Pittsburgh

title: FORD HEARS PRAYER FOR VICTIMS IN ASIA
description: WASHINGTON, April 13 (UPI)President Ford attended church services today and heard a brief, special prayer for all of the victims of war in Southeast Asia.

title: Progress of BonnSoviet Detente Is Being Slowed by Arguments
description: BONN, April 13West Germany's policy of accommodation with the Soviet Union and its allies is mired in haggling five years after it began, officials say, with little early hope for a fresh beginning.

title: The Cast
description: ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE EAST (II Etait une Fois Dans l'Est), directed by Andre Brassard; screenplay (French with English subtitles) by Mr. Brassard and Michel Tremblay; director of photography, Paul Van Der Linden; music, Jacques Perron; editor. Andre Corr??veau?? produced by Les Productions CarleLamy, Ltd. Running time: 100 minutes. At the Museum of Modern Street, 53d west of Fifth Avenue.

title: WILLIAM A. WELLS
description: William A. Wells, an assistant vice president of Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, died Saturday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 62 years old and lived at 175 Lindenwood Road. Great Kills. S.I.

title: Karl Richter Dazzles Ear With Bach on Tully Organ
description: The new organ in Alice Tully Hall passed a crucial test Saturday night when Karl Richter, the German virtuoso, played a Bach recital that dazzled the ear with color and brilliance.

title: PHYSICIANS SCAN OCCUPATION'S ILLS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 13At a conference sponsored by the American Medical Association this weekend, a Maryland psychiatrist, Dr. Aaron Ament, told of a respected physician with a thriving practice who had slowly become psychotic.

title: HONDURAN LEADER FACING CHALLENGE
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, April 13Already challenged, by a group of younger officers, Honduras's longruling chief of state has now been seriously threatened by charges that he accepted a $1.25million bribe from the United States conglomerate, United Brands Company.

title: Screen: Alma, From Brazil, Shown at Modern Art
description: Alma (Isabel Ribeiro) is a whore who thoroughly enjoys her job. She's not pretty in any conventional way. Her figure is too lean to, fulfill Earth Mother fantasies. There's something else about Alma that appeals to men, a streak of recklessness that seems almost mad. Alma couldn't care less about the consequences when her wealthy lover finds out that she's got another fellow on the side. It's simply back to the brothel and let'shaveaparty.

title: Cambodia Regime Vows Not to Give Up, But Seeks CeaseFire and Negotiations
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 13The new military Government in Phnom Penh vowed today that depite the very grave military situation and the evacuation of the American Embassy it would refuse under any circumstances to surrender to the insurgents who surround the Cambodian capital.

title: Building Burns in Vermont
description: ST. ALBANS, Vt., April 13 (AP)Eight apartments and two small businesses were destroyed today in a threealarm blaze that swept through a threestory brick building. There were no injuries reported.

title: Chad at a Glance
description: Vital StatisticsChad is a landlocked nation in north central Africa of 495,800 square miles, about the size of Texas, New Mexico and Arizona combined. It has a population of 3,975,000, almost evenly divided between the Moslem people of mostly Sudanic origin in the north and eastern portions of the country and the Bantu peoples of the south, who are generally animists although about 10 per cent are Christian. The Moslem peoples of the north and central sections of the country speak an Arabic dialect, while the main Bantu languages spoken in the south are Sara, Massa and Moudang.

title: Campaign by City to Sell Surplus Real Estate Lags
description: A drive to sell cityowned surplus real estate to ease the budget deficit has become tangled in bureaucracy and the claims of politicians and community groups, with the result that the city will reap only half the $15million it had projected for this year.

title: High School Sophomores Pelt Dent With Queries on Economy
description: Several dozen high school sophomores kept former Secretary of Commerce Frederick B. Dent on the ropes for an hour here yesterday under a barrage of critical questions on the nation's economic system and its prospects.

title: Injured Russian Sailor Taken off Ship Near L.I.
description: A Coast Guard helicopter picked up a crewman of a Russian fishing trawler off Long Island yesterday afternoon after the man had apparently shot himself in the mouth with a flare pistol.

title: South Vietnamese Officer Jubilant Over Delta Fight
description: TAN THOI, South Vietnam, April 13 (AP)After four days of fighting, South Vietnamese troops appear to have turned back a major North Vietnamese attempt to cut Route 4 and isolate Saigon from Its food supplies in the Mekong Delta.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, APRIL 14, 1975

title: Saigon Troops in Xuan Loc Are Proud
description: XUAN LOC, South Vietnam, April 13You see, we can beat them, said Col. Le Xuan Hieu, commander of the 40th Infantry Regiment in Xuan Loc. He led a score of newsmen today on a tour of the smoldering ruins of what once was a thriving business district.

title: Bobby Allison Takes Auto Race by 3 Feet
China Requests That U.S. Stop Interfering in South Vietnam
description: HONG KONG, April 13China urged the United States today to stop all involvement in South Vietnam and all interference in the internal affairs of South Vietnam, terming this the correct way to settle the South Vietnam question.

title: Insurgents Move Closer to the Airport, but Streets in Phnom Penh Remain Calm
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 13 The insurgents pushed a little closer to the airport today and the noises of war could be heard, as usual at points all around this besieged capital, but the Government seemed essentially in control for the moment.

title: Vote by Vote, Senators Try to Decide Who Won in New Hampshire
description: WASHINGTON, April 13Five months after the election, New Hampshire still has no junior Senator, and it may be months mere before the closest Senate race in history is finally derided.

title: INQUIRY ON NERO SHIFTS ITS FOCUS
description: The state's Election Law Enforcement Commission has joined the inquiry into the affairs of John Nero, a Camden County political figure involved in a state investigation of alleged corruption there, the cornmission chairman, Frank Reiche said yesterday.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A few years back we spoke with enthusiasm of a small pamphlet of recipes titled The Melting Pot. We have recently received the newest edition of the pamphlet from the publishers, English in Action.

title: G.O.P. Donors Are Shunning $1,000aPlate Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, April 13Even with President Ford's help, the big annual Republican fund raiser on Tuesday night for House and Senate candidates will take in less money than last year's dinner did at the bottom of the party's Watergate depression. According to the best inside estimates, the Republicans' $1,000aplate dinner will raise barely half of the recordbreaking $1million that the Democrats expect to collect at a $500aplate feast in the same Washington Hilton Hotel nine days later.

title: Stand by Saigon's Troops Slows Communist Drive
description: For the first time in nearly four weeks of fighting, United States military sources noted yesterday, the pace of the North Vietnamese offensive has definitely been slowed by South Vietnamese resistance in the Mekong Delta and around Xuan Loc, to the northeast of Saigon.

title: Miss Brindisi Has Nuptials
description: Leslie Alice Brindisi, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Watkins Brindisi of HollisWood, Queens, was married yesterday noon to Eric David Kerman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Kerman of Lehighton, Pa. State Supreme Court Justice Joseph J. Kunzeman performed the ceremony at the Roslyn (L. I.) Country Club.

title: Coalition in Laos Shows Strains
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 12The Defense Minister of Laos barely speaks to his deputy. At the Ministry of Public Works, the Deputy Minister privately calls his boss intellectually inferior. The Health Minister says he has little time for the talents of his deputy. And the Ministry of Information people seldom attend the same parties and speak contemptuously of one another.

title: Golfdom's Master of Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 13When he sank a 40foot putt for a birdie 2 on the 16th green of the Augusta National Golf Club today for what proved to be the winning margin in his record fifth Masters champion ship, Jack Nicklaus raised his putter high, jumped for joy and danced away. The 35yearold professional golfer doesn't often show that much emotion. I don't often hole 40footers either, he said later with a smile. But his victory was a rare emotional personal triumph, in a sense almost a comeback.

title: Italy's Communists Set a Titoist Course
description: ROME, April 13  Tensions have developed in the last few weeks between Moscow and the Italian Communist party, the strongest Marxist force in the West, according to Eastern European diplomats here.

title: 2 Slain on Maryland Street; Police Then Kill Assailant
description: (UPI)A man walking along a suburban Washington opened fire on passersby, killing two persons and wounding five others tonight before being shot and killed by the police, the authorities said.

title: Flyers Beat Leafs by 63 In Opener
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 13Rick MacLeisch scored three goals. Moose Dupont got a match penalty for butting. Bobby Clarke had two assists. Dave Schultz charged a player with his stick. Don Saleski was penalized for fighting.

title: Morgenthau Reorganization Is a Long, Uphill Struggle
description: When Robert M. Morgenthau became the Manhattan District Attorney on Jan. 2, he found the officeone of the largest and most respected in the countryusing decadesold methods to cope with a criminal caseload that had increased threefold in 20 years.

title: Advertising
description: The Dunlop Tire and Rubber Corporation, which had all but eschewed advertising for its tires, is now prepared to espouse it. Dunlop is going from a national ad budget of $200,000 last year to $1.5million this year.

title: 1975 Is a Vintage Year For Gallo Ad Agencies
description: The E.&J. Gallo Winery in Modesto Calif., which parted with one ad agency in January, has just added, two: Rosenfeld, Sirowitz, Lawson/ West and Wells Rich Greene. That gives the leading American wine maker a total of three. It already had Young Rubicam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: New York City's Money Crisis

title: Textile Producers Are Finding a Few Signs of Spring
description: The textile market looks brighter now than at any time in the last six months, but recovery so far from its worst slump'since World War II is far from spectacular.

title: Dubcek: J'Accuse
description: Alexander Dubcek, leader of the Czechoslovak Communist party during the 1968 liberalization period, last Oct. 28 sent a protest letter to the Federal Assembly and Slovak National Council (parliament), supporters abroad say. It was made available to The New York Times by the Czechoslovak Socialist Opposition abroad, which attests to its authenticity. Mr. Dubcelz is now a mechanic employed by the Ministry of Forests in Bratislava. Following are excerpts.

title: Scotland Is Recruiting American Teachers
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., April 12 Quite unnoticed by most residents of this former colonial village, who were busy bracing for next weekend's expected Bicentenial tourist invasion, three quiet Britons took over the local school's office this weekend to enlist a small army of American teachers to work in Scottish schools.

title: HENRY K. EILERS
description: Henry K. Eilers of Bronxville, N. Y., owner and until his retirement 10 years ago president of the Pyramid Grate Company of New York, died yesterday at Lawrence Hospital, in Bronxville. His age was 84.

title: Noncompliance Seen on Sterilization
description: The American Civil Liberties Union has charged that many of the nation's leading hospitals are in gross noncompliance with Federal regulations on sterilization and has proposed immediate withdrawal of Federal funding as an enforcement measure.

title: Red Smith
description: Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper for the week ending May 8, 1886, gave over its entire front page to a penandink sketch showing a multitude of silkhats and bowlers carrying two baseball players on their shoulders. Opening of the National League baseball season at the Polo Grounds, the caption read, April 29th, New York vs. Boston: Victorious batsmen carried on the shoulders of their admirers. On an inside page was an item headed. The Baseball Season, between a description of the crack transAtlantic steamer, City of Rome, and an essay on the decline of shad fishing the Delaware. It is a model of a succinct and colorful reporting: The opening League championship baseball game of the season, between the Boston and New York nines, was played at the New York Polo Grounds on Thursday of last week, in the presence of something like 11,000 enthusiastic spectators. A more exciting game could not have been asked. Two extra innings were required to decide the contest, which ended in the defeat of Boston by a score of five to four. At the end of the fourth inning, the score stood three to two in favor of New York; and it was not until the ninth that Boston captured a run and made it a tie. In the tenth inning, each scored another run, preserving the balancesomething quite unprecedented in games between the crack professional players, and phenomenal in the first League of the season.

title: Islanders Drop First Game, 54
description: PITTSBURGH, April 13Unable to make up a threegoal lead that Pittsburgh took in the first period, the New York Islanders lost to the Penguins, 54, tonight before a sellout crowd of 13,404 in the iglooshaped Civic Arena. It was the first of a fourofsevengame series in the quarterfinals of the National Hockey League's Stanley Cup playoffs. The second game is slated for Tuesday here.

title: Dr. Benjamin Malzberg, Expert on Mental Health
description: ALBANY, April 13 (AP)Dr. Benjamin Malzberg, director of research and statistics in the New York State Department of Mental Hygiene from 1944 to 1956, died early today at the age of 81.

title: GLOMAR EXPLORER TO SAIL THIS MONTH
description: LOS ANGELES, April 13 (Reuters)The operators of the Glomar Explorer, the deepsea vessel that recovered part of a sunken Soviet submarine last year for the Central Intelligence Agency, said today that the ship would put to sea again for tests later this month.

title: Personal Finance : Augmenting Medicare
description: Millions of individuals above the age of 65 who receive the benefits of Medicare also buy private health insurance policies.

title: HANOI CALLS ON U.S. TO MOVE OUT NOW
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, April 13 (Agence FrancePresse) The North Vietnamese Foreign Ministry said today that American citizens could easily be evacuated from South Vietnam without deployment of Marines and helicoptersif they were all repatriated now.

title: Aftertaste of Sugar Shortage Lingers
Conservatives in, Japanese Vote Win Rural Areas, Lose in Cities
description: TOKYO, Monday, April 14Japan's conservatives scored solid victory in rural areas in gubernatorial elections yesterday, but were unable to crack the leftist holds on the cities. The vote had strong national implications.

title: Bergen's Affluent Areas Reveal Many Problems In Common With Poorer Communities in State
description: RIVER VALE, April 13Residents of many of New Jersey's small, affluent bedroom communities have more in common with their neighbors in poorer towns than might be expected from a comparison of their lifestyles.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SMORGASBORD An art show today at 5 P.M., held in the rotunda of Low Memorial Library on the Columbia University campus, will begin the school's second annual Arts DropIn, a fiveday festival of special events and showings of graduatestudent work in film, music, writing, theater, painting and sculpture. The art exhibition is continuing daily from 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. Most of the festival is free.

title: Richard H. Moorsteen, 49, Dies; Wrote One of Pentagon Papers
description: Richard H. Moorsteen, an authority on foreign affairs and author of one of the controversial Pentagon papers, died in his sleep early Saturday at his home in Malibu, Calif. He was 49 years old.

title: CAMBODIA REBELS OPEN BIG THRUST FOR PHNOM PENH
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Monday, April 14The Cambodian insurgents, in a sudden largescale attack, drove to the edge of this capital today, sending thousands of frightened refugees fleeing from the outskirts into the city. It appeared that the final battle, for Phnom Penh had begun.

title: Blast Under Italian Train
description: FLORENCE, Italy, April 13 (Reuters)A bomb ripped up a section of track beneath a packed express train early today, but the 17 passenger cars stayed on the rails and only one person was injured. There have been a number of bomb attacks on trains near Florence, and Fascists are believed to have been behind one last August when 12 people were killed.

title: Being Well Dresses in Fall: Layer on Layer of Knitwear
description: PARIS, April 11  As anyone paying the least bit of attention can plainly see, a woman can lead a rich, fashionable life clad in nothing but knitted clothes. If she's the least bit clever about it, she will put her whole wardrobe on her back at the same time. With a hairbrush and mascara in her handbag, she's ready for the Arctic or the tropicswherever the plane will take her.

title: MUNICIPAL HONORS GO TO DOZEN CITIES
description: The National Municipa League bestowed yesterday All America City Awards on 12 cities for citizen and govern meet accomplishments in improving their communities United Press International reported.

title: Pirates Defeat Seaver and the Mets, 53
description: PITTSBURGH, April 13Dave Kingman belted another home run for the Mets today. Rusty Staub clouted his first and New York also hit a weird trifecta by scoring a run on a balk, a passed ball and a wild pitch.

title: Minpin Best in Canada
description: MONTREAL, April 13The smallest dog in the ring won the biggest prize of her career when she was named best in show at the 82d allbreed fixture of the United Kennel Club at the Place Bonaventure tonight.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Internal Revenue Service will keep offices and telephone lines open until 9 P.M. today and tomorrow. The deadline for filing 1974 tax returns is midnight Tuesday. About a million returns remain to be filed in the final two days, according to an I.R.S. spokesman. Historically, taxpayers who owe the Government money wait until the final days to file. More than 2.25 million returns from New Jersey have already been mailed in. The penalty for filing a return late is a monthly charge of 5 per cent of the taxes due.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Yankees Split With Tigers
description: Two Yankee followers were talking after the team split a double header with the Detroit Tigers yesterday.

title: 22 PALESTINIANS KILLED IN BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 13Gunmen of a rightwing Lebanese party opened fire today on a bus filled with Palestinian militants, killing 22 Palestinians, according to an official Lebanese communiqu.

title: European Ministers Agree To Coordinate Vietnam Aid
description: DUBLIN, April 13 (AP)The nine countries of the Common Market decided today to coordinate their humanitarian aid to Vietnam, and to send it to both South Vietnam and the areas occupied by the Communistled forces.

title: U.S. Tells of Airdrops
description: WASHINGTON, April 13The United States has begun an airtrop of supplies to Cambodia, a spokesman for the Pentagon said here today. He declined to say whether the supplies were being dropped at the Phnom Penh airport or elsewhere, however.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: the United States is the Government's absolute and utter control of the export of munitions. We have to get a license from Munitions Control of the State Department before we talk to even a friendly country.

title: REDS PRESS DRIVE TO TAKE XUAN LOC; FIGHTING IS FIERCE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, April 14Communist forces renewed their assault on Xuan Loc, a key provincial capital east of Saigon, yesterday while others shelled the Mekong Delta city of Can Tho in the heaviest fighting since the North Vietnamese offensive of 1972.

title: Finely Disciplined Don't Cry With Your Mouth Full at Paris
description: Don't Cry With Your Mouth Full was shown last year at the 12th New York Film Festival. The following excerpt is from Vincent Canby's review, which appeared in The New York Times on Sept. 28. The film is being shown at the Paris Theater, 58th Street west of Fifth Avenue.

title: Swimmers Leave Cincinnati, Well on Way to Montreal
description: CINCINNATI, April 13Gary Hall will be almost 25 years old if he decides to try for a spot on his third United States Olympic swimming team next year.

title: Peking Reports 10 Freed in Amnesty On Way to Taiwan
description: HONG KONG, April 13Ten Chinese Nationalist war criminals released by China under a special amnesty last month left Peking today on their way to Taiwan, according to Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: HARD TIMES ADD TO LEGAL AID LOAD
description: An increasing number of New Yorkers thrown out of work by the recession are seeking the free counsel of the Legal Aid Society's civil division as they find themselves no longer able to pay for private lawyers.

title: ALLON CRITICIZED OVER VISIT TO U.S.
description: TEL AVIV, April 13Foreign Minister Yigal Allon left for the United States today on a controversial visit denounced by some here as illtimed because of frictions with Washington over the breakdown of Secretary of State Kissinger's last Middle East mission.

title: Memorial Services
description: CHIANGKAISHEK18871975. President of the Republic of China died in Taipei, April 5, 1975. A memorial service will be held in the Marble Collegiate Church, 5th Ave. at 29th St. on Wednesday, April 16 at 11:30 A.M., to he conducted by Dr. Norman Vincent Peale. All friends are invited to attend.

title: I.R.S. Trained Its Agents in Drinking
description: WASHINGTON, April 13The Internal Revenue Service operated a secret school for undercover agents in which it tested them with liquor and women to see if they could resist disclosing their identities.

title: A Clarification
description: It was incorrectly stated in yesterday's Times that Joseph A DeRose had resigned as senior vice president of the American Stock Exchange because of an inquiry into securities trading. Mr. DeRose has joined a law firm here. Paul Kolton, chairman of the exchange, said yesterday that Mr. DeRose's resignation was for personal reasons and unrelated to any securities inquiry.

title: Slight Gains Won By Bonn Coalition In State Elections
description: KIEL, West Germany, April 13  West Germany's coalition parties scored slight gains tdday in state elections in SchleswigHolstein, reversing, the yearlong upward swing of the opposition Christian Democrats.

title: Brooklyn Physicians Denounce Carey on Malpractice Proposal
description: In a crowded and emotional meeting at the Kings County Medical Society headquarters yasterday, Brooklyn doctors denounced malpractice legislation proposed by Governor Carey and called for basic changes that would, among other things, limit awards and eliminate jury trials for malpractice.

title: Its a BreathFilling Feast
description: RICHWOOD, W. Va., April 13More than 1,000 devotees of the ramp the wild mountain delicacy with the foulodor reputation  showed up at the Richwood High. School cafeteria yesterday to enjoy them along with freshly brewed sassafras tea.

title: JAVITS SEES CURBS ON SAIGON RESCUE
description: WASHINGTON, April 13 (UPI)Senator Jacob K. Javits said today that a congressional resolution would be required before troops could evacuate the estimated 200,000 South Vietnamese citizens whom the administration fears would be punished by the Vietcong for cooperating with the United States.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Audience Cheers Soprano, Winner of Met Audition
description: Carmen Balthrop, a 26yearold soprano, won the lop prize yesterday afternoon at the Metropolitan Opera National Council's auditions finals.

title: CHRYSLER PLANS U.S. SUBCOMPACTS
description: DETROIT, April 14John Riccardo, president of the Chrysler Corporation, said tody that the company planned to offer domestically produced subcompact cars in the future.

title: Europeans Veto U.S. Bid On an Approach to Hanoi
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 14The nine countries of the European Economic Community decided today to turn down an American request that they make an appeal to Hanoi for ceasefire in South Vietnam, diplomats involved in their discussions said here today.

title: TV: A TwoHour Swiss Family Robinson Tonight
description: Tonight (at 8 on ABC) the man who brought you the film The Towering Inferno brings you a television special that could be called The Raging Volcano. Actually the title is The Swiss Family Robinson, and the twohour production is based on the book by Johann Wyss. But the producer is indeed Irwin Allen, and if there is a volcano gurgling in the background, you can bet your Mouseketeers memorabilia Mr. Allen will make the ominous most of it.

title: Israel Unveils the Kfir, a New Supersonic Jet Fighter
description: LYDDA, Israel, April 14A new Israelidesinned and manufactured jet fighter, comparable to the French mirage and Soviet MIG21, was unveiled here today at a festive ceremony attended by Premier Yitzhak Rabin and most of the Israeli Government.

title: U.D.C. FEARS STOPS A BILLION IN WORK
description: ALBANY, April 14  Construction of more than $1billion in nursing homes, hospital additions, facilities for the handicapped and other health projects has been held up, state officials said today, because investors have been frightened by the highly publicized fiscal problems of the Urban Development Corporation.

title: School Administration: A Male Bastion
description: Women educators may be rankled by the title of a report from Albany on The Superintendent of Schools: His Role, Background and Salary. What rankles them far more than the masculine pronoun, however, is the fact that it so accurately reflects the reality in school districts outside New York City.

title: WEEKEND BOXING
description: OSAKA, JapanFreddie Mensan, 131 pounds, Japan, outpointed Toshiharu Mori, 131, Japan, 12 rounds.

title: Paris Energy Talks in Impasse; U. S. and Algeria Lead Factions
description: PARIS, April 14Ten delegations from rich and poor countries came here expecting to spend only a few days drawing up an agenda for a world energy conference this summer, but today they were still deadlocked as the meeting went into its second week.

title: CON EDISON BILLS TO INCREASE 5%
description: Electricity bills will rise by about 5 per cent for most customers of the Consolidated Edison Company this month, because of the steepest monthly fuel adjustment increase in more than a year, the company said yesterday.

title: ThickSkinned Tomato Symbol of Consumer Discontent
description: Over the last few years the tomato has become a symbol for consumer groups of everything they find wrong with the American food supply. Today's super. market tomato is a thickskinned mutant of its former juicy self, designed to be mass grown, mass shipped and mass marketed.

title: No United Brands Fight On S.E.C. Charges Seen
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The United Brands Company, charged by the Securities and Exchange Commission with concealing the payment of bribes to foreign officials, was reported today to be considering signing a consent decree with the S.E.C.

title: Elizabeth Erlanger Dead; ExHead of Artists Society
description: Elizabeth Nachman Erlanger, former president of the American Society of Contemporary Artists, died Wednesday at a nursing home in Goshen, N. Y. She was 73 years old and the widow of Felix M. Erlanger, an executive of the B.V.D. Company.

title: G.T.E. Gets $500Million Order to Expand Iran's Telephone System
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation said yesterday that it had received a $500million contract to update and expand the telephone system of Iran.

title: A Tragic Quick Stop On the Train Ride Home
description: MATAWAN, April 14 (AP) Brace yourselves. We're going to come to a quick stop.

title: SHELLING ANGERS BIG CITY IN DELTA
description: CAN THO, South Vietnam, April 14Two months ago Communist forces in a neighboring province overran a Government position and captured two 105mm. howitzers, Last Saturday night 22 shells fell on Can Tho, killing 11 persons.

title: G.O.P. Man Quits L.I. Race Under Fire
description: ISLIP, L.I., April 14The man whom Suffolk Republicans nominated to fill a vacancy in the county Legislature withdrew today in the face of charges that he had lied about his academic and professional qualifications to party officials.

title: Justices to Say if Military Can Ban Politics on Bases
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Supreme Court agreed today to decide if the armed forces have the right to prohibit political campaigning, by speech or leaflet, in public areas of military bases.

title: Buzz Goodbody, 28, a Director Of Royal Shakespeare, Is Dead
description: LONDON, April 14 (AP) Buzz Goodbody, a director of the Royal Shakespeare Company, was found dead Saturday in her north London home. She was 28 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: More than 100 taxi drivers halted their cabs on Queens Boulevard yesterday blocking evening rushhour traffic and prevented the Transportation Administration from testing an experimental express bus lane between Roosevelt Avenue and Woodhaven Boulevard.

title: SOUTH AFRICA BLAST KILLS 14 WORKERS
description: SASOLBURG, South Africa, April 14 (Reuters)  Seven white workers were killed and seven blacks injured here in an explosion today in the world's first plant that makes oil from coal.

title: U.S. URANIUM CURB ANGERING EUROPE
description: BONN, April 14  A recent detision by the United. States to delay its. imports and exports of enriched uranium has drawn criticism from energy officials in. Western Europe's Common Market, which is heavily dependent on the United States for nuclear fuel.

title: Saigon Hopes Its Forces Can End Xuan Loc Siege
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, April 15South Vietnamese forces were reported holding off the Communists at Xuan Loc last night in the face of continuing bombardment and attacks.

title: Dave Anderson
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 15With a perspective gained from the torture of having finished second in the Masters for the fourth time, Tom Weiskopf appreciates the supremacy of the golfer who won the Masters for the fifth time.

title: Fredric March Dies of Cancer; Stage and Screen Actor Was 77
description: Fredric March, who appeared on the stage and in motion pictures over a span of 50 years, died of cancer yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital in Los Angeles. Mr. March, who was 77 years old, had been hospitalized since April 5.

title: Ban on Exclusive Zoning In Mt. Laurel Questioned
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, April 14 A group of experts on housing and land use at a meeting here today questioned the State Supreme Court's recent Mount Laurel decision that struck down local zoning ordinances that exclude the poor and families with moderate incomes by prohibiting apartments or mandating large lots.

title: The Commitment Now
description: Shorn of wishful thinking, the realities in Vietnam should speedily persuade Congress that its overriding responsibility is to act swiftly to authorize the aid necessary to alleviate human suffering. The way, to expedite approval of the $250 million requested by President Ford for such relief is to separate it from consideration of Mr. Ford's capricious call for $722million in military aid.

title: Czechoslovak Six, Soviet Union Win
description: DUESSELDORF, West Germany, April 14 (UPI)  The unbeaten Soviet Union team stretched its streak to seven games today with a 52 victory over Finland in the world amateur ice hockey championships. Czechoslovakia remained in contention by defeating Sweden, 70.

title: 5 Die in Ohio Fire
description: BELLEFONTAINE, Ohio, April 14 (AP)A mother and four of her eight children died in a fire that swept through a sevenroom home here late yesterday. The dead were identified as Mrs. Ada Garland, about45, and Billy, 14; Agnes, 12; Hugh, 11, and Judy, 8.

title: Paine Webber Net Rises to a Record
description: Paine Webber, Inc., one of Wall Street's top five concerns, reported yesterday that its revenues and earnings both for the quarter and the six months to March 31 were the highest in its 96year history.

title: Memorial Services
description: CHIANGKAISHEK18871975. President of the Republic of China died in Taipei April 5, 1975. A memorial service will be held in the Marble Collegiate Church, 5th Ave. at 29th St. on Wednesday, April 16 at 11:30 A.M., to he conducted by ?? Norman Vincent Peale. All friends a?? invited to attend.

title: Collegians Get Warning on China Trip
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association has warned track and field athletes about a possible loss of eligibility for the remainder of the year if they participate in the historic twoweek trip to China next month.

title: Music: soloists Highlight Tully Organ Dedication
description: The dedicatory events of the new pipe organ in Alice Tully Hall ended Sunday night with a Musica Aeterna Orchestra concert in which E. Power Biggs, Catharine Crozier and Thomas Schippers were solists.

title: Jolly Old Capital Losses
description: Internal Revenue eve is always a joyous time at our house. Grandmother always comes over early in the day to take charge of the kitchen and soon the air is rich with the good smell of roasting check book and grandmother's delicious minced pay voucher.

title: SUNY AllStars Win, 78 to 72
description: ALBANY, April 14Just like a lot of postseason allstar games, the 7872 victory the State University of New York team scored over the City University of New York team in the Albany State University gymnasium tonight was a bit disorganized. However, when it was over, everybody agreed it was worthwhile.

title: Parents Protest Closing Of East Haven Schools
description: EAST HAVEN, Conn., April 14  Angry parents demonstrated through the morning outside Town Hall today, demanding an end to the dispute that closed all 12 public schools in this New Haven suburb.

title: COURT TO REVIEW ACCOUNTING CASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (UPI)  The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether an accounting firm can be brought to trial for negligence under the Securities and Exchange Act by investors in a securities company that goes bankrupt.

title: Connally Denies Seeking Or Accepting Dairy Bribe
description: WASHINGTON, April 14John B. Connally denied today from the witness stand that he had eyer sought or accepted $10,000 in payoffs for helping dairy farmers to obtain increased Federal price supports in 1971.

title: Sadat, Conceding Shortcomings, Vows Changes
description: CAIRO, April 14  President Anwar elSadat, conceding serious shortcomings in Egypt's domestic affairs, vowed today to stamp out corruption, check inflation and seek prosperity and social justice for all, in keeping with the doctrine of Gamal Abdel Nasser, his predecessor.

title: System of Tapping Wave Power Would Use Giant Lopsided Vane
description: Proponents of a plan to extract large amounts of energy from ocean waves have received encouragement from experiments conducted by engineers of Britain's Central Electricity Generating Board and the engineering department of the University of Edinburgh.

title: Phnom Penh, as the Battle Nears
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 14This capital was full of strange scenes today the inevitable contrasts between the confusion and fear at the front and the blissful oblivion of those a few miles away.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SAY IT WITH MUSIC The Committee to Save Grand Central Station swings into action at noon today with a free concert on the overhead ramp encircling the historic terminal. A court decision overturning the landmark status of the terminal is being appealed by the city.

title: Bridge:
description: The next world team championship, the Olympiad in Monte Carlo, is still more than a year away, so most countries have not even established a procedure to select a team.

title: Dodgers Conquer Reds, 52
description: LOS ANGELES, April 14 (AP)  Ron Cey and Jimmy Wynn slammed home runs and Mike Marshall turned in a solid relief performance to lead the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 52 victory over the Cincinnati Reds tonight.

title: U.S. Arms Sales Are Complex
description: Foreign arms sales, currently reaching boom proportions, are carried out through a complex relationship between manufacturers, buying countries and various branches of the United States Government.

title: Concert
description: Several seasoned observers of the contemporary Latin music scene have called Eddie Palmieri the most creative single person making such music today, and after his concert Sunday night at Avery Fisher Hall, one could see what they mean.

title: Saigon Hopes Its Forces Can End Xuan Loc Siege
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, April 15South Vietnamese forces were reported holding off the Communists at Xuan Loc last night in the face of continuing bombardment and attacks.

title: German Ruling Disturbs U.S. Lawyers
description: BONN, April 14West Germany's highest court has approved Government limitations on defense lawyers for an important trial of leftist anarchistsa move that some American jurists say is a blow to principles of free speech and legal protection.

title: Nuggets Triumph, Oust Stars
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 14 (UPI)Ralph Simpson scored 28 points, Mike Green 25, and Mack Calvin 24 in leading the Denver Nuggets to a 115113 victory Over the Utah Stars tonight. Denver captured the Western Division playoff in the American Baseball Association four games to two.

title: Scrutiny of Trial Audience Is Opposed by A.C.L.U.
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 14 (UPI)  The American Civil Liberties Union asked today for a halt to the fingerprinting and photographing of spectators at the trial of two reputed members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army.

title: INVENTORIES DROP RECORD 1.5BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The nation's businesses succeeded in reducing topheavy inventories by a record $1.5billion in February, mainly because auto dealers reduced their bulging stocks, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Assembly Approves Women'sRights Bill
description: TRENTON, April 14The Assembly approved a proposed constitutional amendment this evening that would include equalrights guarantees for women in New Jersey.

title: Connally Denies Seeking Or Accepting Dairy Bribe
description: WASHINGTON, April 14John B. Connally denied today from the witness stand that he had ever sought or accepted $10,000 in payoffs for helping dairy farmers to obtain increased Federal price supports in 1971.

title: U.D.C. FEAR STOPS A BILLION IN WORK
description: ALBANY, April 14  Construction of more than $billion in nursing homes, hospital additions, facilities for the handicapped and other health projects has been held up, state officials said today, because investors have been frightened by the highly publicized fiscal problems of the Urban Development Corporation.

title: STATE LISTS CASE AGAINST CRABIEL
description: ELIZABETH, April 14  The state charged today that J. Edward Crabiel, the New Jersey Secretary of State, and the Franklin Contracting Company he had headed were part of a multifaceted conspiracy to violate state laws regulating the awarding of roadconstruction contracts.

title: U.S. Rights Panel Opposes Abortion Restrictions
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The United States Commission on Civil Rights stated today in a formal report its opposition to a constitutional amendment or legislation restricting the freedom of women to obtain abortions.

title: Job Level Drops For Adult Males And TeenAgers
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (UPI)The Government said today that the number of employed adult men and teenagers decreased significantly during the first three months of 1975, but employment among adult women remained about the same as the year before.

title: Bank Opens Cairo Branch
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, fourth largest bank in the country, announced yesterday that it had oppened a bank in Cairo to become the first American bank to establish a branch operation in the Egyptian capital. The First National City Bank has a representative office there and the Chase Manhattan Bank has a joint venture.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Federal Home Loan Bank Board has announced that savings and loan associations are authorized now to offer their depositors the opportunity pay their bills by check out of their savings accounts.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Tuesday, April 15, 1975

title: Justices Take Charge Of a Hot Dog Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Supreme Court took jurisdiction of a dispute over attempts by New Orleans to decide who can sell hot dogs from pushcarts in the city's French Quarter. An ordinance of 1972 prohibited such merchandizing except by those who had been in the business eight years or more.

title: Jury Reports Essex Jail Still Needs Improvement
description: NEWARK, April 14An Essex County grand jury reported today that although conditions had improved at the Essex County Jail in the last year, administration of the fouryearold facility was marked by a lack of thoroughness, efficiency and professionalism.

title: Islanders Feeling Less Strain
description: PITTSBURGH, April 14Breaking free from a web of emotions that entangled them in their opening playoff series with the Rangers, the New York Islanders have begun a difficult, if passionless four  of  seven  game series with the Pittsburgh Penguins. The Islanders were beaten last night, 54, by a team that lost only five games at home in the regular season, the same record that the Islanders boast.

title: Madison Square Garden Is Said To Be for Sale for $60Million
description: Madison Square Garden, said by its owners to be operating in the red, is up for sale for at least $60million, a realestate consultant for the corporation owning the sports and recreation complex said yesterday.

title: Venezuela Plans to Reduce Her Oil Production for 1975
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 14 (Reuters)Venezuela plans to cut oil production to 2.4 million barrels a day by the end of the year from an average of 2.6 million in the first 100 days of 1975, the minister of Mines and Hydrocarbons, Valentin Hernandez, said today.

title: DR. JOHN G. LANG
Bronx Youth, 16, Is Killed In a Subway Accident
description: A 16yearold Bronx youth was injured fatally yesterday evening at a subway station in upper Manhattan after his foot had slipped betwen the platform and a departing train, the police reported.

title: Amex Reports Modest Quarter Profit
description: In a 10minute annual membership meeting yesterday, the American Stock Exchange reported that increased trading volume and the growth of its options market resulted in a modest firstquarter profit.

title: ExMayor Is Sued Over '67 Phone Taps
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, April 14 Patricia Q. Sheehan, State Commissioner of Community Affairs, was charged today with authorizing the tapping of a community leader's telephone by a police confidential squad in 1967, when she was Mayor here.

title: Top Appointee Is Sought For the Inquiry on Attica
description: Twentythree New York legislators, including 13 Representatives, yesterday urged the appointment of the very best attorney available to investigate a charge that the chief Attica prosecutor had covered up possible crimes by law enforcement officers.

title: Israel Unveils the Kfir, a New Supersonic Jet Fighter
description: LYDDA, Israel, April 14A new Israelidesinned and manufactured jet fighter, comparable to the French mirage and Soviet MIG21, was unveiled here today at a festive ceremony attended by Premier Yitzhak Rabin and most of the Israeli Government.

title: In Paris, French Styles Upstaged by Hong Kong
description: PARIS, April 12The Hong Kong people scored a minor coup around here. They produced a lavish show of hometown fashions and upstaged the French.

title: Larry Parks, Actor, Is Dead; Won Acclaim for Jolson Story
description: Larry Parks, the actor who reached Hollywood stardom with his forceful performance in The Jolson Story in 1946 but whose acting career all but came to a halt in 1951 when he admitted past membership in the Communist party, died Sunday night of a heart attack in his home in Studio City, Calif. He was 60 years old.

title: Today Is April 15, Last Day for Tax Returns
Early Portrait by Rembrandt Stolen In Armed Robbery at Boston Fine Arts
description: BOSTON, April 14 (AP)Two men, one wielding a pistol, stole a painting by Rembrandt valued at about $500,000 during the noon hour today from a gallery of the Boston Museum of Fine Arts.

title: GENERAL IN ULSTER REBUKED BY BRITISH
description: LONDON, April 14Merlyn Reeos, the British Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, rebuked the top British military man in the province today for criticizing his program of releasing detainees.

title: Mayer Tops Stone
description: DENVER, April 14 (AP)Sandy Mayer, who has been inconsistent this season, upset fifthseeded Allan Stone of Australia, 36, 76, 62, in the opening round of a W.C.T. tournament today.

title: Times Picks Rothman For Subsidiaries Post
description: The appointment of Dr. John Rothman as director of research and information technology for The New York Times Company's subsidiaries was announced yesterday by Sydney Gruson, executive vice president. He will be responsible for the use by the company's subsidiaries of uptodate computer technology in informationprocessing techniques.

title: SENATE UNIT EARS TROOPS AS GUARD FOR VIETNAMESE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Senate Foreign Relations Committee balked today at the Ford Administration's request for broad Presidential authority to use American troops to protect the evacuation of the Americans and a number of Vietnamese citizens from South Vietnam.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Boston vs. Houston

title: Making New York Green Involves Reams of Red Tape
description: It was perhaps symbolic that New York's first citywide community greening conference was held at St, Mark's in the Bouwerie. That lovely, historic and decaying church dates from 1799, when New York was green. And the people who met together there last Saturday are determined to make New York green again.

title: 2 ACCUSED OF PLOT TO MURDER WOMAN
description: EDISON, April 14 (UPI)State police undercover agents, posing as hired killers, arrested two men today for allegedly plotting to kil the former wife of one of the men, authorities said.

title: Moscow Says It Will Send Food To Areas Now Held by Vietcong
description: MOSCOW, April 14The Soviet Union announced today that it would send food and medicine to areas in South Vietnam that have come under Vietcong control.

title: House Votes Mortgage Aid To Save Homes of Jobless
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 The House of Representatives passed today a bill that would provide for the lending of Federal funds to the unemployed to help them cover the mortgages on their homes if foreclosure were imminent.

title: ACCORD ON TOTAL FOR BUDGET SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The chairman of the new House Budget Committee said today that his committee, its Senate counterpart and the Ford Administration were much closer together than most people realized in their budget estimates for the new fiscal year.

title: PORTUGAL INSISTS SOCIALISM IS AIM
description: LISBON, April 14A major spokesman for Portugal's ruling High Council of the Revolution made it clear today that the country was heading toward socialism regardless of the outcome of the election April 25.

title: Judge Moritt Sues Nadjari and Others Over His Indictment
description: Fred G. Moritt, a retired Civil Court judge, filed a $150million suit in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday against the state's special prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, and 12 other persons in connection with a grandjury indictment of the judge a year ago on charges of conspiracy, perjury, grand larceny and witnesstampering.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Dave Kingman, the outfielder acquired from the Giants who hits home runs and also strikes out, went down swinging three straight times against Jim Lonborg Ed Kranepool played first base instead of John Milner who had not been hitting. Neither had Jerry Grote, the catcher, who got his first hit of the season off Lonborg. . . . Jon Matlack pitches tonight against the Phils' Wayne Twitchell: . . . Helmet Day is on Saturday at Shea Stadium, when the Mets play Chicago. Batting helmets will be given to all youngsters up to 16 years.

title: Street Fighting Erupts in Beirut After the Bus Ambush
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 14Street fighting between Palestinian guerrillas and armed militiamen of a rightwing Lebanese party paralyzed Beirut today as machinegun fire and exploding rockets caused many casualties.

title: Article 2  No Title
Sammartino Wins
Jackson Seesa Charade
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Senator Henry M. Jackson opened a new attack on the Ford Administration tonight, accusing it of trying to force Israel into territorial withdrawals that prejudice her security and increase the risks of war.

title: XEROX SETS LAYOFFS FOR MAY AND JUNE
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., April 14 (UPI)The Xerox Corporation will dimlss between 250 and 350 salaried emFloyes between May 1 and June 30, company officials announced todaY. L Most of the dismissals will take place nt Xerox's Rochester area facilities, but some will occur at other plants throughout the nation, a spokesman said.

title: Wiretapping Trial of Two Sons of H. L. Hunt Is Postponed When Supreme Court Does Not Act on Case
description: The telephone wiretapping trial of two sons of the late oil billionaire H. L. Hunt of Dallas was automatically postponed yesterday under an order of Judge Halbert O. Woodward in United States District Court in Lubbock, Tex.

title: Celtics Top Rockets and Lead Series
description: BOSTON, April 14 (UPI)John Havlicek scored 30 points and six Boston players scored in double figures tonight as the Boston Celtics tonight the Houston Rockets, 123.106, in the opening game of their National Basketball Association quarterfinal series at Boston Garden.

title: House Votes Mortgage Aid To Save Homes of Jobless
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The House of Representatives passed today a bill that would provide for the lending of Federal funds to the unemployed to help them cover the mortgages on their homes if foreclosure were imminent.

title: Ranson Paid to the Kidnappers Of Bulgari Is Put at $16Million
description: ROME, April 14Giovanni Bulgari, coowner of the internationally renowned jewelers, was released here early this morning by kidnappers who had been holding him for 31 days.

title: I.R.S. Chief Says He Halted Liquor Use in T raining Agents Because It Was Inappropriate
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Donald W. Alexander, Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service, told a House subcommittee today that he had found the use of women and alcohol to test undercover agents an inappropriate activity and that the practice had been discontinued.

title: BankAmerica Profits Up; Philip Morris Posts Rise
description: Three more giant banking concerns  the BankAmerica Corporation, Charter New York Corporation and Mellon National Corporationyesterday reported sharply higher firstquarter earnings, continuing a trend that started a week ago when Citicorp released its figures.

title: People and Business
description: Walter B. Wriston, chairman of Citicorp, parent of First National City Bank, said at a meeting of the Financial Women's Association of New York yesterday that he looks for a continuation of the almost uninterrupted yearlong decline in shortterm interest rates. We haven't seen the bottom yet, he said.

title: Conigliaro, in 2d Comeback, Faces Hunter Here Today
description: Tony Conigliaro playing baseball? No more improbabile than, say, Catfish Hunter pitching for the Yankees.

title: Jordan Shifting More Police to Patrol
description: JERSEY CITY, April 14Mayor Paul Jordan announced today a reorganization and civilianization of the city's police department designed to free 75 more members of the 1,200man force for patrol duty.

title: Students Vote Strike Over Brown's Budget
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., April 14Students at Brown University voted today to reject an administration response to their demands and to strike for the rest of the week to protest budget cuts and university budgetmakinn procedures.

title: INVENTORIES DROP RECORD 1.5BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The nation's businesses succeeded in reducing topheavy inventories by a record $1.5billion in February, mainly because auto dealers reduced their bulging stocks, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: SUBPOENA ISSUED FOR PRISON DATA
description: A legislative committee announced yesterday that it had subpoenaed confidential records of the State commission of Correction, a watchdog state agency that has been accused of concealing prison irregularities.

title: Nets Must Tighten Defense
description: ST. LOUIS, April 14After 89 games, the fondest hope of the New York Nets has boiled down to being allowed to return here Wednesday for the sixth game of their American Basketball Association playoff series with the Spirits of St. Louis.

title: Kissinger's Latin Trip Is Set for April 2327
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Secretary of State Kissinger will visit Argentina, Brazil and Venezuela from April 23 to 27, the State Department announced today.

title: Assembly Refuses to Back Change to Generic Drugs
description: TRENTON, April 14  The Assembly today defeated legislation that would have permitted pharmacists in New Jersey to substitute generic drugs for identical drugs under their brand names prescribed by physicians.

title: Advertising
description: Just a little over 60 years ago the Audit Bureau of Circulations was created by advertisers, agencies and publishers with the avowed purpose of bringing order out of chaos.

title: FRIEDA SHPRENTZ
description: Frieda R. Levine Shprentz, who retired 10 years ago as principal of Public School 24 in Brooklyn, died Sunday in Kings County Hospital. She was 79 years old and lived at 60 East 17th Street, Brooklyn.

title: People in Sports
description: Larry Brown, who orchestrates the Denver Nuggets by shouting plays from the sidelines for 48 minutes, was named the American Basketball Association's coach of the year yesterday.

title: Chess:
description: In repent years, the increased grasp of positional alteration has brought about an alteration in defense: Before the turn of the century, the great defensive wizard Wilhelm Steinitz would resist straightforwardly when caught in an inferior position, but there are few who care to follow him now.

title: OTTO KOEGEL, 83, LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: Otto E. Koegel, former chief counsel of 20th CenturyFox and a member of the State Bicentennial Commission, died Sunday at Kaywood Farm, his home in Granite Springs, N. Y. He was 83 years old.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Fete for Israel's 27th Year
H.H. SCOTT, ENGINEER AND INVENTOR, DIES
description: Hermon Hosmer Scott, electrical engineer and founder and former president of H. H. Scott, Inc., of Maynard, Mass., highfidelity equipmentmanufacturers, died Sunday in NewtonWellesley Hospital, Newton, Mass. He; was 66 years old and lived in Lincoln, Mass.

title: Flying Over Cuba
description: MIAMI, April 14Flying over Cuba is an eerie experience. Cuba, after all, is a Communist nation with which the United States has no diplomatic relations. Cuba is, by Government definition, at least an adversary, sometimes a downright enemy.

title: REDS 3 MILES FROM PHNOM PENH; REFUGEES JAM MAIN ROAD TO CITY; SAIGON TROOPS HOLDING XUAN LOC
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, April 15The Communist insurgents drove to within three miles of the western edge of the city yesterday. To the north, one report said, the insurgents raised their flags over factories less than five miles from the edge of the city, along Route 5.

title: For Frustrated Ranger Fans, Islanders Become Alternative
description: At least the circus don't choke! yelled a frustrated New York Ranger fan just after his season had ended abruptly last Thursday night at Madison Square Garden. Suddenly in 11 seconds of overtime against the New York Islanders, all the hopes of spring, winter and autumn had gone up in smoke, leaving just the circus behind at the Garden, and for the ninth successive season Ranger fans had only these alternatives:

title: Stage: Constant Wife
description: There will be many people who will wish to see Ingrid Bergman on Broadway, and for them a word to the effect that she opened last night at the Shubert Theater in a revival of W. Somerset Maugham's play The Constant Wife should prove sufficient. They need read no further, except to be advised that it is a limited engagement.

title: SENATE UNIT BARS TROOPS AS GUARD FOR VIETNAMESE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14,The Senate Foreign Relations Committee balked today at the Ford Administration's request for broad Presidential authority to use American troops to protect the evacuation of the American and a number of South Vietnamese citizens from South Vietnam.

title: Books of the Times
description: I suppose it finally depends on how you feel about the subjectwhether or not you're moved by Phil Berger's The Last Laugh: The World of the StandUp Comics. I mean I felt my interest and readingrate picking up whenever Mr. Berger mentions Lord Buckley or Jonathan Winterstwo comedians I happen to find engaging. Because I have an aberrant affection for Buckley's hipster routineson Gandhi (The Hip Gan), Aesop's Fables (The Housedog and the Wolf), and Jesus Christ (But I'm gonna put a cat on you was the sweetest gaaaawwwnest wailingest cat that ever stomped on this sweetsingin' sphere. And they call this hyar cat. . . . the NAZ.)I was curious to learn that Buckley lived his entire life as if he were a genuine English lord and was a master at making his friends finance the charade. And because anything Mr. Winters does seem to make me laugh, I even smiled at Mr. Berger's description of Mr. Winters's wandering into a drugstore in Mamaroneck, N.Y., and pretending he was A Mexican outlaw from just up the line called the Kisco Kid.

title: Flying Relief Client Proves to Be a Case Of Plane High Life
description: Welfare is a problem that sends some people right up in the air. But there is at least one client who came out of thin air to get on the rolls, according to the latest findings of the state's Acting Welfare Inspector General, Ralph A. Cipriani.

title: Amex and OTC Show increase In Prices as Trading Picks Up
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market rose sharply yesterday in steppedup trading as confidence in the economy seems to be increasing.

title: Recital
description: Renata Babak, a Ukrainian mezzosoprano who defected from the Bolshoi Opera during the Soviet company's Italian tour in 1973, made her New York debut on Sunday night at Carnegie Hail. The event came a few years too late, one would guess, to show her at her best, although Miss Babak has a big, if imperfectly controlled, voice, and a temperament to match.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: WNYCFM SWITCHES TO QUADRAPHONICS
description: WNYCFM, the municipal radio station, will broadcast all its programs in quadraphonic sound.

title: Message From Dar
description: The Organization of African Unity indulged in its usual verbal cannonading against South Africa at last week's meeting in DaresSalaam. But behind the rhetoric the message was clear: The black leaders support negotiations with the white Government in Cape Town aimed at the peaceful transition of Rhodesia to majority rule and Namibia (SouthWest Africa) to independence.

title: Walton Criticism of U.S. Stirs Furor
description: Bill Walton's offcourt statements last week critical of the United States Government have aroused a storm of protests from the people of Portland, Ore.

title: Stage: Gorky's Zykovs at Equity Library Theater
description: Each new play by Maxim Gorky  Enemies, Summerfolk and now The Zykovs (at the Equity Library Theater)is a discovery. The plays, deeply Russian in spirit and universal in their understanding of people in stress, belong in the active international repertory of classics.

title: Morton Signed by Giants
description: Quietly, so the World Football League would not get aroused, the Giants have signed their quarterback, Craig Morton, to a threeyear contract.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Cambodian Communist insurgents were within three miles of the western edge of Phnom Penh yesterday, and to the north of the capital, one report said, the insurgents raised their flags over factories less than five miles from the city's edge. The insurgents' objective seemed to be to cut off the city from Pochentong airport, which is its last supply link with the outside world, and then move into the city. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: NATIONAL PAY TV PLANNED FOR 1976
description: A national paytelevision network may be in operation next year, by means of a domestic communications satellite, if the Federal Communications Commission approves the plans of a payTV programing service and two major cable television systems.

title: 10 ExNationalist Officials Freed by China Arrive in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, April 14Ten former highranking Chinese Nationalists, freed by China in a special amnesty last month, arrived in Hong Kong today hoping to obtain visas for Taiwan.

title: LOSSES ARE POSTED BY CHASE MORTGAGE
description: In a special report to shareholders, the Chase Manhattan Mortgage and Realty Trust of Boston said that its operating losses were currently running at about $3million a month.

title: Data on United Brands Bribery Gathered by Honduras Group
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, April 14A special Honduran investigating commission has received evidence from the United Brands Company that it paid a large bribe to top Honduran officials to obtain reduction of a banana export surcharge, sources close to the commission said today.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: DU PONT EARNINGS WORST SINCE 1947
description: WILMINGTON, Del., April 14E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. reported today that earnings in the first quarter of this year were the worst in almost 30 years.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, APRIL 15, 1975

title: Japanese Voting Shows a Swing to Right
description: TOKYO, April 14Nearly complete returns from Japan's local elections pointed to a moderate swing back toward the political right today after a steady drift to the left in recent years.

title: Major Changes Proposed in System of Leasing Oil and Gas Tracts Beyond 3Mile Limit
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Senator Ernest F. Hollings, chairman of the Commerce Committee's National Ocean Polley Study, proposed today major changes in the system of leasing federally owned offshore lands beyond the threemile coastal limits of the United States for oil and gas development by private industry.

title: URBAN SITE ASKED IN CAROLINA TRIAL
description: WASHINGTON, N.C., April 14 (AP)  The prosecution agreed today that the trial of Joanne Little, a black woman, accused of murdering a white jailer she said was trying to rape her, should be held in another county because of deliberate and excessive publicity.

title: VOLKSWAGEN SETS PRICE RISE OF 8%
description: Volkswagen of America yesterday announced price increases averaging 8 per cent on Volkswagen cars, including its newest model, the Rabbit, and 5.2 per cent on its highpriced Audi models. The price rises, the second on 1975 models, were attributed by the company to the decline of the dollar's value in relation to the West German mark.

title: MRS. PERON GETS ELECTION BOOST
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 14President Isabel Martinez de Peron emerged with a sorely needed political boost from elections yesterday in the small northeastern Argentine proyince of Misiones.

title: A Rembrandt Stolen
FORD DUE TO BLOCK RAIL CLERKS' STRIKE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) President Ford is expected to invoke emergency action to block a nationwide rail strike threatened at 12:01 A.M. Friday by the Brotherhood of Railway and Airline Clerks.

title: Bomber Testifies That Minister Blessed Dynamiting of Schools in Book Dispute
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., April 14A confessed bomber testi, fied in Federal court today that on the night he was sent to dynamite a school here, the Rev. Marvin Horan, a Fundamentalist minister, read from Scripture to bless the attack.

title: Article 1  No Title
Pro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: SIKKIMESE DECIDING ON LINK WITH INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, April 14 (ReutersThe people of Sikkim voted today on whether their country on the border of Chineseruled Tibet should abolish the monarchy and merge with neighboring India.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Issue and Debate
description: Sixteen years ago, when chap steak cost 59 cents a pound and teenyboppers blew their bubblegum money on Presley records, there were 16 baseball teams, 12 pro football teams, eight pro basketball teams and six pro hockey clubs.

title: Kosygin Bids Arabs Close Ranks for Geneva Talks
description: MOSCOW, April 14Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin warned the Arab nations today that they must be more unified or rick being at a disadvantage in dealing with Israel and the United States at the Geneva conference, on the Middle East.

title: High School Seminar Focuses on Stock Market
description: A group of high school sophomores in town for a seminar on the economy got a lesson on the stock market yesterday from James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Notes on People
description: Painting to stacks of telegrams and letters, San Diego's Roman Catholic Bishop, the Most Rev. Leo T. Maher, predicted yesterday that other Bishops and even Protestant church leaders would follow him in denying communion to members of the National Organization for Women and other proabortion groups.

title: Opposition Still Denied A Part in Administration
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 14  President Nguyen Van Thieu announced a new Cabinet today, but there was mounting evidence that his Government was virtually paralyzed.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: Phoenix vs. Quebec

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Apollo Finds It Hard for the Show to Go On
description: The owners of Harlem's Apollo Theater are finding it hard to stick by the old show business sloganthe show must go onin face of the new show business economics.

title: Gunman Seizes 4 as Hostages In a Tenement House in Bronx
description: A distraught gunman seized four hostages, including a handicapped 11yearold girl and a set of twins, and barricaded himself in an apartment in a Bronx tenement last night after arguing with his girlfriend and exchanging gunfire with police officers.

title: Con Ed's Rate Rise
description: Three factors combine to reinforce the recommendation of the professional staff of the State Public Service Commission that the $202million interim rise in electricity rates sought by Consolidated Edison be rejected:

title: Phnom Penh, as the Battle Nears
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 14This capital was full of strange scenes today the inevitable contrasts between the confusion and fear at the front and the blissful oblivion of those a few miles away.

title: PRICE DROP SHOWN IN GOLD FUTURES
description: Gold futures dropped sharply here yesterday following a decline abroad. The April delivery on the Commodity Exchange here ended at $164.8 an ounce, down from $171.5, the lowest level and the sharpest drop in many months.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: Islanders vs. Pittsburgh

title: Legislators, on Returning, Confront Unsettled Issues
description: ALBANY, April 14  The state's 210 legislators return tomorrow from a 20day recess to pick up virtually all of the unsettled issues they faced when they convened in January. These include the questions of aid to schools, transit systems and local governments, constitutional equality for women, and a tighter ethical code for the legislators themselves.

title: Hanoi Tactics Stress Guerrillas
description: The North Vietnamese forces appear to United States military sources to be shifting to guerrilla tactics in the suburbs of Saigon and in the Mekong Delta. The object apparently is to divert Saigon's forces from the main battle at Xuan Loc. The geographical scope and the tactical variety of the Communists' operations expose one of Saigon's major weaknesses: a shortage of manpower. Saigon's problem is that a force of 60,000 regulars has to be responsible in theory for a wide variety of missions.

title: Sihanouk Reasserts He Plans To Withdraw From Public Life
description: PARIS, April 14 (Reuters)Prince Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia affirmed in a broadcast interview today that he would withdraw from public life after the war ends.

title: Albany's Fiscal Dilemma
