L'Ensemble gave its fifth and final concert of the season in this oldworld environment on Sunday night, a program of cantatas: Stravinsky's one essay in the form, Bach's Hunting Cantata and a baroque pastiche by Joshua Rifkin entitled Last Night Said, Cantata for the Third Saturday After Shea Stadium based on three songs by the Beatles.

title: Bridge:
description: Excitement and tedium, a rare combination, marked the final of the district Grand National Team Championship here Sunday. The excitement came from the score, which left the match in the balance at the halfway stage and the threequarter mark.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
Sawhill Appointed To Succeed Hester As N.Y.U. President
description: John C. Sawhill, former Federal. Energy Administrator, was named yesterday to be the 12th president of New York University.

title: CYANAMID SALES AND NET SET HIGHS
description: Citing flourishing sales of fertilizers and pesticides, the American Cyanamid Company reported record sales and earnings yesterday while another chemical giant, E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., blamed weak automotive, textile, and home construction markets for its worst earnings performance since 1947.

title: Indiana Standard's Net Tumbles 33.2%
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) reported yesterday that its net income fell 33.2 per cent in the first quarter of 1975 to $146.2million from the yearearlier $219million. Earnings per share fell to $1 from 1.57.

title: Pound in Plunge on Economic Anxiety
description: LONDON, April 21Renewed anxieties over the state of the British economy caused the pound to fall sharply today on foreignexchange markets.

title: 73.3% Decline Reported
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation, the nation's No. producer of both copper and coal, cited the recession in reporting a 73.3 per cent plunge in its firstquarter earnings, which were announced yesterday.

title: Paris Issues Statement
description: PARIS, April 21The French Government appealed urgently today for a quick resumption of negotiations to carry out the 1973 Paris agreements on Vietnam, accompanied by a ceasefire covering all South Vietnam.

title: Grant Expected to Name Sears Man as President
description: Robert Anderson, a top executive of Sears, Roebuck & Co., is expected to become president of the W. T. Grant Company here early next month.

title: 3 SEIZED IN THEFT OF PENSION CHECKS
description: As part of what the city's Commissioner of Investigation, Nicholas Scoppetta, described as a continuing inquiry into reports of thievery at the city pension office, a $6,600ayear clerk and two alleged accomplices were arrested yesterday and charged with stealing pension checks worth $15,000 in the last three months.

title: DrugSmuggling Logistics Bizarre and Often Fatal
description: The rainy season has ended in Chulumani, Bolivia, and on the steeply terraced mountainside, Juan Mamani Is crouching in his small plot of coca plants, beginning to strip the tiny green leaves that will be his first crop of the year. He will pack the leaves into bales, called tambors, and sell the 300 pounds he harvests for $250.

title: ExOfficials Reported Surrendering in Cambodia
description: A number of important figures in the fallen Cambodian government have eft their refuge in the French Embassy in Phnom Penh to surrender to the Cambodian Communists, according to reports yesterday that could not be confirmed, and many of the thousands of Cambodian civilians who fled to neighboring Thailand were said to be returning home.

title: HOUSE SUPPORTS ROAD FUNDS PLAN FOR 150,000 JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, April 21In this Congressional session's first major confrontation between employment and environment priorities, the House of Representatives voted today for jobs.

title: Radio
First Period Gains 9%
In Memoriam
Rich Family Loses Power in Bitter Feud With Marcos
description: MANILA  President Ferdinand E. Marcos and a multimillionaire who was once his patron are pitted against each other in a bitter feud in which the President stands accused of using his martial law powers to amass enormous wealth for his relatives and friends.

title: Baseball Box Scores and Standings
10YEAR RULE ENDS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 21President Nguyen Van Thieu, denouncing the United States as untrustworthy, resigned tonight after 10 years in office.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
FELICIANO PEPPERS ACT WITH VARIETY
description: Jos Feliciano plays Spanish classicaltype guitar pieces, does impressions of Top 40 radio commercials, sings of Puerto Rican attitudes about New York, unveils some mildish rock' n' roll, performs reggae and rock boogie and, safe as milk, covering many bases, proves himself a classic nineteensixties allround entertainer.

title: Lynch Has Operation For Cancer of Throat
description: TRENTON, April 21 (AP)Senator John A. Lynch, Democrat of Middlesex, was operated on for throat cancer over the weekend. legislative aides reported today.

title: Kennedy Leads Ford In Popularity Survey
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, is the only one of six Democratic Presidential potentials whose current popularity surpasses President Ford, the Harris Poll reported yesterday, However, two others are on a par with Mr. Ford.

title: Advertising
description: Some TV aspirin commercials condition people to think that arthritis is a minor illness and lead some sufferers to selfdiagnosis and selfprescription, the Arthritis Foundation believes.

title: Florida Takes Control of Development of the Keys
description: MIAMI, April 21The development of the Florida Keys, a 130mile chain of tropical islands, has been placed under the control of the state authoriies.

title: HATHAWAY BACKS ECOLOGY VALUES
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Stanley K. Hathaway, former Republican Governor of Wyoming, assured the Senate Interior Committee today that, if confirmed as Secretary of the Interior, he would strive conscientiously to find the fine line between protecting the environment and developing the nation's resources.

title: LEO W. GEISMAR
description: Leo W. Geismar, retired treasurer of B. T. Babbitt, Inc.. manufacturer of household cleaners, died Saturday at St. Petersburg Beach, Fla. He lived in Westmont. N. J.

title: Broadway Host to Off Off Broadway Team
description: For about an hour yesterday, Broadway became showcase for Off Off Broadway.

title: A Shift in U.S. Policy
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Administration sources said today that President Ford two or three weeks ago ordered a hands off policy that neither supported nor abandoned President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam.

title: High Tides Around New York
G. M. Pins Hopes on a Small Cadillac
description: DETROIT, April 21  The Cadillac division of the General Motors Corporation released today the details of its new small Seville, a model that was born in the gloom of the energy crisis as a G.M. hope for recouping some of its lost earnings.

title: College and School Results
Music: Debut for Concerts Unlimited
description: Chamber Concerts Unlimited is an organization whose goal is to bring music into nursing homes, oldage centers, prisons and other places ordinarily not visited by performing groups. If the group's debut program, presented at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night as a showcase event, was a fair sample, the institutions will be getting concerts of real quality.

title: Supreme Court Begins Review of the Death Penalty
description: WASHINGTON, April 21at I P.M. today a low buzzer sounded in the huge square courtroom of the Supreme Court. The chatter stopped; the heavy curtains in the front of the room parted; the television artists poised to make their sketches.

title: GOLD SPOT MARKET IS CLEARED BY U.S
description: WASHINGTON, April 21The Justice Department's Antitrust Division said today that it had no objection at this time to the creation of a spot market for gold that would be modeled on the London gold market.

title: Accident Rule Voted
description: The State Senate gave final approval yesterday to a major change in the tort law. It would permit a person who is partly at fault in an accident to collect damages for the part of the accident that is attributable to the other party. Page 72.

title: Unheeded Fire Alarm
description: The Beame administration's proposal to postpone for one year the 1978 deadline for installing sprinklers highrise commercial buildings represents a bow expediency in the face of a clear danger to hundreds thousands of office workers in this city.

title: 2 Denied U.S. Trip To China
description: Two athletes from Louisiana State University were dropped from a United States track and field team yesterday shortly after the Amateur Athletic Union had listed them among five college male athletes on a 66member squad to compete in China next month. The National Collegiate Athletic Association has threatened to declare ineligible any N.C.A.A. athlete who makes the trip.

title: Plans Rethought for Old buildings of Distinction
description: The city has decided, at least for the time being, not to devote any funds toward refurbishing two old, architecturally distinguished buildings it owns just north of City Hall.

title: 10YEAR RULE ENDS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 21President Nguyen Van Thieu, denouncing the United States as untrustworthy, resigned tonight after 10 years in office.

title: Treasury Bills Rise At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Next Steps in Vietnam
description: The resignation of Nguyen Van Thieu as President of South Vietnam lessens the probability of a bloody fight to the finish that had been haunting the city of Saigon. An entirely new situation now exists, and the Vietnamese parties have at last a clear opportunity for an orderly political evolution consistent with the 1973 Paris agreements.

title: Panel Voices Fears for National Institutes of Health
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 Fears for the future of the nation's foremost medical research establishment were voiced today by a panel of leading American scientists and science administrators.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
GOING OUT Guide
description: PAGING THE PUBLIC

title: HOUSE SUPPORTS ROAD FUNDS PLAN FOR 150,000 JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, April 21In this Congressional session's first major confrontation between employment and environment priorities, the House of Representatives voted today for jobs.

title: Court Told of Spying on Attica Defense
description: BUFFALO, April 21A 26yearold woman said under oath here today that she had spied on the Attica legal defense team for 14 months for the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: DA NANG SCARCITY OF FOOD REPORTED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 21A United Nations relief representative has reported after a weekend visit to the Communistcontrolled South Vietnamese city of Da Nang that some food rationing has been instituted there because of shortages.

title: Dividends
Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Legacy of Wounded Knee: Hatred, Violence and Fear
description: PINE RIDGE, S.D.  The week of April 2026 has been proclaimed as Law and Order Week on the Pine. Ridge Oglala Sioux Reservation.

title: NINE NEW SERIES IN FALL SET BY NBC
description: Series starring Glenn Ford, Tony Curtis, George Peppard and Lee Grant are among the nine new shows selected by NBCTV for its fall schedule, which otherwise is marked by an infusion of medical dramas and contemporary situation comedies. Canceled from the present prime time schedule are The Smothers Brothers Show, The Mac Davis Show, Sunshine, The Bob Crane Show, Adam 12, Lucas Tanner and the Monday night movies.

title: 183,277 Honda Motorcycles Being Recalled Over Defect
description: TOKYO, April 21 (UPI) The Honda Motor Company said today that it would recall 183277 motocycles sold at home and abroad for replacement of defective parts.

title: MICHAEL PRENDIVILLE
description: Michael Prendiville, a paper handler for The New York Times, died early last Sunday morning, apparently of a heart attack, while driving from work to his home in Maspeth, Queens. He was 48 years old. Mr. Prendiville, a native of Castle Island, Ireland, is survived by his widow, the former Sheila Murphy; a son, Michael, and two daughters, Marie and Cathy.

title: Short Interest on Big Board Set Record High in Month to April 15
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that its short interest position totaled a record of 26,085,879 shares April 15, compared with 25,992,366 shares a month earlier.

title: Paine, Webber Payout Set
description: Paine, Webber, Inc., parent company of Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., stockbrokers, said yesterday it would pay a dividend of 10 cents a share June 3 to holders of record on May 13. The brokerage house last paid a dividend of 7  cents a share in June, 1973.

title: FACTORY ORDERS OFF 36% IN MARCH
description: WASHINGTON, April 21New orders flowing to manufacturers of durable goods weakened in March following a brief rebound in February, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Marcos Grants Concessions to Moslems in Mindanao
description: MANILA, April 21  President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that he had granted concessions to Moslem groups in Mindanao in the hope of moving toward a settlement of the protracted rebellion there.

title: Concert: Klara Barlow
description: Klara Barlow made her New York recital debut in 1954 as a coloratura soprano, and her Metropolitan Opera debut as Leonore in Fidelio in 1971. But she didn't really make a mark on this city until last season, with a shortnotice substitution as Isolde. Sunday night was thus billed as her major New York concert debut, and it was an occasion that mixed intensity and eccentricity.

title: Sawhill Appointed To Succeed Hester As N.Y.U. President
description: John C. Sawhill, former Federal Energy Administrator, was named yesterday to be the 12th president of New York University.

title: Stocks Move Ahead; Dow Climbs by 7.43
description: The stock market registered its ninth advance yesterday in the last 10 sessions in heavier trading.

title: Muscular Dystrophy Budget
description: The Muscular Dystrphy As sociation said yesterday that it had proved a record research bbudget of more than $8million. The funds include an initial allotment og $327,755 to establish a neuromuscular research center at the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis.

title: VIETNAM FIGHTING VIRTUALLY CEASES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 22Fighting in South Vietnam virtually ceased after President Nguyen Van Thieu's resignation last night, highly informed military sources reported today.

title: Cloud Over Meskill
description: The Senate is scheduled to vote today on the nomination of former Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut to sit as a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuitbut, unfortunately, it does not yet have all the facts necessary for a sound judgment on his qualifications and abilities.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug announced yesterday that the House Committee on Public Works and Transportation had voted out her bill to provide Federal reimbursement to cities for protection of foreign and diplomatic missions. She said that favorable action by the House would give the city $2.5million for the corning fiscal year.

title: 13 Go on Trial in Chile; 2 U.S. Lawyers Barred
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 22 (AP)Thirteen alleged leftist revolutionaries are being tried by a military court on charges of illegal possession of arms.

title: Stage: Lillian Hellman's Sad, Comic Autumn Garden Revived
description: Without foundation grants and with severely limited income, the three  year old Joseph Jefferson Theater Company, under the artistic direction of Cathy Roskam, is a paragon of Off Off Broadway resourcefulness.

title: Price of Sugar Dips In City Food Survey
description: The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City dropped slightly last week, 0.1 per cent, the city Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday. The department's 38item market basket cost $64.24 or 6 cents less than in the previous week.

title: Merck's Spending Is Cited
description: Despite the large and growing cash flow from operations and recent increases in the investment tax credit, Merck Co. will need cash from outside sources to finance part of its previously announced $400million capital spending program for 1975 and 1976, Henry W. Gadsen, chairman, told shareholders at yesterday's annual meeting in West Point, Pa.

title: Convict Slain, Hostages Seized Before Joliet Revolt Is Quelled
description: JOLIET, Ill., April 22 (UPI)More than 200 convicts seized a cell block and 12 hostages at the Joliet Correctional Center today. A convict was slashed to death and eight members of the prison staff were injured before the rebellion ended more than five hours later.

title: POVERTY AGENCY IS SEEN AS ENTITY
description: CHICAGO, April 22The director of the Federal antipoverty program said today that he had detected strong Congressional sentiment for keeping the program as an independent agency although the Ford Administration was drafting plans to place the agency under the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Advertising
description: Bank advertising and airline advertising have something in commonboth challenge an agency to find a marketable point of difference between the client and its competitors.

title: Market Place
description: The ad, which appeared in the April 4 issue of The New Times, began with the headline, The Second Safest Investment In America, in letters almost and an inch and a half high.

title: FRANK DELLORUSSO
description: Frank DelloRusso, manager of postal services for The New York Times, died Monday in Corley Island Hospital. He was 48 years old and lived at 2230 East 12th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Islanders Win, 42
description: PITTSBURG, April 22The Islanders played in the spirit of the 1942 Toronto Maple Leafs tonight, defeating the Pittsburgh Penguins, 42. It was New York's first victory ever in the iglooshaped Civic Arena and the timing was perfect for it kept the Penguins from claiming the fourofsevengame quarterfinal series, which Pittsburgh now leads, 3 games to 2.

title: YEROCHAM AMITAI
description: Yerocham Amitai, former director of the Israel Aliyah Center in North America, 515 Park Avenue, died Sunday after a car accident in Israel. He was 48 years old and lived in Tel Aviv.

title: FIRST OF REFUGEES ARRIVE ON COAST
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., April 22The first wave of Vietnamese refugees, the vanguard of expected tens of thousands, has arrived here in the last 48 hours, with hundreds more aboard planes now coming from the Philippines.

title: Move Is on to Settle Cambodians in U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 22  Seven private organizations representing Roman Catholic, Jewish, Protestant and nondenominational groups have offered to help resettle at least 1,000 Cambodian refugees in the United States.

title: WRITE ROUSE ASKS ACTION ON ENERGY
description: WASHINGTON April 22The House Ways and Means Committee began its final round of voting on an energy conservation bill today as the White House again prodded Congress to make substantial progress this week toward approval of a comprehensive energy program.

title: REVIEW OF POLICY ON WATER IS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton called today for a national shift in attention from the quality of water to its Quantity.

title: 1,450 Guidance Counselors
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (UPI)  More than 1,450 men and women are employed in guidance counseling in Missouri's public schools.

title: Celtics Win; 122117
description: HOUSTON, April 22 (AP) The Boston Celtics, led by 29 points apiece by Dave Cowens and Don Chaney, outmuscled and outran the Houston Rockets for a 122177 victory tonight in a National Basketball Association playoff game.

title: Pipeline Postscript
description: RIO DE JANEIROIn purest bureaucratese it was labeled the pipeline. One entered it in Washington and emerged in Saigon. I went in the pipeline in January, 1966, as a junior officer in the United States Information Agency.

title: CONVENTION CENTER CALLED AIR THREAT
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency raised objections yesterday to air pollution it said would be caused by the New York City Convention Center scheduled to rise on the Hudson River west of Times Square.

title: Quintuplets Delivered By Caesarean Section
description: CINCINNATI, April 22 Quintuplets, three girls and two boys, were delivered by Caesarean section today at General Hospital of the University of Cincinnati. The mother and children were reported to be in good condition.

title: Mary Newton, 107, Nurse In SpanishAmerican War
description: BUFFALO, April 22 (AP)Mary Alice Newton, a nurse who served with Theodore Roosevelt in the SpanishAmerican War, died today in a Buffalo nursing home. She was 107 years old.

title: Garr Rubs Salt in Wounds of Dodgers With Key Hit in Braves' 32 Victory
description: The injuryriddled Los Angeles Dodgers ran afoul of the National League's defending batting champion in Atlanta yesterday and suffered a 32 defeat.

title: Charter Co. Begins Talks on a Merger With Oil Refiner
description: The Charter Company of Jacksonville, Fla., said yesterday that it had entered into preliminary discussions with the Commonwealth Oil Refining Company of Puerto Rico regarding a possible merger of Commonwealth into Charter.

title: Misuse of Public Job Fund Is Laid to State's Big Cities
description: TRENTON April 22Joseph A. Hoffman, the State Labor Commissioner, believes New Jersey's big cities are misusing Federal funds designed to create 5,000 public service jobs for the unemployed.

title: Teachers Union Is Ready For an AllOut Campaign
description: Within the next 13 days, each of the 55,000 members of the United Federation of Teachers who lives in the city is scheduled to receive a telephone call at home from union representative.

title: FEDERAL RULES AIM AT BIAS IN CREDIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Retailers, banks and others who grant credit would be barred from terminating credit solely because of a change in the marital status of an individual under proposed regulations issued today by the Federal Reserve Board.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Beef that has been frozen and then thawed may be safely refrozen if it shows no sign of spoilage, according to Marcelle Allen, an extension specialist in foods and nutrition at Purdue University, and Mardel L. Crandall of the Indiana Cooperative Extension Service.

title: Score It Martin to Bieber to McGraw
description: Billy Marlin, the spirited manager of the Texas Rangers whose chats with umpires often provide light reading for Lee MacPhail, president of the American League, recently took steps to exercise prior restraint over the umpires' reports to headquarters. He walked up to Ron Luciano with a microphone clipped to his shirtfrock where even an umpire couldn't fail to see it. Answering the inevitable question, he said he was sick of being slandered biased and inaccurate reports to the league office and had got himself wired for sound so he would have a recording of any arguments that might come up. I'm not trying to get Luciano fined, he told the press, I'm trying to get him fired.

title: About Education
description: College costs am not only going upthey are going up faster than most other things.

title: Honduran Army Ousts Leader Named in Bribery Case in U.S.
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, April 22The Honduran military ousted the Chief of State of this Central American country today just two weeks after he had reportedly been accused of accepting a $1.25million bribe from the United States company United Brands.

title: Shortage of Investigators Cited by H.E.W. Official
description: WASHINGTON. April 22 (UPI) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare, with responsibility for more than onethird of the Federal budget, has too few professional investigators to look into fraud and abuse, a department official said today.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON TRANSIT FUNDS
description: ALBANY, April 22$100million state aid program for mass transit  needed to help the financially pressed Metropolitan Transportation Authority pay some overdue bills was agreed upon today by legislative leaders and the Carey administration.

title: Greece Denounces Demonstrations Against U.S.
description: ATHENS, April 22 The Greek Government today denounced the demonstrations against the American Embassy here last night as damaging to Greek interests and: unfair to the United States. It said the incidents were the work of extreme leftists who deliberately set out to attack the Embassy and provoke a confrontation with the police.

title: Con Ed's Net Soars By 64% in Quarter
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc., reported yesterday a 64 per cent increase in profits for the first quarter. Despite the improvement, directors maintained the quarterly dividend at a 30 cents a share, the same rate as they ordered for the last quarter of 1974.

title: Rio Reaction Mixed On Postponement Of Kissinger's Visit
description: RIO DE JANEIRO. April 22The news that Secretary of State Kissinger had put off his scheduled trip to Latin America this week was greeted here today with expressions of understanding and some irritation.

title: Article 4  No Title
4 CRABIEL COUNTS DROPPED BY STATE
description: ELIZABETH, April 22The tate conceded today that it had not proved four of the seven overt illegal acts it had listed in its case charging Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel and the Franklin Contracting Company of Little Falls with conspiring to rig bids and fix prices in public highway construction work.

title: A French Delicacy For U. S. Palates
description: Crme frache, the faintly sour, very thick heavy cream that has always been one of the essential ingredients for cooking in France, is now available in specialty stores here.

title: Pathet Lao Says Troops Gain In Fight Against Coalition Foe
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 22 (Reuters)The proCommunist Pathet Lao said today that its troops had forced soldiers of its partners in the Laotian coalition Government to give ground in fighting around a strategic road junction north of here.

title: $10Million Invested
description: SALEM, April 22Mr. Healy said the  state's suit against Mr. Foster involved about 7,500 church goers. who invested about $10million in a fund for building or expanding their churches.

title: Carey Names S.C.I. Chief and Orders Correction Unit Inquiry
description: ALBANY, April 22Governor Carey today appointed David W. Brown, a lawyer with Washington and Wall Street experience, as chairman of the State Commission of Investigation, and ordered him to look into charges of misconduct by the State Commission of Correction.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York State's nofault automobile insurance law was ruled unconstitutional yesterday by a State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: PRICE INDEX HERE STAYS UNCHANGED
description: The prices of goods and services in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area, as measured by the local Consumer Price Index, remained virtually unchanged last month, compared with smalland in a few casessubstantial advances in other parts of the country.

title: Stores Being Demolished
description: CARACAS, Venezuela (UPI) Work crews have started to tear down some 200 cafes, grocery stores and boutiques built illegally In the Venezuelan capital. The Federal District Governor, Diego Arria, says the structures were either attached illegally to other buildings or jutted out onto the sidewalk.

title: Issue and Debate
description: In just over two months New York State must have in operation a completely new method of handling medicalmalpractice insurance. The old system, with one private company writing almost all of that insurance, comes to an end July 1 when that company abandons the field. No other insurance company has been willing to take over the medicalmalpractice business.

title: An Emigre Bids Scientists of West Press Moscow
description: A Soviet Jewish physicist who emigrated last December said here yesterday that the Soviet Union benefited more than the West from a program of scientific exchanges and that this offered a means of dissuading the Soviet authorities from harassing dissident scientists.

title: In Memoriam
description: COHNFlorence (Bobble). In cherished memory of a beloved mother and grandmother who entered eternal rest April 26, 1973. Always in our hearts.

title: New Law in Italy Gives Equal Rights to Wives
description: ROME, April 22 (Reuters) Italian wives today gained full equality in law with their husbands.

title: The Forgotten Charter
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 22 It has been widely ignored during the last' gasp of the Indochina war that the United Nations, which now seems to be forgotten and even reviled by almost everybody, was almost the only organization in touch with all parties in the tragedy while it was getting' food, medicine and clothing to the suffering people on both sides of the contending armies.

title: Delaware Museum Show Updates the AvantGarde
description: WILMINGTON, Del. The immense international influence wielded by the American abstract expressionist painters of the nineteenforties and fifties and by the pop artists and colorfield abstractionists who succeeded them in the sixties, tended for many years to obscure the achievements of an earlier generation of American moderniststhe painters and sculptors who, in the period immediately before and after World War I, were the first to respond to the revelations of the Europeanavantgarde.

title: The Way They Stand Today
description: Wednesday, April 23, 1975

title: RAIL LINES SEEK FREIGHT RATE RISE
description: The Eastern and Western railroads are expected to file applications with the Interstate Commerce Commission on Monday, seeking a 5 per cent freight rate increase to help offset a 10 per cent general wage increase that went into effect on Jan. 1. The rate request will follow a 7 per cent rate increase that the industry has been authorized by the I.C.C. to make effective Sunday night. Since there are a number of commodities, which will be exempt from the 7 per cent increase, the effective rate will be less than 6 per cent.

title: Awaiting a Recovery
description: Is the recession really bottoming out, as so many businessmen and economists assert? And, if it is, will the recovery be strong and sustained or weak and uncertain? As of the moment, real evidence of the beginning of an upturn is hard to find. On the contrary, last month's drop in new orders for durable goodsa decline of $1.3billion, or 3.6 per centlooked more like evidence of a con tinuing, slump. That drop, in fact, more than wiped out the 2.7 per cent gain in February that Government economists had hailed as evidence that the slump was ending.

title: Goodyear Net Down 24.6% in Quarter, While Burlington Industries Slumps 87.2% and Avon Rises
Capitalists Assailed
description: LISBON, April 22  Portugal's governing armed forces accused national and international capitalism today of trying to halt the country's revolution and return to the past.

title: More Dialogue Delay
description: Developments in Indochina make it entirely understandable that President Ford has asked Secretary State Kissinger to postpone his trip to Latin America. The delay will nonetheless disappoint those LatinAmerican governments most anxious to resume with the Secretary of State the longinterrupted dialogue on major hemisphere issues.

title: Coast Mayor, 21, Enjoys First Hurrah
description: CAMPBELL, Calif.  He could be 41 years old. His short black hair is streaked with gray. His shiny geometric ties are the same color as his trousers and socks (often red or green). And he knows his way around political clubhouses here the way any oldtimer from the Bronx knows when, where and with whom to lean back, put his feet on the table, and knock cigar ashes on the floor.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN TRADING DROP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange dropped yesterday, in decreased trading. Prices also fell in the overthecounter market, but volume there increased.

title: New Hampshire Official Balks At Filing Suit Over Senate Seat
description: CONCORD. N. H., April 22, (AP)New Hampshire's Attorney General, Warren B. Rudman, said today that he could not, in good faith, file suit in the. Supreme Court in the dispute over one of the state's United States Senate seats.

title: NEV RULES ISSUED ON FLOOD CONTROL
description: TRENTON, April 22 Controversial regulations banning the construction of buildings in floodprone areas throughout the state were issued here today by the Environmental Protection Commissioner, David J. Bardin. The regulations will take effect on June 2.

title: BRONX YOUTH SLAIN, MOTHER IS STABBED
description: A 19yearold Bronx youth was stabbed to death and his mother was seriously wounded early today when they were attacked by a young man in front of their home at 4446 DeReimer Avenue, the police reported.

title: Gulf to Change Directors If Warranted by Inquiry
description: PITTSBURGH, April 22Bob R. Dorsey, chairman of the Gulf Oil CompanY, said today that a special shareholders meeting would be called for election of new directors if a review committee investigating secret political contributions by the company found information from which the board or the Securities and Exchange Commission reaches the conclusion that new election of directors should be held.

title: Honduran Army Ousts Leader Named in Bribery Case in U.S.
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, April 22The Honduran military ousted the Chief of State of this Central American country today just two weeks after he had reportedly been accused of accepting a $1.25million bribe from the United States conglomerate United Brands.

title: U.S. Plans Waiver to Admit Up to 130,000 Indochinese
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Justice Department announced today plans to waive immigration restrictions so that up to 130,000 refugees from Indochina, including ranking officials of the Saigon Government, Could be admitted into the United States.

title: F.B.I. MAN DENIES ATTICA ESPIONAGE
description: BUFFALO, April 22A Federal Bureau of Investigation agent denied under oath today that he had received any information about the strategy of the Attica legal defense team from a woman who had testified that she had furnished such information to him.

title: Retread Tire Requirements
description: Under new regulations, retreads have to meet government performance standards according to the Tire Retread Information Bureau. Quality retreaded tires undergo intensive tests for strength, dimensional accuracy and bead unseating. Casings must also be stringently inspected for defects.

title: Bolshoi Back in Gorgeous Spartacus
The Big Apple Gives Dutch a Treat Marking Origin as New Amsterdam
description: I want to ask you to raise your glasses in salute to Her Majesty the Queen, said the man from Brooklyn.

title: DEFICIT DEEPENS AT UNITED BRANDS
description: The United Brands Company, which is involved in a major bribery investigation in Honduras, reported here yesterday a net loss of nearly $4million in the first quarter.

title: Notes on People
description: Robert L. Vesco has given up his United States citizenship and has no intention of ever returning to this country, he said in a letter made public by Terrence A. Todman, United States Ambassador to Costa Rica. Federal officials said recently that they would make their third attempt to extradite the financier, who faces charges of embezzlement and of contributing illegally to the 1972 Nixon reelection campaign.

title: Students at Brown U. Vote For Budget Control Plan
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 22 Students at Brown University voted today to accept trusteeapproved mechanisms that would allow faculty members and students some say in future budgets as an incomplete step toward the implementation of our demands, and to consider further tactics in their protest over budgetary priorities.

title: Figure in Lisbon Revolt Goes Into Political Exile
description: PARIS, April 22One of the major participants in Portugal's revolution announced in Paris today that he had gone into political exile.

title: British Pound Falls To Lows in Europe; Cold Prices Mixed
description: BRUSSELS, April 22 (UPI)The British pound tumbled today to a record low on foreign exchanges. The dollar dropped on all European exchanges except London and the price of gold was mixed.

title: TV: The Secret Life of an Orchestra
description: One of the more successful transferrals of music to the television screen was accomplished in Bolero, using the familiar Ravel chestnut. It was produced for WNET/13 by Allan Miller and, through circuitous routes, won an Academy Award in 1974. Continuing his experiments in televised music, Mr. Miller is completing a sixpart series called The Music Project Presents. The first, The Secret Life of an Orchestra, will be shown on public television tonight at 8:30.

title: Death Penalty Imposed
description: MIAMI, Fla., April 22 (AP)A Dade County Circuit judge has followed a jury's recommendation of a death sentence for Thomas Otis Klight, convicted in the kidnap slaying last July of Sydney Gans, a wealthy Miami businessman, and his wife, Lillian. Judge Eugene Williams handed down the sentence yesterday, even though he was not hound by the recommendation under Florida law.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Appellate Division of the State Superior Court upheld the suspension of the restaurant liquor license of Emersons, Ltd., in Wayne, ruling that largescale food and drink operations were not entitled to special treatment by the state. The court affirmed a decision by the Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control to take away the liquor license of the restaurant for 72 days for serving liquor to minors. Emersons, a chain with several restaurants throughout the state, argued that because it was a big business it was more vulnerable to involuntary violations of the liquor laws and should be treated more indulgently. The court noted that the offense was the second by Emersons, Ltd., within a sixmonth period, and that the restaurant had paid a fine the first time.

title: MillionDollar Tennis Ballyhoo
description: The richest tennis match ever played, between Jimmy Connors and John Newcombe, is scheduled to take place on Saturday on an indoor court at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Nev. The total pot will approach $1million, although exactly how it will be divided among the players and the various promotional interests has not been made clear. Theoretically, the winner will get about $200,000 more than the loser.

title: House Vote to Control Grants Scored by Head of Science Unit
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Dr. Philip Handler, president of the National Academy of Sciences, charged today that the House of Representatives had voted to establish itself as a censor of the National Science Foundation's programs on a grantby grant basis.

title: Kinetic Sculptures by Rickey Adorn Fordham Plaza
description: This plaza's been here for seven years, waiting for something to happen, the sculptor George Rickey said, with the air of a discoverer. With helpers, he was installing a show of 22 Rickey works on the Robert Moses. Plaza of Fordham University's Lincoln Center campus, one floor above street level.

title: Chicago to Comply With Order On Discriminatory Police Hiring
description: CHICAGO, April 22Mayor Richard J. Daley said today that the city of Chicago would hire 200 police officers, most of them blacks and women, to comply with a Federal court order currently denying the city millions of dollars in Federal general revenuesharing funds because of alleged discriminatory hiring practices.

title: For Stuyvesant, Roving Animals Were Pet Peeve
description: Animals ran freely in the settlement of New Amsterdam, and its sternest Governor, Peter Stuyvesant, labored in vain to create rules for their control.

title: VOTER PROTECTION SPURRED IN TEXAS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The state of Texas, faced with the threat of being brought under an expanded Federal voting rights law, has intensified its interest in voter protection legislation of its own.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HOUSE CALL It's tuneup time for general practitioners, surgeons, anesthetists, medical students, dentists, lab technicians, pharmacists, electrologists and nurses. The 60 members of the Brooklyn Doctors' Symphony Orchestra will be presenting the first concert of their 36th season tonight at 8 o'clock, as a benefit for a student nurses scholarship fund, in the secondfloor auditorium of the Nurses Residence of Kings County Hospital Center, at Clarkson and New York Avenues. The program is again to be conducted by Bartolomeo Ferrara (the group's only nonmedical member) and will consist of 10 numbers, ranging from classical (Bach, Haydn, Rossini), to semiclassical, brass ensemble. Dixieland blues and Broadway (West Side Story). A $2.50 contribution is requested.

title: Article 3  No Title
CONVICTS' FAMILIES WILL GET $270,000
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 22 (AP)The state of California agreed today to pay $270,000 to the families of three black Soledad Prison inmates shot to death in 1970 by a guard.

title: ...How Many Jobs?
description: Public service employment is mushrooming under pressure of the current emergency, and there will be strong pressure for permanent programs to provide governmentfinanced work as a matter of right for those who will remain idle after the gross national product turns upward. The House Subcommittee on Equal Opportunities is studying a bill by Representatives Augustus Hawkins of California and Henry Reuss of Wisconsin, with 85 cosponsors, that calls for a comprehensiveand expensivenational program to cut unemployment to per cent within eighteen months.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MEXICO CITY, April 22 (Reuters)Foreign Ministry officials said today there was no chance that Mexico would allow her Davis Cup tennis team to play South Africa. There have been no further requests for reconsideration of the ban, the officials said, but if one were made, the reply would remain negative. They said Mexico was acting in accordance with a United Nations resolution calling for the end of sports relations with South Africa, because her apartheid policies. Mexico, which ousted the United States, was to have met South Africa in the North American semifinals.

title: Impact of Wife's Death
description: ST. LOUIS, April 22Senator Symington said today that the death of his wife, Evelyn Wadsworth Symington, who died from a heart attack on Dec. 24, 1972, has had a major impact on my running again.

title: Take Rys and Perche or Lopstere, Do Perto and Serve It Forth
description: If Americans have been eating more pan di ramarino, iuselle dates, blamanCard perys cofyns lately, as well as drivers fruytes and nuttes, it probably has to do with such Renaissance figures as. Afichelangelo and his contemporary Lodovico Ariosto, the 16thcentury Italian poet, each of whose 500th birthday has been celebrated within recent weeks.

title: Article 1  No Title
ExAide Says Byrne Avoided Full Inquiry By Polke on Crabiel
description: TRENTON, April 12  An executive assistant to Governor Byrne who was dismissed by the Governor last weekend charged today that Mr. Byrne had never asked the state police to make a complete background investigation of Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation has received an order worth more than $100million from the Florida Power and Light Company for two nuclear reactor systems and associated fuel fabrication systems. The units will located at a site about 30 miles south of Miami.

title: Sapporo, in North Japan, Boasts Ambiance All Its Own
description: SAPPORO, JapanThis is a city where leaden skies unload wet, sticky snow on a spring day while the rest of Japan enjoys warm sunshine.

title: H.E.W. Warns Los Angeles About Teacher Integration
description: LOS ANGELES, April 22 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has notified Los Angeles school officials that nearly $100million in Federal education funds may be withheld because city school teaching staffs are not adequately integrated.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES DECLINE SLIGHTLY
description: The stock market finished slightly lower in accelerated trading yesterday as late selling pressure erased earlier gains.

title: WINE TALK
description: ST. EMILION, France. The room was a typical college science laboratory with long work counters and deep sinks. It was at a small agricultural school about six miles from this famous wine center. But the 30 men gathered there the one day recently were not students.

title: Senate Approves Meskill for Bench After Long Battle
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The Senate approved today the controversial nomination of Thomas J. Meskill, former Governor of Connecticut, as a United States Court of Appeals Judge for the Second Circuit.

title: FIRST OF REFUGEES ARRIVE ON COAST
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., April 22The first wave of Vietnamese refugees, the vanguard of expected tens of thousands, has arrived here in the last 48 hours, with hundreds more aboard planes now coming from the Philippines.

title: About New York
description: What does an art dealer do when he is buying back two dozen stolen pictures and the detectives who have told him to bring $700 instead of the $5,500 demanded by the thieves don't show up to make the arrest?

title: Bridge:
Chief Investigator
description: ALBANY, April 22David W. Brown is the only Carey appointee thus far whose literary efforts were rejected, with some encouraging comments, by The New Yorker.

title: VIETNAMESE REDS APPEAR TO REBUFF TRUCE AND TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22North Vietnam and the Vietcong responded today to the resignation of Nguyen Van Thieu as South Vietnam's President by insisting that the only way out for the Ford Administration was to stop all involvement in South Vietnam, including military aid.

title: East St. Louis, Decayed and Desperate, Still Has Hope
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, Ill.In the revolving rooftop restaurant of Stouffer Inn on the St. Louis side of the Mississippi River, the cocktail napkins have map of the riverfront drawn on them.

title: All Xuan Loc Troops Reported Pulled Out
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 23Xuan Loc, a provincial capital where South Vietnamese forces had made a stand since April 9, has been evacuated, military sources reported yesterday.

title: Robert Hennemuth Dead at 53; Led Raytheon Labor Relations
description: Robert G. Hennemuth, a vice president of the Raytheon Company in Lexington, Mass., and director of industrial relations since 1963, died yesterday in Newton, Mass. He was 53 years old and lived in Wellesley, Mass

title: Argentine Filled Key Role In Latins' Drugs Network
description: The one man in South America whom drug enforcement officials say they would most like to see behind bars is Armando H. Nicolai, a 46yearold Argentine who has been under indictment on narcotics conspiracy charges in New York since 1971.

title: JAWORSKI CITES ROLE OF PLEA BARGAINING
description: AUSTIN, Tex., April 22 (UPI) Had it not been for plea bargaining, the full story of the Watergate breakin and coverup would never have been ,known, Leon Jaworski, the former special prosecutor in the lease, said today.

title: Eastern Air Lines Reports a Profit; Braniff Net Dips
description: Eastern Air Lines barely broke even in the first quarter this year, while the Braniff International Corporation's subsidiary, Braniff Airways, despite an earnings decline, had one of its most profitable first quarters in its history.

title: Article 5  No Title
URANIUM POLICY CLARIFIED BY U.S.
description: PARIS, April 22An American atomic agency representative said here today that European protests over United States policies on the shipment of enriched uranium were the result of a misunderstanding.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: 2 New Business High Schools To Open in Manhattan in Fall
description: The Board of Education said yesterday that two new high schools specializing in business education would open in Manhattan next fall.

title: Big Horse's Off To the Big Race
description: Foolish Pleasure, the Kentucky Derby favorite, was carefully installed in a cargo plane at Kennedy Airport shortly before noon and shipped to Louisville yesterday.

title: ExAide Says Byrne Avoided Full Inquiry By Police on Crabiel
description: TRENTON, April 22An executive assistant to Governor Byrne who was dismissed by the Governor last weekend charged today that Mr. Byrne had never asked the state police to make a complete background investigation of Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel.

title: Economics Series Planned by Public TV
description: The public television systems of the United States, Canada and Britain have joined in the production of a series on the economic evolution of industrial society, to be written and hosted by John Kenneth Galbraith, the Harvard economist.

title: Suicide Attempt Fails
description: PARKERSBURG, W. Va., April 22 (UPI)Edward Die, 79 years old plunged nearly 80 feet from the Belpre Bridge into the Ohio River today and was rescued without serious injury. HeH said he had jumped because he had been feeling bad about a few things recently.

title: Common Cause Official Urges Senate Panel to Scrutinize Hathaway's Environmental Record
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The acting president of Common Cause called on the Senate Interior Committee today to give effective scrutiny to the qualifications of Stanley K. Hathaway to be Secretary of the Interior.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, April 22, 1975

title: Nine Are Accused Of Having Cheated Apartment Seekers
description: Five owners and operators of three apartment referral services and four of their employes yesterday were ordered arrested on charges arising from what District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn called a ripoff of apartment hunters totaling $250,000 last year.

title: Symington, 73, Says He Will Not Seek Senate Reelection
description: ST. LOUIS, April 22 (UPI)Senator Stuart Symington, the 73yearold Missouri Democrat who first won election to the United States Senate in 1952, said today that he would not seek reelection to another sixyear term in 1976.

title: Senate Approves Meskill for Bench After a SixMonth Struggle
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The Senate approved today the controversial nomination of Thomas J. Meskill, former Governor of Connecticut, as United States Court of Appeals Judge for the Second Circuit.

title: 12 Oil Corporations Consent to Ending Interlocking Boards
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Twelve corporations in the oil and gas business agreed today to settle lawsuits brought against them by the Government, which charged them with violating a 40yearold law prohibiting the same director from serving on the boards of two competing companies.

title: About New York
description: What does an art dealer do when he is buying back two stolen pictures and the detectives who have told him to bring $700 instead of the $5,500 demanded by the thieves don't show up to make the arrest?

title: SHOP TALK
description: A kind of textile festival is going on in New York at the momentalthough it's all coincidental. A number of New York crafts galleries and shops art having shows that deal with fiber arts.

title: Saigon's Denouement...
description: The political and military unfolding of Saigon's fate is moving with a dynamic of its own that is unlikely to be much affected by any decisions in Washington. What does hang in the balance on Capitol Hill, however, is authorization for the Ford Administration to mount a military operation, if necessary, to evacuate American and Vietnamese personnel. Congress has a responsibility to make available all needed resources without, in the process, granting an inadvertent blank check that could lead this country into renewed combat engagement.

title: Fire Delays Pennsy Riders
description: About 2,000 homebound commuters on the Penn Central's Harlem line were delayed 15 minutes to an hour during the early part of Monday night's rush hour when a brush fire near the Mount Vernon West station led to a 71minute power cutoff. A railroad spokesman said eight trains were stranded and two departures were postponed between 4:02 P.M., when the power was shut off at the request of the Mount Vernon Fire Department, and 5:13, when it was restored.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DROP DAILY LIMIT
description: Sunshine in the Midwest planting and growing areas stimulated a large amount of selling yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, with the result that prices of soybeans generally dropped the daily limits as did the price of soybean oil.

title: Books of The Times
description: Scanning rapidly through the pages of Benjamin C. Bradlee's Conversations With Kennedy, the eye catches items such as that it took John F. Kennedy nearly an hour of practice to master the phraseIch bin ein Berliner'; that he once placed a telephone call to Truman Capote just to demonstrate the prowess of the White

title: HELP WANTED: JOBS WITH COATMAKER
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 22 (UPI)  The recession may be digging in at this resort, but a coat manufacturer said he had 60 jobs for workers who sew and they were going begging.

title: Farm Price Bill Is Passed; Ford Expected to Veto It
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The House of Representatives passed today and sent to the President a bill that would increase price supports and income guarantees for farmers. The measure faces an almost certain veto.

title: Sabres Beat Hawks, 31; Win Series
PERONISTS EXPEL AN EXPRESIDENT
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 22Dr. Hector J. Cmpora, former President of Argentina, was expelled today from the ranks of the Peronist movement.

title: CONSUMER PRICES SHOW LOWEST RISE SINCE '73 FREEZE
description: WASHINGTON, April 22As a result of the first drop in food prices since last July, overall consumer prices rose last month by the smallest amount in 20 months since the shortlived Government price freeze of mid1973, the Labor Department reported today.

title: MARJORIE W. CLARK
description: Marjorie Ward Clark, wife of John Balfour Clark, honorary chairman of Coats & Clark, Inc., manufacturer of thread and yarn, died yesterday. She was in her early seventies and lived at 800 Park Avenue.

title: Zarb Warns Congress of a Veto Of Strict Curbs on Strip Mining
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Ford Administration warned the Democratic leadership in Congress again today that the President was likely to repeat his 1974 veto of a bill to control the environmental abuses of strip mining for coal.

title: Speedier Rule Changes Planned by F.A.A. Chief
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UPI)Criticized by Congress for is its slow reaction to air safety recommendations, the Federal Aviation Administration announced plans today for a major policy reform to speed the process of updating flight rules.

title: Yanks Win on Medich 3Hitter
description: BOSTON, April 22The Yankees played an outstanding game today in the pleasant spring sunshine of old Fenway Park, a game they won from the Boston Red Sox, 50, with a display of superior pitching, base running and hitting. George (Doc) Medich pitched a threehit shutout for his third victory of the season and he did it with a runny nose. The Doctor had a cold, but his strong right arm was warm.

title: U.S. Bill Interest Rates Show Increase
description: Shortterm interest rates notably in the Treasury bill market, moved up yesterday in subdued trading. A similar trading pace was reflected in the corporate and tax exempt sectors of the market, where several wouldbe borrowers announced cancellations or postponements.

title: A Judge Orders Patriarca To Appear in Killing Inquiry
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 22 (AP)Raymond L.S. Patriarca, reputed New England crime leader, was ordered today by a Federal judge to appear before a grand jury investigating the ganglandstyle slaying of Richard Callei.

title: Most Top City Aides Seen Resigned To the Cutbacks Proposed by Mayor
description: City administrators and commissioners said yesterday that the outline of cutbacks presented by Mayor Beame was not necessarily final, and that, in some cases, they would press for substitute economies.

title: RevenueSharing Funds Rise
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP)Nearly $6.4billion will be distributed in the fiscal year 1976 to 39,173 state and local governments under the Federal revenuesharing program, the Government announced today. The total is up from $6.2billion distributed in the fiscal year 1975. Onethird will be paid to the state and the remaining twothirds will be divided among local governments.

title: ...and Washington's Role
description: Legislation to authorize military protection for any evacuation must include tight safeguards: a clear time limit on terminating deployment of American forces, some definition of the specific geographic areas into which those forces could be legally introduced and, finally, continuing oversight authority in the Congress to assure that no military operation develops a life and purpose beyond the immediate evacuation effort.

title: Article 2  No Title
CITY PLANS TO CUT 3,975 OFF PAYROLL FOR 7576 BUDGET
description: Mayor Beame announced yesterday that 3,975 city employes, including 1,802 members of the uniformed services, were scheduled to be dismissed during the fiscal year beginning July 1 and that the total reduction through layoffs and attrition would shrink the city's 337,780member payroll by about 10 per cent.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 23, 1975

title: NEWSMAN BACKED ON CONFIDENTIALITY
description: In a discussion of freedom of the press from the Peter Zenger case of 1735 to the subpoenas of the Watergate tape recordings, a Brooklyn Supreme Court justice has held that a reporter has a right to protect the confidentiality of news sources.

title: NOFAULT POLICIES ARE RULED INVALID
description: New York State's nofault automobile insurance law was ruled unconstitutional yesterday by a Brooklyn Supreme Court justice, who said the law denied due process and favored the rich.

title: List of Schools Facing Closing
description: Following are the schools that Mayor Beanie has proposed to close. Pupils would be accommodated in nearby schools with vacancies.

title: DONALDSON, LUFKIN REPORTS RISE IN NET
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, Inc., the diversified brokerage house, reported yesterday that firstquarter profits stood at $1.07million, or 14 cents a share, up from $13,000 a year ago. Revenues from continuing operations rose to $13.76million from $8.48million.

title: U.S. Plans Waiver to Admit Up to 130,000 Indochinese
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Justice Department announced today plans to waive immigration restrictions so that up to 130,000 refugees from Indochina; including ranking officials of the Saigon Government, could be admitted into the United States.

title: Rifle Group's Display Draws Loyal Crowd
description: SAN DIEGO, April 22David Ziskin sighted down the blue barrel of the Garcia .45 automatic at an imaginary target somewhere in front of him and his face crinkled with pleasure.

title: VIETNAMESE REDS APPEAR TO REBUFF TRUCE AND TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22North Vietnam and the Vietcong responded today to the resignation of Nguyen Van Thieu as South Vietnam's President by insisting that the only way out for the Ford Administration was to stop all involvement in South Vietnam including military aid.

title: Net of New York Times Co. Down 20%; Quarter Revenues Up by 6% to a Record
description: The New York Times Company yesterday reported consolidated net income for the quarter ended March 31 of $3.81  million, or 34 cents share, down 20 per cent from the $4.77million, or 43 cents a share, for the equivalent period last year.

title: Mrs. Streit Advances In Golf at Pinehurst
description: PINEHURST, N. C., April 22 (AP)Marlene Streit of Canada, the defending champion, lost the first hole to a birdie but rallied through a par performance to beat 17yearold Sally Voss of Bethesda, Md., 4 and 2, in today's opening round of the North and South amateur golf tournament.

title: Canada Sets Commission To Study Mergers' Effect
description: OTTAWA, April 22Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau announced today a royal commission to investigate the economic and social effect of huge corporate mergers. The commission will also recommend safeguards to protect the public interest in the creation of major business conglomerates in Canada.

title: Argentine Filled Key Role In Latins' Drugs Network
description: The one man in South America whom drug enforcement officials say they would most like to see behind bars is Armando H. Nicolai, a 46yearold Argentine who has been under indictment on narcotics conspiracy charges in New York since 1971.

title: Death of State Insurance Chief Puts Pact on Malpractice System in Peril
description: ALBANY, April 22A bipartisan agreement on a new system for handling medical malpractice in the state appeared near collapse today following the death of Lawrence W. Keepnews, the Superintendent of Insurance who legislators of both parties said had been the indispensible mediator between the Governor's office and the Legislature in the delicate talks.

title: Airlines' Aggregate Loss In Quarter Sets a Record
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) The nation's scheduled airsines lost a record $190million in the first three months of 1975, the Air Transport Association said today. The previous biggest loss was $176.7million in the fourth quarter of 1970.

title: Protest Halts a NursingHome Directory
description: The distribution of an officiallooking directory of nursing homes was suspended yesterday after State Senator Karen S. Burstein, Democrat of Woodmere, L.I., whose name appears in it as an adviser, threatened to file a complaint against it as a consumer fraud.

title: Confederate Statue Moved With Aid of Federal Funds
description: HEIDELBERG, Miss., April 22 (AP)Jasper County's use of $5,220 in Federal revenuesharing funds to move a Confederate monument has brought discord to this southeast Mississippi town of 1,100.

title: Diamond Reo Trucks, Inc., Is Placed in Receivership
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., April 22 (AP)Diamond Reo Trucks, Inc., the nation's 10th largest truck manufacturer and employer of 1,800 persons in Lansing, Mich., has been placed in receivership in United States Bankruptcy Court here.

title: LAW ON LOBBYING HELD INADEQUATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 22A group of Senators, public officials and lobbyists told a Senate committee today that the Federal lobbying control law was a farce and should be changed.

title: Oil Profits Decline
description: After nearly two years of record profits, the nation's largest oil companiesExxon, Texaco, Mobil and Gulf reported declines yesterday and saw little likelihood of a stronger performance later in the year. Page 59.

title: People in Sports
description: For leading the Kansas CityOmaha Kings into the National Basketball Association playoffs in his first full season, Phil Johnson was named N.B.A. coach of the year yesterday. He received 21 of the 54 votes cast by a panel of sports writers and broadcasters. Al Attles, who guided the Golden State Warriors to their first division title since 1967, was runnerup with 10.

title: $3Million Offered All to Box Frazier
description: Still solvent despite playoff collapses by the Knicks and Rangers, Madison Square Garden offered Muhammad Ali $3million yesterday to defend his heavyweight title against Joe Frazier on Sept. 16.

title: Met Bats Help Beat Cards, 95
description: It wasn't exactly a classic, but to Manager Yogi Berra yesterday's 95 triumph still ranked as a thing of beauty. His new offense cranked out 13 hits, the Mets overpowered the St. Louis Cardinals for their third straight victory and Jerry Koosman threw 165 pitches and lived to tell about it.

title: Tennis Officials Defend Their Calling
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP)The Federal Home Loan Bank Board announced today it was authorizing Federally insured savings and loan institutions to raise money by issuing securities supported by home mortgages.

title: Concert
description: Catherine Malfitanit, the promising young soprano who recently made her New York City Opera debut, has given a number of recitals in which her father, Joseph Malfitano, accompanied her on the violin. But the family broke new ground on Monday night at Alice Tully Hall when soprano and father were joined on the program by Elena Malfitano, Catherine's sister, as dancer and choreographer in two numbers. Further extending the frontiers of togetherness, in one of the danced selections (Bach's Chaconne, if you please) Elena shared credit for the choreography with her mother, Maria.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Of Tolls, a Golden Egg and a Tired Goose

title: KOSHER FOOD OFFER MADE FOR PRISONS
description: Five rabbis volunteered yesterday to help provide kosher food for Jewish prisoners until a Federal Court ruled on the dietary issue in prisons.

title: Italian Inflation Slows
description: ROME, April 22 (Reuters)Italy's rate of inflation slowed dramatically in March, when the consumer price index rose only 0.1 per cent, according to figures released here today. This compared with a rise of 1.5 per cent in February and meant the rate of increase over the last 12 months has been 20.3 per cent, During 1974 the increase was more than 25 per cent.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: Horowitz to Repeat Recital on Sunday At Carnegie Hall
description: This Sunday afternoon in Carnegie Hall, Vladimir Horowitz will fulfill a promise. He will repeat the recital he gave on Nov. 17 in the Metropolitan Opera House for those who were unable to get tickets to that soldout event.

title: ExEnvoy Enters U.S. Post
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (Reuters')Mr. John E, Reinhardt, 55 years old, former United States Ambassador to Nigeria, was sworn in, today as Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs.

title: B1 Flies for 42 Minutes
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., April 22 (AP)Flying faster than the speed of sound for 42 minutes, the prototype B1 bomber completed its seventh test flight yesterday.

title: Forging the PostVietnam Era
description: WASHINGTONThe coming months will be among the most historic of this generation. For the Vietnam war, the seminal experience of the post1945 era, is ending. President Nguyen Van Thieu's resignation raises hopes that war will conclude relatively peacefully. If the Ford Administration continues to support his policies, however, there can still be a bloody finale that will haunt us for decades.

title: G.A.O. Asserts Food Program For Poor Abroad Is Disrupted
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The General Accounting Office said today that the Government's stopandgo budgeting had disrupted the United States food donation programs developed to aid the hungry in poorer countries.

title: Transkei, to Be Free in '76, Planning Capitalist Policy.
description: JOHANNESBURG, April 22 (Reuters)The South African black homeland of Transkei will follow a policy of capitalism with a conscience when it attains independence next year, its Chief Minister, Kaiser Matanzima, said here today.

title: Energy Agency Plans a 20Year Project to Develop Fusion Power
description: A 20 year Feferal program to achieve fusion power, using high energy laser pulses to crush fuel pellets, was outlined here yesterday by scientists of the Energy Research and Development Administration.

title: Earnings of Alcan Aluminium Fell 51.3% in the First Quarter
description: Firstquarter net income of Alcan Aluminum, Ltd., fell 51.3 per cent as sales slipped by 0.5 per cent from the yearago level, according to the quarterly report released yesterday at Montreal. Among other major metals producers reporting yesterday, the Anaconda Company showed a quarterly loss of $9.2million as sales plunged.

title: French Connection Stays Dominant in Market Here
description: The French Connection has lost its hold on the heroin market in most of the country, but it still dominates in New York.

title: Chief of Communist Forces in Cambodia Hails Victory
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 22  The commander of the Communist forces in Cambodia, in his first broadcast from Phnom Penh, today hailed the victory of his troops over the former Cambodian government.

title: Sharing of Life's Riches Is Way of Black Writer
description: On the bus from West Conshohocken, Pa. (population, 2,464), were 21 members of the Lee family brothers, sisters, inlaws, nephews, niecesalong with 22 friends. They were bound for the St. Marks Playhouse on lower Second Avenue to see part of their own family life unfold on stage.

title: DEFICIT SPENDING ASSAILED BY ERVIN
description: JERSEY CITY, April 22 (AP) The former chairman of the Senate Watergate Committee said today that Congress must raise taxes to restore a sound economy.

title: Oil Profits Decline
description: After nearly two years of record profits, the nation's largest oil companiesExxon, Texaco, Mobil and Gulf reported declines yesterday and saw little likelihood of a stronger performance later in the year. Page 59.

title: All Xuan Loc Troops Reported Pulled Out
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 23Xuan Loc, a provincial capital where South Vietnamese forces had made a stand since April 9, has been evacuated, military sources reported yesterday.

title: CITY PLANS TO CUT 3,975 OFF PAYROLL FOR 7576 BUDGET
description: Mayor Beame announced yesterday that 3,975 city employes, including 1,802 members of the uniformed services, were scheduled to be dismissed during the fiscal year beginning July and that the total reduction through layoffs and attrition would shrink the city's 337,780member payroll by about 10 per cent.

title: OREGON MINISTER ACCUSED OF FRAUD
description: SALEM, Ore., April 22 (AP) The state has accused a Sadem minister of a securities fraud involving thousands of investors in Oregon and across the country.

title: Soviet and Egypt Cautious About Geneva
description: MOSCOW, April 22  The Soviet Union and Egypt issued a cautiously worded communiqu today at the end of talks between Kremlin leaders and Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy.

title: Thieu, Day After Speech, Reported Still in Charge
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 22Nguyen Van Thieu, who resigned from the presidency last night, was still directing Government operations at the presidential palace today, according to sources close to the palace.

title: Wider Reserve Requirements Suggested
description: WASHINGTON, April 21A member of the Federal Reserve Board suggested today that effective Government monetary control might require that reserve requirements be extended to apply beyond just the deposits in commercial banks affected at present.

title: People and Business
description: John E. Sheehan has resigned as a member of the Federal Reserve System's board of governors, effective June 1, the White House announced yesterday. Mr. Sheehan, who is 45 years old and who has been a governor since January, 1972, will return to private business, but his exact plans could not be determined yesterday afternoon. His term was scheduled to expire on 1982.

title: FEDERALRULES AIM AT BIAS IN CREDIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Retailers, banks and others who grant credit would be barred from terminating credit solely because of a change in the marital status of an individual under proposed regulations issued today by the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Maryland Gets Rid Of Birds in Forest By Removing Trees
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) The two million squawking birds that roosted in a pine forest in Graceham, Md., are apparently gone for good, And so is a large part of the forest.

title: Coop City Tenants' Suit Gains Backing of S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Residents of Coop City in the Bronx, the largest cooperative housing project in the country, won the support of the Federal Government today for a suit aimed at lowering their monthly carrying charges.

title: Carey Threatens to Veto Bills Not in His Fiscal Plan
description: ALBANY, April 22Governor Carey today threatened to veto any bills passed by the Legislature calling for expenditures not already in his fiscal plan unless budget deficit estimated at $500million was erased with new taxes.

title: Miss Krupsak Is an Orchid Now
description: A rose is a rose Is a rose. But a Mary Anne is a Lieutenant Governor and an or chid.

title: Cooking While on Vacation: More Exciting Than It Sounds
description: People who like to travel and like to cook are discovering more and more that they can have a vacation in such places as France and Italy in Europe and Vermont and California in the United States and not get too far away from the kitchen.

title: The Big Apple Gives Dutch a Treat Marking New Amsterdam Origin
description: I want to ask you to raise your glasses in salute Her Majesty the Queen, said the man from Brooklyn.

title: FEDERAL SPENDING SCORED BY HAUGE
description: Gabriel Hauge, chairman of the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation accused Congress last night of being extravagant and of relying too much on borrowing.

title: Study Asked on Funding Conventions
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Republican and Democratic national chairmen asked the new Federal Election Commission today whether the parties could take $2million in public subsidies for the 1976 conventions and still accept the private donations that formerly funded their conventions.

title: What Kind of Democracy?
description: ATHENSDuring Greece's recent municipal elections, in which the leftwing opposition achieved several important successes, Premier Constantine Caramanlis behaved more as if he were an impartial President of all Greeks than as the head of a Government and, incidentally, a party. This could be significant.

title: PUBLIC ROLE SEEN IN RESEARCH WORK
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Scientists planning research that involves possible hazards should seek the informed consent of the public, much as a doctor does with an individual patient before prescribing innovative treatment, a medical scientist suggested today.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A Paris dispatch in The New York Times April 13, describing a television interview with Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, quoted the editor Jean Daniel of Le Nouvel Observateur as saying the Russian writer was not the martyr of the revolution but the prophet of the counterrevolution. In fact Mr. Daniel attributed the remark to a French television commentator.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, APRIL 23, 1975

title: David P. Sentner, 79, Dies; Hearst Washington Writer
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (AP) David P. Sentner, longtime Washington and New York correspondent for the Hearst newspapers, died today in George Washington University Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: How Many Jobless...
description: It is a measure of the bankruptcy of economic thought that most economists, of all schools and political persuasions, believe the United States must resign itself to an unemployment rate of at least 6 per cent for the rest this decade.

title: Exxon, Texaco, Mobil Nets Fall After 2 Record Years
description: After nearly two years of record  breaking profit increases, the nation's three largest oil companiesExxon, Texaco and Mobilreported declines yesterday for the first three months of 1975 and offered little hope for a stronger performance later in the year.

title: Lansky Is Subpoenaed
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., April 22 (AP)Meyer Lansky, reputed underworld financial figure, has been subpoenaed by a state grand jury investigating illegal gambling. Mr. Lansky, 72 years old, will be among 18 witnesses called to testify before the grand jury impaneled by the Florida Supreme Court, State Attorney Eugene Whitworth said today. The grand jury will convene in Fort Lauderdale on Wednesday.

title: Target of Bishop's Ire Explains Her Views on Abortion
description: SAN DIEGO, April 22To the Most Rev. Leo T. Maher, Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of San Diego, Janet Gleason is a heretic guilty of shameless proabortion education who has forfeited her ministerial role as a lay reader of the church and the right to receive its sacraments.

title: CONSUMER PRICES SHOW LOWEST RISE SINCE '73 FREEZE
description: WASHINGTON, April 22As a result of the first drop in food prices since last July, overall consumer prices rose last month by the smallest amount in 20 months since the shortlived Government price freeze of mid1973, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Bullet Still Unbitten
description: What emerges most dramatically from Mayor Beame's announcement that he has pared another $188 million from next year's expense budget is how remote the city remains from any genuine solution to the worst budget crunch in its history.

title: Cooler Peking Attitude Toward U. S. Seen
description: PEKING, April 22Premier Leo Tindemans of Belgium has come away from talks with Chinese leaders with the impression that they have cooled in their attitude toward the United States and now attach more weight to Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger's statements on military policy than to Secretary of State Kissinger's diplomatic pronouncements, according to Belgian sources here.

title: Pentagon Offers to Build Saudi Air Force Academy
description: WASHINGTON, April 22, (Reuters)  The Defense Department said today that it had offered to build an air force academy to train pilots for Saudi Arabia at a cost estimated eat more than $25million.

title: Mother and Retired Son Win MillionDollar Lottery
description: TEANECK, April 22 (AP)A retired industrial sales engineer from Bergen County and his widowed mother won a million dollars today in the 39th Millionaire drawing by the New Jersey Slate Lottery Commission.

title: SEARS EXPECTING DROP IN PROFITS
description: Arthur M. Wood, chairman and chief executive officer of Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's largest retailer, told financial analysts here yesterday that he expects net income for the first quarter ending April 30 to be lower than the year before. The decline could exceed the 48 per cent profit drop in the fourth quarter of the recent fiscal year, he said.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Overtime Pay Law Is Being Adjusted May 1 for 2 Million
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UPI)Beginning May 1, Federal laws on overtime pay will be adjusted for about 2 million workers.

title: BUENOS AIRES
