description: (In Argentina pesos)

title: Special Interests Gird For School Vote May 6
description: Isabel Capobianco, a gregarious mother of six children in Roman Catholic schools, is the president of a parish homeschool association in the Fordham section of the Bronx that is actively engaged in trying to select a slate of candidates to endorse in next month's community school board elections.iL Although a spokesman for the Archdiocese of New York maintains that interest among parochial parents in the rublicschool elections has declined this year, Mrs. Capobianco's parish, Our Lady of Mercy Church, joined with 15 others in District 10 to hold a candidates  screening night last night.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A Paris dispatch in The New York Times April 13, describing a television interview with Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, quoted the editor Jean Daniel of Le Nouvel Observateur as saying the Russian writer was not the martyr of the revolution but the prophet of the counterrevolution. In fact Mr. Daniel attributed the remark to a French television commentator.

title: New Trial Won as Disclosure By Parolee to Officer Is Voided
description: TRENTON, April 22 (UPI)The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that a prison inmate's candid conversation with his parole officer could not be used against him at a trial.

title: Smith Toppled in First Round, 63, 75
description: HOUSTON, April 22 (AP) Vijay Amritraj of India all but knocked Stan Smith out of the $100,000 World Championship Tennis finals by eliminating the lanky blond, 63, 75, in the first round of the $60,000 River Oaks tournament today.

title: 12 Oil Corporations Consent to Ending Interlocking Boards
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Twelve corporations in the oil and gas business agreed today to settle lawsuits brought against them by the Government, which charged them with violating a 40yearold law prohibiting the same director from serving on the boards of two competing companies.

title: Guam Becomes Center for Airlift From Vietnam
description: AGANA, Guam, April 23 (Reuters)The focus of the United States airlift of Americans and Vietnamese from Saigon switched today to this Americanadministered territory, touching off expressions of concern in the territorial legislature.

title: Post No Bills
description: Among the many amenities too long withheld from New Yorkers have been sheltered bus stops. After years of delay, a few such shelters have made their welcome debut at some key intersections.

title: Nicklaus Canadian Entry
description: MONTREAL, April 23 (AP) Jack Nicklaus, who won the Masters golf tournament for a record fifth time two weeks ago, has entered the Canadian open tournament to be held July 24 through 27 at the Royal Montreal Golf Club.

title: STATE DUE TO SHUT HOLLANDER HOMES
description: The State Health Department said yesterday that it would move next week to put Eugene Hollander, honorary president of the Metropolitan New York Nursing Home Association, out of business as a nursinghome proprietor in the state.

title: Honeywell to Begin Selling A Smaller Computer in U.S
description: WALTHAM, Mass., April 23 (Reuters)  Honeywell, Inc., said today it was introducing in the United States market a small Series 60, Model 62/40 computer.

title: Revlon Lured Its President With Bonus of $1.5Million
description: When Charles Revson, the 68yearold chairmanarchitect of Revlon, Inc., the nation's leading cosmetics retailer, last September lured a new president into his company, he did so by agreeing to pay him an immediate, $1.3million bonus for taking the job.

title: Dow Index Off 11.65 As Volume Is Lower
description: An absence of favorable economic news and continued profit taking sent stock prices down sharply yesterday in slow trading.

title: Plan for SEEK Reductions Stirs Protests
description: Administrators and student leaders in the City University mobilized yesterday to fend off Mayor Beanie's proposed cuts in the SEEK programeconomies that some people suggested were motivated as much by ideological as by fiscal considerations.

title: Music: Ax's Virtuosity
description: Emanuel Ax, who has been knocking piano competitions down the way a lumberman fells trees, gave a recital last night in Tully Hall, and all that experience showed. This concert was given under the auspices of one of his recent prizes, the Michaels Award of Young Concert Artists. Since then he captured first prize in the Arthur Rubinstein Competition in Israel. Before that there were high awards in the Queen Elisabeth in Belgium, the Chopin in Poland, the Vianna da Motta in Portugal. Etc. Etc. Etc.

title: Seoul Deputies Clash With Police
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 23Opposition members of the National Assembly clashed with riot policemen in several parts of Seoul today as they defied a police ban on selling their party newspaper, which is severely critical of President Park Chung Hee's Government.

title: Red Sox Score 5 in 8th  Lyle Takes Defeat
description: BOSTON, April 23Catfish Hunter failed today for the fourth time to win his first game for the Yankees. He didn't lose either, but his new team did.

title: Left Said to Control Laos Road Junction As 3Day Fight Ends
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 23 (Reuters)Three days of fighting between troops of the rightwing and leftwing partners in the Laotian coalition Government have ended with the Marxist Pathet Lao in complete control of a vital road junction north of here, military officials said today.

title: Hondurans, in U.S. for Bribe Inquiry, Say They Still Lack Proof of Lopez Tie
description: WASHINGTON, April 23A Honduran commission investigating bribery charges against top government officials declared here today that it had not yet sufficient evidence to say thai the deposed Chief of State personally benefited from $1.25million deposited by the United Brands Company last September in numbered Swiss bank accounts.

title: Air Discounts Rejected
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board turned down a restoration of domestic youth fares and discounts for the elderly and families. Youth fares have been approved on transAtlantic flights. Page 38.

title: Louisiana Birth Control Expert Gets 2Year Sentence for Fraud
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 23Dr. Joseph Beasley, a widely known authority on population control methods who founded and directed a statewide family planning program in Louisiana, was sentenced to two years in prison today in a fraud case.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article and an accompanying table in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly reported the percentage decline in the firstquarter earnings of the Mobil Oil Corporation. Mobil's earnings fell 28 per cent in the period.

title: Gotham Book Mart Thins Its Shelves
description: Gotham Book Mart, which has been a literary landmark on West 47th Street for half a century, has decided to relocate and, as part of the move, has sold about 65 per cent of its stock to New Mexico State University at. Las Cruces for $485,000. Book sellers said that it must have been one of the largest retail sales in bookstore history. moved since they were placed there. The university people came armed with tape recorders and Polaroid cameras. It was easier to record the lists and titles on the tape than to have some one write them by hand.

title: Crabiel Cleared on All Counts; Plans Return to Byrne Cabinet
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., April 23New Jersey's Secretary of State, J. Edward. Crabiel, was found not guilty today of charges that he conspired to rig bids and fix prices on public road constructicn contracts in the late nineteensixties.

title: Concert: Sidlin Conducts
description: The National Orchestral Association, which has long trained young instrumentalists in symphonic playing, instituted a conductors' program under the direction of Leon Barzin in 1970, and at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night, a conducting participant in that first year made his New York debut leading an Orchestral Association concert.

title: Nadjari Is Scored but Wins Right to Appeal on Mackell
description: The chief judge of the Court of Appeals yesterday granted Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, permission to appeal a lowercourt decision that had thrown out the indictment of Thomas J. Mackell, the former Queens District Attorney. But the judge sharply criticized Mr. Nadjari's office for attacking the honesty and integrity of the lower court.

title: Shooting and Shouting Incidents Heighten Tension in a Thai Town on the Border Facing Cambodia
description: ARANYAPRATHET, Thailand, April 23Tensions are high in this border town as heavily armed Thai and Cambodian Communist troops glower at each other across a 50foot bridge that once linked these two countries but now separates them.

title: Bulls Eliminate Kings
description: KANSAS CITY, April 23 (AP  The Chicago Bulls blended Jerry Sloan's long and deadly corner shots with brilliant defense and defeated the Kansas CityOmaha Kings, 10189, tonight to move into the N.B.A. Western Conference final.

title: HANOI IS SIGNALING U.S ON TAKEOVER
description: WASHINGTON, April 23The North Vietnamese and Vietcong have told Washington through intermediaries that they do not wish to humiliate the United States in the coming days, but have refused to say anything else, even whether they are prepared to negotiate or on what terms, according to authoritative Administration officials.

title: Notes on People
description: Charles Alan Wright, a defense counsel whom former President Richard M. Nixon failed to inform about two missing White House tapes, was announced yesterday as June commencement speaker at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Conn., but he withdrew about three hours later. Mr. Wright is a 1947 Wesleyan graduate and professor of constitutional law at the University of Texas.

title: WILLIAM J. WALLS, A.M.E. ZION BISHOP
description: Bishop William Jacob Walls, retired spiritual leader and elder statesman of the millionmember African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church (A.M.E. Zion), died yesterday of a kidney ailment at St. John's Riverside Hospital in Yonkers. He was 89 years old and lived at 38 Aqueduct Place, Yonkers.

title: Film: Ten Little Indians
Alabama a Disaster Area
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 23 (UPI)President Ford declared today a state of major disaster for Alabama as a result of storms and flooding beginning April 9, the White House said. The Presidential order opens the way for Alabama to receive Federal aid for the public and private losses.

title: Tornado Hits Missouri Town
description: BRECKENRIDGE, Mo., April 23 (UPI)A tornado touched down briefly today in this down Missouri town, killing an elderly man, damaging about 20 buildings and cutting off power, the police said. Three other persons were hurt, but were treated at a hospital and releasd, th highway patrol said.

title: A Moral Responsibility
description: The people of the United States simply cannot in good conscience shed responsibility for the thousands of ordinary Vietnamese who put their personal trust in the successive waves of Americans with whom they were associated in Vietnam during the past decade or longer.

title: Nixon Tells Coast College Editor That He Is 75 to 80% Recovered
description: LOS ANGELES, April 23 (UPI)Former President Richard M. Nixon, in a brief conversation with the editor of a college newspaper, has said his doctors have told him he is about 75 to 80 per cent recovered from surgery and complications growing out of his phlebitic condition.

title: Seales Stops Elizondo
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif,, April 23 (UPI)  Sugar Ray Seales of Tacoma, Wash., knocked out the middleweight champion of Mexico, Manuel Elizondo, in 1 minute 50 seconds of the second round last night in a scheduled 10rounder.

title: STATE DUE TO MT KUM HOMES
description: The State Health Department said yesterday that it would move next week to put Eugene Hollander, honorary president of the Metropolitan New York Nursing Home Association, out of business as a nursinghome proprietor in the state.

title: Anaconda Adds Cutback In Aluminum Output
description: The Anaconda Company announced yesterday an additional 7 per cent cutback of primary aluminum production due to continued slow demand in the building, transportation and appliance industries. Coupled with previous retrenchments, Anaconda's aluminum division has now curtailed its production by 23.5 per cent of its annual capacity of 600 million pounds.

title: Official on Coast Asks Kissinger For a Meeting on Refugee Influx
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 3 (AP)California's top welfare official sent an urgent message to Secretary of State Kissinger today asking to meet with him about the possible influx of thousands of Vietnamese refugees to the state.

title: Panic Rises in Saigon, But the Exits Are Few
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 24Panic is clearly visible in Saigon now as thousands of Vietnamese try desperately to find ways to flee their country.

title: Willowbrook Hope
description: The signing by Governor Carey of an agreement settle the threeyear court fight over Willowbrook represents only the beginning of hope for the patients consigned to that dismal institution for the mentally retarded.

title: EMERGENCY FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, April 24The House of Representatives, after more than 13 hours of debate, early this morning approved legislation giving the President authority to use American troops to protect the evacuation of Americans and South Vietnamese citizens from Saigon.

title: HANOI SAID TO HOPE FOR U.S. INVESTMENT
description: Frances FitzGerald, a Pulitz er prizewinning author who reported from Indochina in the nineteensixties, believes that North Vietnam hopes eventutally to receive American economic investment.

title: Excerpts From Ford Address at Tulane
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 23 (UPI) Following are excerpts from the text of a speech by Preseident Ford as prepared for delivery last night to the student body of Tulane University:

title: Polishing The Bar
description: CHICAGOThere has been an outcry in recent days, led by Warren E. Burger, the Chief Justice of the United States, about the incapacities of some members of the legal profession to perform their functions well. The fact cannot be gainsaid. There are large numbers of lawyers who cannot do well some or any of the things that lawyers are supposed to be able to do. But the proposed remedy that has gained widespread support, sending the lawyers back to school, is, at best, a vain or idle fancy. It is likely only to add to the costs of legal services that are already beyond the reach of those who need them.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Town of Hempstead and the Village of Valley Stream on Long Island have agreed to try to convince the Jones Beach. State Parkway Authority to roll back its 2[09]cent toll on the Southern State Parkway to 10 cents.

title: GROMYKO OFFERS ISRAEL GUARANTEE
description: MOSCOW, April 23Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko told the Foreign Minister of Syria today that the Soviet Union was prepared to guarantee Israel's existence as an independent state.

title: Tribute Paid to Black Inventor
description: A crowd of schoolchildren, city officials and a black historian walked through gravestones set willy nilly in St. Michael's cemetery in Elmhurst, Queens, yesterday, crushing spring periwinkle and wild chives underfoot, to the unmarked grave of an unsung black inventor.

title: SOUTHWEST AFRICAN SLAIN DURING RIOTING
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, April 23 (Reuters)The police shot and killed a black and wounded 10 othersthree seriouslywhen they opened fire on a stonethrowing crowd here today, the South African Government said.

title: Gallery Gets a New Publisher
description: Steven Saunders, who's been around a while on the publishing side of the socalled skin magazines, now heads a company that has acquired Gallery magazine, which he will be editor and publisher.

title: Belgium to Cut Bank Rate to 7%
description: BRUSSELS, April 23 (Reuters)Belgium is cutting her bank rate to 7 per cent from 7.5 per cent effective tomorrow, the National Bank announced here today.

title: Nessen Says Ford Reads Newspapers Throughout the Day
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 23 (UPI)  President Ford reads newspapers throughout his 18hour workday, Ron Nessen, the White House press secretary, said today.

title: Councilmen Find Service Cuts Preferred to Taxes
description: A number of City Councilmen reported yesterday that many of their constituents preferred further cuts in city services to new or increased taxes to balance Mayor Beame's projected $12.8billion expense bucket.

title: 300Unit Project for Elderly is Dedicated in the Bronx.
description: Kelly Towers, a $10.5million apartment development for the lowincome elderly, was dedicated yesterday in the Bronx by public officials and community leaders.

title: WHITE HOUSE LAG ON SPY DATA SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 23The chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence charged today that excessive delays in turning over documents by the Ford Administration and the Central Intelligence Agency were hampering the committee's investigation.

title: Apartment Construction In City Drops 78% in Year
description: Only three construction permits for private, unsubsidized apartment buildings for five or more familiesfor a total of 65 dwelling unitswere issued in the city during the first three months of this year, according to the State Division of Housing and Community Renewal.

title: SERIOUS CRIMES UP 21.3% IN THE CITY
description: Serious crimes reported to the police in the city increased 21.3 per cent in the first two months of this year compared with the same period last yearone of the largest rises in years.

title: CONVICT DEFENDS 2 IN COAST KILLING
description: SACRAMENTO. Calif., April 23 (AP) Jefferson, convict, said on the witness stand today that he had ordered the killing of Marcus Foster, Oakland School Superintendent.

title: Government Gives Reservation Back To the Menominees
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)  The Government returned the Menominee Indian reservation in Wisconsin yesterday to the tribe.

title: Critic Takes a Role in Thieves Carnival
description: Dwight Macdonald, 69yearold writer for the New Yorker magazine and long a critic of films, books and politics, took on an acting role yesterday in Jean Anouilh's Thieves Carnival at the John Jay College of Criminal Justice.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 24, 1975

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Frelinghuysen Donating Papers

title: Wiesner Says U.S. Has Outrun Technology in ProblemSolving
description: Americans have outrun our technological base and certainly our intellectual base in trying to solve ageold problems in 30 to 40 years, Dr. Jerome B. Wiesner, president of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, said here yesterday.

title: CABINET RESIGNS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 24The South Vietnamese Cabinet formed only two weeks ago, resigned last night as urgent efforts got under way to organize a government acceptable to the Vietcong as a negotiating agent.

title: Galbreath Entry Choice in Blue Grass
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., April 23 The entry of Prince Thou Art and Sylvan Place, which carried John Gaibreath's silks to a onetwo finish in the Florida Derby three weeks ago, is an 85 favorite to take the Blue Grass Stakes tomorrow over the Keeneland course. Recognized as probably the single most important race preceding the Kentucky Derby, the 1mile Blue Grass has attracted nine horses, with several regional stars choosing to test the Galbreath entry.

title: Dance: Night Creature
News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, APRIL 24, 1975

title: Lack of Treaties Hinders Drug Control Effort Here
description: The United States has indicted more than half of the 200 active drug traffickers in Colombia for narcotics violations in this country, but under existing international agreements they cannot be extradited from Colombia or prosecuted at home, So these dealers continue in business, supplying much of the cocaine sold in New York and other major cities.

title: Union Carbide Seeking to Sell Building and Move Out of City
description: The Union Carbide Corporation is engaged in negotiations that may lead to the sale of its 52story office building on Park Avenue and its departure from the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: City Burau Finds 2 + 2 Are Not 4 In School Closings
description: The Beame administration, in what a Budget Bureau spokesman called an inadvertent oversight, has reassigned 1,142 schoolchildren from two Manhattan schools that are scheduled to be closed to two schools that do not exist.

title: Advertising
description: Many large corporations are only now beginning to think of somehow involving themselves in the Bicentennial celebration, according to a check of the top public relations firms.

title: Air Discounts Rejected
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board turned down a restoration of domestic youth fares and discounts for the elderly and families. Youth fares have been approved on transAtlantic flights. Page 38.

title: Lithe, Lively Limbs Show Spirit for 76 At Circus Auditions
description: Legs, which often show up in the circus as lumbering, as with elephants, or leaping, as with lions, were in lithe and wellshaped profusion yesterday at Madison Square Garden as Ringling Bros and Barnum & Bailey held audi tions for 27 women for next year's production. One hundred, count them 100, legs, appended to 50 young women, showed up for the tryouts Jerry Fries, assistant to Richard Barstow, the direc tor of the circus productions, checked elevations in one of the circus rings, while (at far right) three Garden workers paused for reveries of life under the Big Top.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Underwriters headed by Kidder, Peabody & Co., Inc., and Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. marketed yesterday 3 million units comprising 3 million shares of 2.50 cumulative preferred stock with warrants to purchase 3 million shares of common stock of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation. The units are priced at $25 and, each consists of one share of preferred stock and one warrant to buy one common share at $16.25. This figure, the company and underwriters explained, is subject to adjustment in certain events from the date it becomes separately transferable until April 22, 1980, when it expires unless extended by the company at its option for an additional period of up to five years. It was further explained that upon expiration common shares would be issued to holders of unexercised warrants at the rate of one common share for each 100 warrants.

title: Cosmos 729 Launched
description: MOSCOW, April 23 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today a new earth satellite, Cosmos 729, to continue space explorations, the Russian press agency Tass reported here.

title: Mrs. Syms Advances in NorthSouth Golf
description: PINEHURST, N.C., April 23 (AP)Nancy Roth Syms lost the three finishing holes with bogeys, then pulled her faltering game together long enough for a 20hole victory over Sue Higgs of Canada today in the quarterfinals of the North and South amateur gold tournament.

title: Kennedy Games Canceled
description: BERKELEY, Calif., April 23 (AP)The University of California's annual Kennedy Games invitation track meet has been canceled. Instead, California will be the host to the United States Track and Field Federation Meet of Champions at Edwards Stadium on June 14.

title: Jersey Announces New InstantLottery With Lots of Prizes
description: TRENTON, April 23 (AP)The New Jersey Lottery Commission announced today that it would begin an instant lottery game in June.

title: STATE AGENCY GETS LOAN AT 9.6 RATE
description: ALBANY, April 23An extraordinary high interest rate of 9.6253 per cent on a loan to one of the state agencies afflicted by the fallout from the Urban Development Corporation's fiscal troubles was approved today by Controller Arthur Levitt.

title: The Easing of Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, April 23A sharp decline in production and cbs seems to have done much more than WIN buttons or local vegetable gardens toward solving the nation's inflation problem.

title: Fryman Shuts Out Pirates Again
description: Woodie Fryman, who began his major league pitching career with Pittsburgh in 1966, turned on his former teammates yesterday as he pitched the Montreal Expos to a 50 triumph over the Pirates in Montreal. The victory was Montreal's fourth in four games against the Pirates this season and Fryman's second. He shut out Pittsburgh by the same score a week ago in Pittsburgh.

title: Narcotic Agent Lives a Boyhood Dream
description: From the time he was a young boy. the son of the local constable in the sleepy Texas town of Palacios, George Frangullie always wanted to be a cop.

title: Oregon Town Greets 148 Vietnam Refugees
description: MOUNT ANGEL, Ore., April 23 (AP)  A group of 148 South Vietnamese orphans and refugees arrived in this town of 2,500 today after day of feverish preparations by residents.

title: U.S. STEEL FIGHTS POLLUTION ORDER
description: ATLANTA, April 23  The United States Steel Corporation and the Government locked environmental horns again today in the continuing battle over whether the company was pouring too many pollutants into the nation's air.

title: What Went Wrong?
description: WASHINGTONIn 1969, President Thieu met with President Nixon on Midway Island to announce the beginning of America's troop withdrawals from Vietnam. In private conversation before the two leaders went out to face the cameras, Mr. Nixon told General Thieu: I would not like to be breaking the umbilical cord to your people.

title: PRISONER'S DEATH LINKED TO GANGS
description: JOLIET, Ill., April 23 (AP)The death of a prison inmate in a sixhour uprising resulted from his efforts to act as a peacemaker in the disturbance that had its roots in gang activity, prison officials say.

title: Tomahawks Lose 2d Lacrosse Game
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 23  The Philadelphia Wings gained their second victory in four professional National Lacrosse League games by defeating the Long Island Tomahawks, 199, tonight before 5,040 fans at the Spectrum.

title: Kaunda Said to Foresee a Long Rhodesian Effort
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia. April 23  President Kenneth D. Kaunda of neighboring Zambia was quoted here today as having said that he thought would take more than 10 years to achieve majority rule for the blacks of Rhodesia.

title: On Tap or By the Bottle, Newk Is Ready
description: John Newcombe can't be too concerned about Jimmy Connors, not if he's drinking beer.

title: Duane Bobick Victor
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., April 23 (AP)Undefeated heavyweight Duane Bohick of Bowlus, Minn., scored unanimous 10round decision tonight over Raul Gorsito of Argentina for his 27th professional boxing victory. However, Duane's younger brother, Rodney Bohick was soundly beaten by Scott Le Doux, a Minneapolis heavyweight, in the main event. Le Doux recorded a unanimous decision.

title: 3 Seized on Charges Of Tax Conspiracy To Aid the Mafia
description: A garment center businessman and two reputed Mafia figures were arrested yesterday on charges invoiving an alleged tax evasion conspiracy designed to provide members of organized crime with apparently legitimate sources of income.

title: New Hampshire Governor Vows a Senate Challenge
description: CONCORD, N.H., April 23 (AP)With or without the state Attorney General, New Hampshire will sue the United States Senate over the state's disputed Senate race betwen John Durkin, a Dmocrat, and former Representative Louis C. Wyman, Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr. said today.

title: SUGAR CONTRACTS DRIFT DOWNWARD
description: World sugar futures drifted downward yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, despite some talk that snow in Idaho was still delaying planting of the sugar beet crop in that area.

title: Security National Loss In'74 Put at $38Million
description: The Security National Bank, which the Controller of the Currency forced to sell its assets to the Chemical Bank in January, had a loss of $38million in 1974 after making a $62million provision for loan losses.

title: Danes Bar Loan to Hanoi
description: COPENHAGEN, April 23 (Reuters)A Danish parliamentary committee departed today from the country's traditional policy of aidwithoutstrings when it rejected a Government application to lend North Vietnam 150 million kronerabout $27million.

title: Commonwealth Oil Asks Court To Bar Tesoro's Bid for Stock
description: The Commonwealth Oil Refining Company: Inc., of Puerto Rico filed suit yesterday in the United States Court for the Southern District of New York seeking an injunction to prevent the Tesoro Petroleum Corporation of San Antonio, Tex., from purchasing any Commonwealth shares. Commonwealth also seeks to have Tesoro divest itself of shares already purchased. Last Friday, Tesoro made a tender offer to purchase 5.5 million shares of Commonwealth stock at $11.50 a share. On Tuesday, the Charter Company of Jacksonville, Fla., said it had entered into preliminary discussions regarding a possible merger of Commonwealth into Charter.

title: State Aid for City Transit Is Adopted by Legislature
description: ALBANY, April 23  The transitaid program that will let the Metropolitan Transportation Authority resume paying its bills received final legislative approval today in a talky, politically pointed Assembly session.

title: In Angola's Political Maneuvering, a Moderate Gains Support
description: LUSO, AngolaIf ballots instead of guns are permitted to settle the future of Angola, a political unknown may emerge as the African country's new leader.

title: Reds Trail on Eve of Election in Portugal
description: LISBON, April 23Portugal's election campaign ended today with the Communists apparently trailing in tine race for seats in the constituent assembly to be chosen on Friday.

title: Clark Center Phased Out
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Philippines, April 23  Clark Air Base is being phased out as the main receiving center for evacuees from South Vietnam, military officials confirmed here today.

title: How Did It Happen? Some Replies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 23The Communists, in the words of the Pentagon, now have unlimited military options, and, as the Army Chief of Staff, Gen. Frederick C. Weyand, has testifled, they have the capability to overwhelm South Vietnam if they want to.

title: LEVI BACKS SHIFT ON DRUG RAID CASE
description: WASHINGTON. April 23 (AP) The Justice Department is delending five Federal narcotics agents and one former agent against civil suits for the violent drug raids in Collinsville, Ill., after prosecuting the same men on criminal charges in the case.

title: Senate Leader Contends Carey Reneges on a Vow to Retarded
description: ALBANY, April 23  The State Senate's deputy majority leader, William T. Conklin, today rejected a proposal by Governor Carey for the creation of an Office of Retardation and Developmental Disabilities in the Department of Mental Hygiene.

title: Singapore Leader in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 23Just one week after the surrender of Phnom Penh, Lee Kwan Yew, Prime Minister of Singapore, has paid a twoday visit to Thailand, where he discussed the latest developments, in Indochina with Thai Government and military leaders.

title: People and Business
description: Raymond L. Dirks, the man who uncovered the insurance fraud that led to the collapse of the Equity Funding Corporation of America two years ago, disclosed yesterday that the Securities and Exchange Commission is showing renewed interest in him.

title: People in Sports
description: I think the chances are pretty good I'll do it, says Rod Carew, the Minnesota Twins' threetime American League batting champion about his intentions to convert to Judaism, the religion of his wife, Marilyn, I've learned so much from my family itself, said Carew. You go into a Jewish home and there's so much warmth. They embrace. They kiss. It's not like walking into any other home.

title: A Shuffle In Drive For Cup
description: After stunning setbacks for two straight years, the United States Tennis Association reorganized its Davis Cup committee yesterday as the first step in a drive to regain the coveted international team trophy.

title: Ford Called Anticonsumer
description: WASHINGTON April 23 (UPI) President Ford was accused, today of ignoring consumer needs by opposing the creation of a Federal consumer advocacy agency. Representative James J. Howard, Democrat of New Jersey, charged in a statement that the nation's consumers are annually cheated out of billions of their hardearned dollars and that Mr. Ford had flatly stated to those people that they will have to continue to lose that money when he threatened to veto [consumer] legislation if it passed.

title: NBC Movies Will PinchHit for Baseball
description: NBCTV has suspended the Monday night telecasts of major league baseball games until June 2 and, beginning next week, will substitute movies. The programing maneuver is widely described in the industry as an attempt by the network to build up ratings during a period when the A. C. Nielsen Company and Arbitron are conducting their seasonal surveys for local stations.

title: Oil Officials, in Linwood Forum, Rebut Fears on Offshore Drilling
description: LINWOOD, April 23 Oilindustry spokesmen said today in this Atlantic County community that fears about offshore drilling were unfounded.

title: Ousted Executive Aide Charges Byrne With Conflicts of Interest
description: TRENTON, April 23  The former executive assistant to Governor Byrne charged today that the Governor had been personally involved in a number of unspecified conflicts of interest.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Boston vs. Houston

title: Newsmen's Shield Bill Snagged Again
description: WASHINGTON, April 23The issue of a law permitting reporters to keep their news sources confidential came up in the new Congress today, with the same result as in the last two sessionsinstant impasse.

title: New Laser Technique May Facilitate Output of Atomic Fuel and Weapons
description: A laser technique that scientists believe will make it easier to produce nuclear weapons and commercial nuclear power has been developed by the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory.

title: Carey Warns State Chiefs Of Budgetary Reductions
description: ALBANY, April 23Governor Carey met with the heads of state agencies and departments this afternoon and told them they would soon be receiving reduced budgets, reflecting the State Senate's refusal to pass new taxes.

title: HOUSE UNIT SHIFTS DATE ON GAS TAX
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 The House Ways and Means Committee voted today to give Congress more time to cancel or modify a proposed 20cent increase in the Federal gasoline tax that is a key element in the pending energy conservation bill.

title: U.S. Is Struggling to Resettle the Vietnam Refugees
description: WASHINGTON, April 23As thousands of Vietnamese fled Saigon aboard American military aircraft, State Department officials here were still grappling today with plans for their resettlement.

title: 1915 Genocide Is Still Vivid to Armenians Here
description: New York, a city of survivors, will be reminded today by its small but articulate Armenian community of one of the century's first and worst genocides, which wiped out half of its compatriots who lived in the Turkish part of Armenia 60 years ago.

title: 2 in Mount Holly Cleared In Security Guard's Death
description: MOUNT HOLLY, April 23 (AP)  Two men reportedly connected with the Campisi crime family have been acquitted of firstdegree murder and armed robbery charges by a Burlington County jury here.

title: Hunter Loses 73 Lead, Yanks Bow, 117; Seaver and Staub Star in Met Victory
description: The old Tom Seaver outpitched the old, old Bob Gibson yesterday as the New York Mets continued their recent rumpus by mauling the St. Louis Cardinals, 71.

title: 1915 Genocide Is Still Vivid to Armenians Here
description: NeW York, a city of survivors, will be reminded today by its small but articulate Armenian community of one of the century's first and worst genocides, which wiped out half of its compatriots who lived in the Turkish part of Armenia 60 years ago.

title: Panel in Senate Opens Hearing On Legislation for Gun Control
description: WASHINGTON, April 23A Senate Judiciary subcommittee began hearings today on gun control, and the issueimmediately became whether the public would comely with gun laws.

title: Seaboard Coast's Net Off; T.W.A. Warns of Big Loss
description: Seaboard Coast Line Industries, whose railroad of the same name is one of the biggest systems serving the South and the Southeast, and the Missouri Pacific Railroad, a major carrier serving the Midwest and Southwest, both reported sharply lower earnings yesterday for the March quarter.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NIGHT NUGGET Phone inquiries to Manhattan evening spots can yield cryptic, even chilling responses that are strictly business and prices. Not so with 7538270  Roger's Restaurant, at 324 East 57th Street, (between First and Second Avenues, south side), where Goldie Hawkins is at the keyboard around 9 P.M. Tuesdays through Saturdays. The telephone voice said: There's no cover or minimum, we serve food till midnight and we'd be happy to have you sit at the bar and nurse a Coke all evening.

title: HANOI IS SIGNALING U.S. ON TAKEOVER
description: WASHINGTON, April 23The North Vietnamese and Vietcong have told Washington through intermediaries that they do not wish to humiliate the United States in the coming days, but have refused to say anything else, even whether they are prepared to negotiate or on what terms, according to authoritative Administration officials.

title: Company Cuts Dividend
description: The McGrawEdison Company announced yesterday in Chicago that it was reducing its quarterly dividend on the common stock to 30 cents a share from 37.5 cents. The dividend is payable June 12 to shareholders of record May 12.

title: People in Sports
description: I think the chances are pretty good I'll do it, says Rod Carew, the Minnesota Twins' threetime American League batting champion about his intentions to convert to Judaism, the religion of his wife, Marilyn, I've learned so much from my family itself, said Carew. You go into a Jewish home and there's so much warmth. They embrace. They kiss. It's not like walking into any other home.

title: Nicklaus Canadian Entry
description: MONTREAL, April 23 (AP) Jack Nicklaus, who won the Masters golf tournament for a record fifth time two weeks ago, has entered the Canadian open tournament to be held July 24 through 27 at the Royal Montreal Golf Club.

title: JOSEPH DAVIS, 89, FOOD ECONOMIST
description: Joseph Stancliffe Davis, an international authority on world food production, an economist and a former director of Stanford University's Food Research Institute, died yesterday in Los Altos, Calif. He was 89 years old.

title: WOMAN LOSES BID IN SLAYING AT JAIL
description: WASHINGTON, N.C., April 23 (UPI)A judge refused today to dismiss a murder indictanent against a young black woman who is charged with slaying a white jailer she says tried to rape her in her cell.

title: Plan to Spur Economy Announced by Giscard
description: PARIS, April 23 (Reuters)President Valry Giscard d'Estaing tonight announced a $3.45billion program to stimulate the flagging French economy.

title: Bronx Man Is Seized in Slaying Of Youth During a Crime Spree
description: A 25yearold unemployed butcher was arrested early yesterday following a sixhour crime spree that the police said began when he stabbed and killed a 19yearold Bronx youth and seriously wounded the youth's mother while stealing her car.

title: Procter & Gamble Net at Peak; Continental Oil Gains
description: The Procter & Gamble Company and the ColgatePalmolive Company, two big makers of soaps, cleaners and household products, achieved record sales and earnings in the quarter ended March 31, according to results announced yesterday.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Threat to Close Picatinny Called Disastrous by Byrne
description: TRENTON, April 23 (AP)Governor Byrne said today that the possible closing of the Picatinny Arsenal and the elimination of 5,700 jobs would be disastrous to the state's economy.

title: Methadone Tied to Low Male Fertility
description: Methadone, a drug widely used in the treatment of heroin addiction, may impair the fertility and sexual performance of many of the men who take it according to the findings of a preliminary study published yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: According to the dust jacket of The Straw Man, Barbara Goldsmith is an awardwinning journalist, a former contributing editor of New York magazine and senior editor of Harper's Bazaar. She is also a trustee of the Parks Council of New York, a former member of the Junior Council of the Museum of Modern Art and a member of the acquisitions committee of the Friends of the Whitney Museum. As anyone can see, she is well qualified to write about the politics of art and art museums in New York City.

title: In Tam in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 23 (AP)Another Cambodian leader on the Communist death list has fled to Thailand, leaving only two of the seven unaccounted for.

title: Howell in Rangers' Future?
description: Will Harry Howell become the next coach of the New York Rangers? Howell, an exRanger, says lie has not been asked. Emile Francis, the Rangers' general manager and current coach, says it is silly to answer the question now.

title: Colonels Beat Spirits
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 13 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels shook off a pesky St. Louis Spirits' defense tonight and won the second game of the American Basketball Association's Eastern Division semifinals, 108103.

title: New Curbs Urged on U.S. Nuclear Sales Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 The United States' approval of the export of nuclear materials and equipment that could be used in the manufacture of weapons is coming under increasing Congressional criticism and could result in changes in the processing of export licenses.

title: City Bureau Finds 2 + 2 Are Not 4 In School Closings
description: The Beame administration, in what a Budget Bureau spokesman called an inadvertent oversight, has reassigned 1,142 schoolchildren from two Manhattan schools that are scheduled to be closed to two schools that do not exist.

title: U.S. Reserve Assets Rise
description: The nation's total reserve assets rose $124million in March to $16.26billion, the Treasury announced yesterday. The rise reflected a $129million increase in the United States reserve position in the International Monetary Fund and $17million rise to $19million in United States holding's of convertible foreign currencies. The increases offset a $21million decline in holdings of special drawing rights and $1million decreaseto $11.62billionin United States gold holdings.

title: PENTAGON CHIEF ASSURES ISRAEL OF SECURITY AID
description: WASHINGTON, April 23Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger has assured Israel that the Ford Administration's reassessment of Middle East policies will not diminish continuing American support for Israel's security.

title: H. E. W. Head Opposes Ban on DES as Birth Curb
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)The Ford Administration would not oppose a legislative ban on the use of a suspected cancercausing hormone in cattle feed, Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, told Congress today.

title: Bills Before Legislature to Protect Dogs
description: There are 66 bills in the Legislature regarding pets, the vast majority of them for dogs. This the Dog Fanciers Club learned from Gordon Carvill at its meeting here last week as he discussed those measures he believed should be either passed or defeated. Carvill also called for fanciers to urge their organizations to join the Association of Dog Clubs of New York State, which he said serves as a watchdog for breeders and exhibitors in matters of education, legislation and fraudulent actions.

title: MARKET BASKET COST FELL $9 IN MARCH
description: WASHINGTON. April 23 (AP) The annual retail cost of a farmproduced food market basket dropped $9 in March, the first drop since last July, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: DR. SIGMUND MAGE
description: Dr. Sigmund Mage, a surgeon specializing in gastroenterol ogy, died yesterday at Beekman Downtown Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 601 East 20th Street.

title: PRICES TUMBLE ON AMEX AND OTC
The Way to Leave Vietnam
description: WASHINGTONAll that remains in the Vietnamese war is the final killing. Our goal must be to minimize it. The critical immediate problem with which we must be concerned is the safe evacuation of the thousandodd American citizens in South Vietnam.

title: PENTAGON CHIEF ASSURES ISRAEL OF SECURITY AID
description: WASHINGTON, April 23Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger has assured Israel that the Ford Administration's reassessment of Middle East policies will not diminish continuing American support for Israel's security.

title: Vietnam to California Sadness, Uncertainty, Relief
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., April 23Two more plane loads of employes of the United States Government and its contractors, accompanied by their Vietnamese dependents, arrived here today. Some met loved ones and rejoiced; others wept over their uncertain future.

title: Egypt and Syria Form Committee to Unify Policies Against Israel
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, April 23 (Reuters)President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and President Hafez alAssad of Syria announced today that they had agreed to set up a committee Ito help unify strategy against Israel.

title: Three Times Reporters Honored With Guild's Page One Awards
Linden Man Gets Life Sentence In the 1969 Murder of a Girl, 17
description: FREEHOLD, April 23 (AP)Robert Zarinsky was found guilty today of firstdegree murder in the death of 17yearold Rosemary Calandriello of Atlantic Highlands.

title: CITY AUDIT FINDS RISE IN PARKING TICKETS
description: The city is giving tickets to more parking violators but has not increased its rate of collecting on the summonses, according to an audit of the Parking Violations Bureau by Controller Harrison J. Goldin.

title: Brooklyn Union Gas Lifts Net 17.5% in 2d Quarter
description: The Brooklyn Union Gas Company, a major supplier of natural gas services in metropolitan New York, reported yesterday a 17.5 per cent increase in net income for the second quarter ended March 31 compared with earnings for the same period a year ago.

title: Portugal's Election
description: A year after the military revolt that ended a halfcentury of rightwing dictatorship, Portugal goes to the polls tomorrow to determine whether a chance still exists to move toward democracy and avoid a dictatorship the left.

title: Concern's 65% Advance in Quarter Is First in Petroleum in 1975
description: The Continental Oil Company became yesterday the first of the nation's large petroleum corporations to announce profit gain for the first quarter of 1975

title: Big Board Seat Is Sold
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that a seat was sold for $100,000, up $2,000 from the previous sale Tuesday. Seats are now quoted at $80,000 bid, $100,000 asked.

title: Playoff Refunds Ready
description: Refunds on all Knicks and Rangers playoff tickets will continue daily through next Wednesday at the Madison Square Garden box office. After that date requests for refunds will be accepted only by mail.

title: City's Homage to Holland Gets the Mayor in Dutch
description: It is a rule universally acknowledged in the city limits of (New York that the politician who singles out one ethnic group for special praise here places himself in immediate peril with all others.

title: Ford Says Indochina War Is Finished for America
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 25President Ford, calling on the nation to develop an agenda for the future, declared today that the war in Indochina was finished as far as America is concerned.

title: Concert
description: Posterity may well mark Tuesday evening's program by the New York Philharmonic at Avery Fisher Hall as the occasion of Boris Belkin's American debut, since Mr. Belkin is clearly an artist of consequence. But attention was most immediately seized by Leonard Bernstein's typically selfeffacing response to the opening of the Bolshoi Ballet across the plaza.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: AUTO SALES RATE DECLINES BY 18.4%
description: DETROIT, April 23 The domestic auto industry, looking for a spring upturn in sales, has failed to find it so far. The daily selling rate was down 18.4 per cent in midAprilthe worst performance for the period in 14 years.

title: Panic Rises in Saigon, But the Exits Are Few
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 24Panic is clearly visible in Saigon now as thousands of Vietnamese try desperately to find ways to flee their country.

title: A Day of Fashions, Photos and Faces
description: Two lions came to town this week and, predictably, they were lionized. They came hearing quasicultural gifts, the viewing of which swelled the coffers of two local charities. And if their egos were also swelled as a result of the adulation, where's the harm?

title: Wife of Soviet Jew Says Appeal to Save His Life Is Rejected
description: MOSCOW, April 23 The life of Mikhail Y. Leviyev, a Soviet Jew condemned to death for economic crimes, said today that the Supreme Court had rejected the final appeal of the sentence.

title: Americans Oppose Arms for Saigon, Gallup Poll Shows
description: Americans overwhelmingly oppose President Ford's request for $722million in military aid for South Vietnam, according to a national opinion survey by the Gallup Poll.

title: Music: Sound of Silence
description: It was John Cage who discovered that there is no such thing as silenceor it was he, at any rate, who made a noise in the avantgarde musical world some years ago by being the first to write a piece based on the noisy properties of silence, the unforgettable 4 minutes and 33 seconds. Following up on Mr. Cage's perception,Carman Moore's Museum Piece, which had its first performance on Tuesday night at the Guggenheim Museum, takes the idea a step further and makes a witty piece of it.

title: Father of the Quintuplets Says He Wasn't Expecting So Many
description: CINCINNATI, April 23 (AP) Mark Levy, the father of newborn quintuplets, said today that he received the first hint or what was in store or him only moments before he officially got the news.

title: Upheavals in Indochina Stir Three Asia Capitals
description: NEW DELHI, April 23Amid evidence of some apprehension about events in Indochina and a growing antiAmerican mood here, India's Foreign Minister, today applauded the dramatic changes taking place in Cambodia and South Vietnam.

title: Chicago Sniper Kills Man, Then Is Captured by Police
description: CHICAGO, April 23 (UPI)A youth armed with a carbine opened fire at two persons on a South Side street and then took on the police in an exchange of gunfire tonight. One person was killed and another was serious wounded.

title: AMERICAN ELECTRIC SHOWS ENERGY PLEA
description: Donald C. Cook, chairman of the American Electric Power Company, the nation's largest investorowned electric utility, presented his shareholders yesterday with his case against the Government, utility regulators, environmentalists and consumer groups.

title: Stage: A Beautiful and Provoking Hedda Gabler
description: WASHINGTON, April 23We all knew that Washington was rapidly becoming an important theater town, but the idea that a major imported production, from Britain's Royal Shakespeare Company, no less, and starring Glenda Jackson, should bypass New York and play Washington may seem outlandish. Yet that is precisely what is happening to Trevor Nunn's new staging of Ibsen's Hedda Gabler, which began life in Australia this season, appeared in Los Angeles and last night opened at the National Theater here, on its way home to its London premier.

title: PRICES DEFENDED ON STOCK OPTIONS
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Company responded yesterday to criticism about reducing the purchase price of management stock options at its annual meeting and a news conference that preceded it.

title: U.S. Dollar Declines To a 7Week Low; Price of Gold Climbs
description: BRUSSELS, April 23 (UPI)A sudden selling flurry today sent the dollar tumbling to sevenweek low in Paris and twoweek lows on other European money markets. The dollar's fall helped raise the price of gold.

title: A.&P. Told to End Advertising Sales on OutofStock Products
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)The Federal Trade Commission today ordered the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, the nation's secondlargest food chain, not to advertise items at sales prices unless the stores have them on hand for the shoppers to buy.

title: Military Business Defended by G.E.
description: BOSTON, April 23While 75 protesters quietly picketed and read poetry outside the Statler Hilton Hotel today, Reginald H. Jones, chairman of the General Electric Company, spent nearly four hours inside the hotel defending the company's military business, its nuclear safety record and its operations in foreign countries.

title: They Battle Inflation By Trading Down
description: As the Government was reporting a drop in the climb of its cost of living index this week, individual Americans were cutting their personal costs of living by what is known as trading down.

title: Union Carbide Sees Difficulty In Equaling Its 1974 Earnings
description: The Union Carbide Corporation believes it will be difficult, but not impossible, for second  quarter earnings to equal last year's levels, William S. Sneath, president, told some 1,700 stockholders at yesterday's annual meeting here.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, APRIL 24, 1975

title: Braves Victors, Tie Builets, 33
description: BUFFALO. April 23The Buffalo Braves exploded out of the 19th tie of the game, 8989, with 5 straight points and went on to a 10296 triumph over the Washington Bullets tonight at Memorial Auditorium.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article and an accompanying table in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly reported the percentage decline in the firstquarter earnings of the Mobil Oil Corporation. Mobil's earnings fell 28 per cent in the period.

title: Greek Proposes Dismissal Of Charges for Junta Role
description: ATHENS, April 23 (UPI)A Greek investigating magistrate has proposed that charges against 104 leading members of the ousted miiltary junta he dropped, an Athens court said today.

title: WAGE COUNCIL SEEKS CEREALPRICE DATA
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)  The Council on Wage and Price Stability asked six major cereal companies today to submit data explaining why retail prices of their products are going up while the costs of ingredients are falling.

title: National Steel Net Up 3.9% in Quarter
description: The National Steel Corporation reported yesterday firstquarter sales of $604.3million, up 2.6 per cent over the $588.9million of a year ago.

title: J. W. McGovern, 79, Dies; Led U.S. Rubber, N.A.M.
description: John W. McGovern, former president of the United States Rubber Company, who left that post to become president of the National Association of Manufacturers, died yesterday in Good Samaritan Hospital, Palm Beach, Fla., where he lived. He was 79 years old.

title: Market Place
description: Last New Year's Eve Schroeder Boulton, vice president in charge of research for Jesup & Lamont, Inc., endorsed a research report by Richard R. Olivere Jr., recommending Consolidated Edison stock.

title: Arts Figures Speak of Italy con Amore at Rizzoli's
description: Simon Michael Bessie looked around at the red velvet armchairs in Rizzoli's International Bookstore and announced that the people in them were so distinguished that to bother introducing any of them would be folly.

title: Smith's Heaven and Earth at Whitney
description: Because it's been some time since Harry Smith's Heaven and Earth Magic Feature has been available to the public on a regular basis, the Whitney Museum's current booking should not be missed by anyone interested in this classic American avantgarde film.

title: Terrible Looting' in Da Nang Laid to Panicky Saigon Units
description: DA NANG, South Vietnam, April 22 (Agence FrancePresse) A parish priest who witnessed the capture of Da Nang by Communist forces said today that there was terrible looting by South Vietnamese soldiers before the city fell.

title: China Tour Approved By N.C.A.A.
description: KANSAS CITY, April 23 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association gave approval today to college athletes who wish to accompany the Amateur Athletic Union track and field team that will tour mainland China next month.

title: U.S. Bond Prices Firm as Fed Supplies Reserves
RIDERS REROUTED ON FLUSHING LINE
description: Thousands of subway riders who use the Flushing line were forced to use other lines to get home during the evening rush hour yesterday because work crews found a cracked Ibeam on the elevated section of the line east of the Hunters Point station in Queens.

title: TRIVIAL FUNCTION FOR RABBIS DECRIED
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y. April 23American Jewish communities and heads of congregations were criticized today by the new vice president of the rabbinic body of Conservative Judaism for having trivialized the role of the rabbi and case him as a ribbon cutter.

title: Lafayette Plays City Game
description: In Bensonhurst baseball is the city game. Drawing on a rich lode of talent in the Italian  American area of South Brooklyn. Gil Fersht man has directed Lafayette to two Public Schools Athletic League titles in three seasons, and the Frenchies won 17 of 18 games this season. Fershtman is also the school's basketball coach; his team lost in the P.S.A.L. final last month to Taft.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Bridge:
WILLIAM N. GOODWIN, INVENTOR, 98, DEAD
description: William N. Goodwin Jr., inventor of the photoelectric ex posure meter and its accompanying filmrating system, died Saturday at the Doylestown (Pa.) Hospital, following a fall a few days earlier at his home in New Hope, Pa. He was 98 years old.

title: Norwegian Labor Party Chooses the Next Premier
description: OSLO, Norway, April 23 (AP) The governing Labor party, looking ahead to Premier Trygve Bratteli's planned resignation before the elections of September, 1977, announced today that it had chosen Odvar Nordli to succeed him when the time comes.

title: Stamford Publisher Disputes Charge of Suppressing News
description: STAMFORD Conn., April 23  Kingsley Gillespie, publisher of The Stamford Advocate and The Greenwich Time and president of Radio Station WSTC, insisted in a Federal Communications Commission hearing today that he had not used his power to suppress news or to deny a forum for aspiring politicians who failed to win his personal approval.

title: Cleveland Orchestra in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 23 (AP)The Cleveland Orchestra made its Brazilian debut last night to a standing ovation that brought the conductor Lorin Maazel back seven times to the stage of the Municipal Theater. More than 3,000 persons, including Ambassador John Crimmins of the United States, Gov. Faria Lima of Rio de Janeiro and other top officials, attended the performance. The orchestra leaves today for So Paulo.

title: Dorothea Castles, 75, Dies; A Teacher of Photography
description: Dorothea Smith Castles, who had been a book reviewer for The New York Herald Tribune and a professional teacher of photography, died yesterday in Morristown (N. J.) Memorial Hospital. She was 75 years old and lived in Mendham, N. J.

title: Lack of Treaties Hinders Drug Control Effort Here
description: The United States has indicted more than half of the 200 active drug traffickers in Colombia for narcotics violations in this country, but under existing international agreements they cannot be extradited from Colombia or prosecuted at home. So these dealers continue in business, supplying much of the cocaine sold in New York and other major cities.

title: Could Hit $46Million
description: Trans World Airlines, Inc., warned its stockholders yesterday that its loss for calendar 1975 could be twice as great as the $23.3million deficit reported in 1974. Late last week, T.W.A.the only American airline to operate both extensive domestic and international routesreported a $73.3million net loss for the first quarter of this year.

title: Soviet and India Conclude New SpaceLaunch Accord
description: MOSCOW, April 23 (Reuters) India has signed a secondstage space agreement with the Soviet Union following the successful launch of her first earth sattelite on a Soviet rocket, Tass reported today.

title: Sihanouk Is Willing to Pass Up Cambodian Rule
description: PEKING, April 23Prince Norodom Sihanouk has said that he will not be upset if the victorious Khmer Rouge did not abide by their offer to let him return to Cambodia as chief of state.

title: $35 an Acre
description: The House Subcommittee on Energy and the Environment, a unit of the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs, has finished hearings and is at work framing another bill on landuse planning. The procedure getting to be something of an annual event in Congress, with Representative Udall of Arizona and Senator Jackson of Washington doing their best to bring the country to a realization that its future lies in a coherent use its ultimate treasurethe land.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: Kentucky vs. St. Louis

title: BLAZES IN NEWARK CAUSE EMERGENCY
description: NEWARK, April 23  The Newark Police Department dedared a state of emergency for three hours this afternoon after several major fires tied up most of the city's police and fire units and snarled traffic throughout the downtown area.

title: Chess:
Criminal Code Revision Near Congress Test
description: WASHINGTON, April 23A massive and controversial revision of the Federal Criminal Code is approaching its first test in Congress, with a powerful coalition of sponsors determined to push the complex legislation through before the 1976 election.

title: Islanders Lick Their Wounds
description: Controlling information as well as the puck has been part of the New York Islanders' defense in their fourof  seven  game quarterfinal series with the Pittsburgh Penguins. The Penguins won the first three games, but the Islanders have won the next two. The sixth game is scheduled tonight at 8 o'clock in Nassau Coliseum.

title: Crabiel Cleared on All Counts; Plans Return to Byrne, Cabinet
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., April 23New Jersey's Secretary of State, J. Edward Crabiel, was found not guilty today of charges that he conspired to rig bids and fix prices on public road construction contracts in the late nineteensixties.

title: Nadjari Is Scored but Wins Right to Appeal on Mackell
description: The chief judge of the Court of Appeals yesterday granted Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, permission to appeal a lowercourt decision that had thrown out the indictment of Thomas J. Mackell, the former Queens District Attorney. But the judge sharply criticized Mr. Nadjari's office for attacking the honesty and integrity of the lower court.

title: Four Are Injured In a School Fight At Boca Raton, Fla.
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., April 23 (UPI)  Black students, greeted by a racial slur scrawled on a gymnasium wall, battled white students at Boca Raton High School for two hours this morning. Three students and a policeman were iniured.

title: S.E.C. Grants Advice Exemption of 4 Months to BrokerDealers
description: WASHINGTON. April 23 The Securities and Exchange Commission today granted fourmonth exemption from the Investment Advisers Act to brokerdealers who charge separately for research and other investment advice for customers after fixed commission sates are terminated on May 1.

title: A PLAN TO SCREEN TERRORISTS ENDS
description: The Washington Star

title: POLLUTION FORCES CLOSIN6 OF PLANT
description: INDEPENDENCE TOWNSHIP, April 23The Ashland Chemical Company, the largest industry in this rural Warren County township, temporarily shut down equipment this afternoon that was causing pollution problems.

title: Stockton And Cox Beaten
description: HOUSTON, April 23 (AP)Eddie Dibbs, who has been sick for a month, upset secondseeded Mark Cox, 76, 06, 62, in the second round of the $60,000 World Championship Tennis Red Group tournament at the River Oaks Country Club today. The loss jeopardized the Briton's chances of making the $100,000 eightman W.C.T. singles finals in Dallas next month.

title: Ford Says Indochina War Is Finished for America
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 25President Ford, calling on the nation to develop an agenda for the future, declared today that the war in Indochina was finished as far America is concerned.

title: CONTINUING U.S. AID IS PLEDGED TO ASIA
description: MANILA, April 23Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said today the United States would continue to support economic development in Asia and would honor its commitments toward this goal.

title: U.S. Agency to Add Another 10 Species To Endangered List
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI) The Interior Department announced today that it planned to add 10 more animals to its list of endangered species, including the American crocodile, the Mexican wolf and three Hawaiian birds.

title: TWO FOUND SLAIN IN NEWARK DUMP
description: The bodies of a Montclair, N.J., bowlingalley owner and young bowlingalley employe, who had been missing since Jan. 13, were discovered in Newark dumping ground yesterday, the apparent victims of a ganglandstyle execution.

title: Instant Lottery to Be Started In June, With Lots of Prizes
description: TRENTON, April 23 (AP)The New Jersey Lottery Commission announced today that it would begin an instant lottery game in June.

title: CABINET RESIGNS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, April 24The South Vietnamese Cabinet formed only two weeks ago, resigned last night as urgent efforts got under way to organize a government acceptable to the Vietcong as a negotiating agent.

title: New Rate Programs Announced by Bache
description: New stockcommission plans available after May 1, were announced yesterday by Bache & Co., one of the nation's biggest brokerage firm. The plans include sizable discounts on shortterm trades of all sizes.

title: Polished Jewel on Diamond
description: Off the baseball diamond, Steve Baum does not have the physical appearance of an athlete, but once he moves onto the pitching mound for North Bergen High School Me appears invincible. On those days, in fact, the entire team looks unbeatable.

title: $179MILLION LOSS REPORTED BY A.&P.
description: The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, which last month announced that it would close 1,250, or more than onethird of its stores within 12 months to improve Its profits, reported yesterday a loss of $179million in the fourth quarter ended Feb. 22. This compares with a net profit of $12.4million, or 50 cents a share, in the same quarter the vear before.

title: EMERGENCY FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, April 24The House of Representatives, after more than 13 hours of debate, early this morning approved legislation, giving the President authority to use American troops to protect the evacuation of Americans and South Vietnamese citizens from Saigon.

title: No End of a Lesson: I
description: BOSTON, April 23We should have had no illusion that it would end well, when it finally did end. But we did not have to expect the nightmare that now confronts us: Americans fleeing Saigon, leaving behind most of those whom we enlisted in our war against Communism. It is a final horror in the series of horrors that has marked the American intervention in Indochina.

title: Contract Awards
description: Kentron Hawaii Ltd., received a $34million At contract for technical support, of the Kwajalwin Missile range in the Pacific.

title: C.A.B. Rejects Discounts For Youths and Families
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board rejected yesterday a restoration of domestic youth fares, and also turned down discounts for the elderly and for family travel.

title: FORD AIDE SPLITS ON LAND USE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, April 23 (UPI)Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, said today that he disagreed with President Ford's decision to oppose passage of Federal landuse planning legislation.

title: Personal Finance: Many Grants Offset College Costs
description: The rising cost of attending college is hardly a secret.

title: Prosecutors' Use of Informers Stirs a Legal Debate
description: WASHINGTON, April 23Despite recurring complaints by civil libertarians and others, including judges, the nation's courts have imposed few reistrictions on the use of informers and other undercover agents by governments.

title: Goal Put at 8,000 a Day
description: WASHINGTON, April 24As fears rose here that time was running out on plans for an orderly evacuation of Americans and Vietnamese from Saigon, the director of President Ford's Refugee Task Force said today that he was trying to accelerate the outflow.

title: Special Delivery
description: Amid applause from President Ford and many top leaders of labor and management, the United States Postal Service put into circulation last month a new stamp in honor of collective bargaining. Now the service and four unions representing its 600,000 employes are engaged in a test of their joint capacity to bargain out a contract geared to meeting the public's need for efficient mail delivery and not solely to satisfying union demands for more money.

title: HOLLANDER DENIES ABUSES IN HOMES
description: Eugene Hollander yesterday denied allegations of abuses in his nursing homes and said he would fight state moves to lift his licenses. He predicted that the courts would uphold him.

title: Byrne Says Crabiel Will Be Restricted To Ceremonial Duty
description: TRENTON, April 24Governor Byrne said today that Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel would he confined to the constitutional  and largely ceremonialduties of his office and would not reassume the sensitive and influential position he held before he was indicted last year on charges of highway bidrigging.

title: Election Official Named
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 (AP) Orlando B. Potter, consultant to the secretary of the Senate, was named today as staff director for the new Federal Election Commission. The commission will administer new reform regulations under Federal election laws for all Presidential and Congressional elections.

title: Ziegfeld Girls Recalling the Glitter of an Era
description: Their memories are of diamonds, sable coats and sugar daddies, of RollsRoyces parked outside the stage door, and of a kind of glittery glamour that the world may never see again.

title: Vincent A. Massi, 69, Is Dead; Acting Supreme Court Justice
description: Acting Supreme Court Justice Vincent A. Massi collapsed yesterday afternoon on a downtown intersection near State Supreme Court, apparently of a heart attack, and was declared dead at BeekmanDowntown Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 2145 Haight Avenue in the Bronx.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Grain and soybean prices tended to drift aimlessly yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade prior to the release of the stocks on hand report by the Department of Agriculture after the close of trading.

title: Aussies' Harry Hopman Has L.I. in Center Court
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., April 24When the nonplaying captain, Harry Hopman, was winning the Davis Cup for Australia 15 times in 21 years some critics insisted his exacting methods would never work in that other former colony.

title: Dow Jones Sues McGrawHill on Article
description: Dow Jones & Co. and Alan Abelson, managing editor and a columnist of Barron's a Dow Jones business and financial weekly publication, filed a civil suit yesterday against McGrawHill, Inc., two of its editors and a businessman who was quoted in an article in this week's issue of Business Week magazine, a McGrawHill publication.

title: Aussies' Harry Hopman Has L.I. in Center Court
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., April 24When the nonplaying captain, Harry Hopman, was winning the Davis Cup for Australia 15 times In 21 years some critics insisted his exacting methods would never work in that other former colony.

title: BRITAIN PLANNING LEYLAND RESCUE
description: LONDON, April 24  The Government announced plans today to take control of the British Leyland Motor Corporation, one of the nation's largest industrial enterprises, and to provide it with billions of dollars in financial assistance.

title: New York Telephone Net Fell 23.4% in the Quarter
description: The New York Telephone Company, a member of the Bell System, reported yesterday decline of 23.4 per cent in firstquarter net income to $72.[09]million, or 38 cents a share, from $94.7million, or 50 cents a share, for the corresponding three months last year.

title: Memorial Services
description: COREYMerion L. A memorial servire will be held at the Scarsdale Congregational ?? Scarsdale, N.Y., Sunday Apr. 27 at 3 P.M.

title: Truce Promise Refused
description: PARIS, April 24Vietcong representatives here, talking today with a delegation of nonCommunist Vietnamese, refused to promise a ceasefire even if Saigon set up an acceptable administration and began negotiations.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up 7%
description: WASHINGTON, April 24The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.04billion up 5 per cent from the yearearlier $99[09]million. Total retail store sales were about $10.88billion, up 7 per cent from last year's $10.1[09]billion.

title: 8% Advance Is Reported
description: The Standard Oil Company of California reported yesterday an earnings gain of 8 per cent in the first quarter of 1975 but the Shell Oil Company, the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), the Getty Oil Company and the Sun Oil Company all announced declines.

title: Regulating Medicaid
description: Efforts to regulate Medicare and Medicaid have hatched an epidemic of litigation that seems to be heading toward the United States Supreme Court.

title: 10 ACCUSED IN FIRE THAT RAZED PLANT IN SHELTON, CONN.
description: Arson and conspiracy charges in the firebombing that destroyed a $10million spongerubberproducts plant in Shelton, Conn., last month were lodged yesterday against the plant's owner, his allegedly clairvoyant spiritual adviser and eight other men.

title: FORD STILL SEEKS MORE SAIGON AID
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 Despite President Ford's declaration last night that America's involvement in the Indochina war was finished, his spokesman said today that the President still wanted Congress to approve more military aid for South Vietnam.

title: In Memoriam
description: STRAUSSLeo. The Board of Directors of AeroFlow Dynamics, ?? ?? with ?? regret the Passing of Its fellow Director and forrner President of the Corporation on April 22, 1975. His loss will be deeply felt by his many friends throughout the Corporation.

title: Profit Drop Worst Since World War II
description: Corporate profits in the first quarter suffered their steepest drop in any recession period since World War II, the First National City Bank reported yesterday in its quarterly survey of almost 1.000 companies.

title: Inquiry on Cereal Costs
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 (UPI)  President Ford's antiinflation panel asked six major cereal companies yesterday to submit data explaining why retail prices of their products were going up while ingredient costs were falling. The inquiry was directed to Nabisco, Inc., the General Foods Corporation, Ralston Purina, General Mills, Quaker Oats and the Kellogg Company.

title: 1,000 Apply for 90 Tutoring Jobs at Bronx College
description: Well over 1,000 job applicants, many of them with advanced degrees, descended on Bronx Community College over the last two days to apply for 90 jobs as tutors, paying $7,800 a year.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Profits Scoreboard

title: TV: Music, From Shock Rock to the Tops in Ops
description: Television's music entertainments this weekend range from shock rock to the tops in ops. The cleverly packaged shock can be sampled tonight at 11:30 on Alice CooperThe Nightmare, a selfpromotion extravaganza acquired by ABC's Wide World: In Concert series. The ops are part of Danny Kaye's LookIn at the Metropolitan Opera, being presented this Sunday afternoon at 5 as part of The CBS Festival of Lively Arts for Young People.

title: MEDICAIDTEST PLAN IS DRAFTED BY CITY
description: The city's Human Resources Administration said yesterday that it had erred in a statement last week that lawyers for the State Departments of Health and Social Services had drawn up specifications for impending city contracts aimed at centralizing Medicaid laboratory tests in each borough.

title: Houston Says Its Port Leads in Foreign Cargo
description: HOUSTON, April 24The Port of Houston is feuding with the Port of New Orleans over which port is No. 2. Houston contends that its total foreign cargo last year was a million tons more than that of New Orleans.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article in The New York Times last Friday, the Human Resources Administration stated incorrectly that specifications for new city Medicaid laboratory contracts had been drawn up by state lawyers. A corrective article appears today on Page 33.

title: STUDENT, 22, SLAIN; SUITOR ARRESTED
description: A 22yearold woman student at Kingsborough Community College in the Manhattan Beach section of Brooklyn was shot to death on the campus yesterday allegedly by a male student described by the police as jilted suitor.

title: Tourists Warned in an 1876 Guidebook to New York
description: New York in 1876, you may be comforted to know, was a dangerous place at night and wise citizens stayed off the streets after darkness closed in.

title: VIETCONG INDICATE THEY WANT MINH AS SAIGON LEADER
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, April 25  The Vietcong strongly implied last night that only Gen. Duong Van Minh, a proponent of peace, neutrality and cooperation with the Communists, was acceptable to them at the head of the Saigon Government.

title: FARM TRUCK SALES HAILED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 (UPI)  Farmers from nine states brought truckloads of beef, cheese and potatoes to the Washington metropolitan area for a direct sale to consumers today and reported that they sold about 300,000 pounds of food.

title: Pacers Triumph And Lead Series
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 24 (UPI)  George McGinnis rallied Indiana with 33 points and 21 rebounds tonight and the pacers beat the Denver Nuggets, 118112, to take a 21 lead in the American Basketball Association Western Division playoff. The fourth game will be played here tomorrow night.

title: Goal Put at 8,000 a Day
