title: Price Rise Indicated
description: Despite a sharp decline in shipments, particularly to its automotive, construction and appliance customers, the United States Steal Corporation raised its earnings 103.5 per cent in the first three months this year, the company reported yesterday.

title: New Trident Base Backed Over Needs Of the Environment
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP) National security needs put military construction beyond environmental considerations, a lawyer supporting a new submarine base argued today.

title: Gotbaum Backs Slate Favoring Fuentes in District 1 Election
description: Victor Gotbaum, executive director of District Council 37 of the State, County and Municipal Employes Union, yesterday endorsed and promised to work for the election of 10 candidates for the District 1 school board representing a group of parents and community organizations called Por Los Nios.

title: BROKER'S EMPLOYES INDICTED ON CHECKS
description: A police officer and two former employes of the brokerage firm of Goldman, Sachs & Co. were arrested yesterday on indictments charging them with conspiracy to defraud the company of $75,000 by issuing and cashing fraudulent checks.

title: WINE TALK
description: AY, FranceInflation, overproduction and a drop in world wide demand, the same problems that currently afflict the rest of the wine regions of France, also affect the farmers and the winemakers of Champagne.

title: PARLEY TO DISCUSS DOCTOR DISCIPLINE
description: Leaders of the Medical Society of the County of New York and state officials are scheduled to meet tomorrow to assess a serious difference that has arisen over charges by the medical society that the Board of Regents has been lax in investigating and disciplining doctors.

title: Budd Votes Dividend Cut
description: Directors of the Budd Company yesterday voted to cut out the quarterly dividend to 15 cents from 20 cents paid in previous quarters. It is payable June 1 to record May 14. The company said the action resulted from a $3.1million loss incurred in the first quarter as reported last week.

title: McGovern Opposes Airlift
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, April 29 (UPI)Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, said today that he was opposed to large numbers of Vietnamese refugees being brought to the United States, including the orphans and babies because they would be better off in Vietnam. I was opposed to this airlift, he said. The Vietnamese have a strong tradition of taking care of their children.

title: Commonwealth Parley Urging Economic Equity
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, April 29Leaders of 33 British Commonwealth nations opened a conference here today with appeals for a new world economic order.

title: $1Million Suit Filed in Death of Inmate
description: TRENTON, April 29  The American Civil Liberties Union of New Jersey has filed a $1million damage suit against state officials in behalf of the survivors of Daniel Hogan, an inmate at the state prison here who was scalded to death in his solitaryconfinement cell on Dec. 21, 1973.

title: About New York
description: The noon sun streamed through the tall windows of Bobby Short's apartment looking south on 57th Street and bounced off the ebony top of his new Bechstein.

title: Books of The Times
description: In an interview with the critic Hugh Kenner recently published in The New York Times Magazine, Alex Comfort said: Come Out to Play started to be simply a comic novel. I think now it was the manifesto of which The Joy of Sex commences the implementation. Though Come Out to Play was published in England in 1961, it has had to wait until 1975 to be issued here. The author suggests that American publishers shied away from it because it contains too many political jabs, beginning with a jab at a Catholic President. I would suggest that they ignored it because it was already dated in 1961 and not very funny anyway. Now, of course, everything is changed. With The Joy of Sex on several million bedside tables, we may even see the republication of Dr. Comfort's early books of poems in a neoGeorgian idiom.

title: STOCKS DECLINE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped yesterday in dull trading.

title: Evacuation From Saigon Tumultuous at the End
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 30With American fighter planes flying cover and marines standing guard on the ground, Americans left Saigon yesterday by helicopter after fighting off throngs of Vietnamese civilians who tried to go along.

title: West Berlin Police Hold 4 In Political Chief's Abduction
description: BERLIN, April 29A West Berlin police spokesman today announced the arrest of four men as suspects in the kidnapping of Peter Lorenz, the Berlin Christian Democratic leader.

title: Conferees Adopt StripMine Bill That Both Sides Term Weak
description: WASHINGTON, April 29A conference committee cleared tonight for final approval by the Senate and House a Federal stripmine control bill that both environmentalists and spokesmen for the coal industry called significantly weaker than a similar measure vetoed by President Ford late last year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mexico to Extend Subway
description: MEXICO CITY (AP)Mexico City plans to more than double its subway system, extending to its northern suburbs, said Angel Borja, whose firm is overseeing the expansion from 26 miles to 62 miles. The sixyearold system now carries 1.8 million people daily.

title: Cozy Basics For Wearing In the Autumn
description: Wrap yourself up in a shawl or serape (alternate choice: stole; cape or poncho) or slip into a quilted, padded Chineseinspired jacketand you have a pretty good idea of what fashion designers consider significant for fall.

title: Parents Vigilant in Union City
description: UNION CITY, April 29Afraid? My wife is afraid all the time, said Jose Colon, a packer on the night shift at the Crown Cork and Seal Comapny, as he escorted three of his own children and a neighbor's child to the Edison school here a little before 8:30 this morning.

title: MRS. GRASSO SEEKS REMEDY FOR DEFICIT
description: HARTFORD, April 29 (UPI)Connecticut's Governor Ella T. Grasso said today she was still grappling with a $40million budget deficit expected by mid1976 and hal not decided whether to make it up by raising taxes or laying off state workers.

title: Yankee Records
description: BATTING

title: Ivan, the Formidable Bolshoi Ballet
description: Yuri Grigorovich's latest spectacular, almost operatic ballet, Ivan the Terrible, was given its Western premiere by the Bolshoi Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House last night. It is a huge and ambitious work  obviously envisaged as a successor to Mr. Grigorovich's Spartacus (which preceded it by seven years) and conceived in the same massive, epic style. Ancient Rome, however, has been replaced by 16thcentury Russia.

title: Amstar Cuts Prices On Wholesale Sugar
description: The Amstar Corporation, the nation's largest sugar refiner and marketer, announced yesterday a reduction of $2.25 hundred weight on its wholesale grocery prices, effective tomorrow.

title: Stage: Parto, an Angry Play About Woman's Fate
description: In 1971 three Portuguese women, all of them writers and mothers named Maria, outraged by the plight of womankind, banded in sisterhood and began writing, collectively, about their predicament. As cornerstone for their protest, they took Mariana Alcoforado, a 17thcentury Portuguese woman who was placed in a convent, was seduced and abandoned by a French cavalier, and wrote five famous letters to him, letters that ascended from blind idolatry to vengeance.

title: Canada Asks China to Remove An Aide From Ottawa Embassy
description: OTTAWA, April 29The Canadian Government has ordered the withdrawal of a member of the Chinese Embassy in Ottawa.

title: Abram Offers Bills To Curtail Abuses Of Nursing Homes
description: ALBANY April 29Morris B. Abram proposed today a series of changes in the laws governing nursing homes to deal with the most serious immediate problems uncovered during his monthlong investigation.

title: 2d Key. Met Museum Aide Quits In Dispute Over Hoving Methods
description: With an attack on Thomas P. E. Hoving's administration at the Metropolitan Museum of Art alleging its inability to function in any way that creates or preserves trust, confidence and decency, Anthony M. Clark; chairman of the museum's department of European paintings, has resigned.

title: HOUSE G.O.P. VOTES TO OPEN SESSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The House Republican Conference voted today to open its meetings to the press and public for the first time in almost half a century.

title: HEAVY USERS FACE CON ED INCREASE
description: The state's Public Service Commission ordered the Consolidated Edison Company yesterday to raise its rates for those customers who accounted for the heaviest summer power demands and to cut the rates for customers whose usage did not create excess power demand.

title: Selling by Phone Is Big Business
description: The biggest advertising medium in the United Statesbigger even than newspapersis the telephone, according to Murray Roman, who happens to be in telephone marketing. How he comes by his statistics is a mystery, but they no something like this:

title: Flyers, With a Reserve Goalie, Subdue Islanders in Opener, 40
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 29  The team that had been dubbed Chico and the Men behind the goaltending of Glenn Resch against Pittsburgh looked like Chico and the boys tonight against Philadelphia as the New York Islanders were manhandled by the Flyers and lost, 40.

title: Rock Island Assumes Debt Incurred Before TakeOver
description: CHICAGO, April 29 (UPI) William M. Gibbons, the courtappointed trustee for the bankrupt Chicago Rock Island & Pacific Railroad, said today he had taken over $308million ir equipment debt the line incurred before it filed for reorganization March 17.

title: HARRY J. LARKIN
description: MONTREAL, April 29 (AP)Harry J. Larkin, general manager of The Montreal Gazette, died today. He was 68 years old.

title: Mexicans Bar Hewitt and McMillan
description: MEXICO CITY, April 29 (UPI)The Mexican Government refused today to permit Frew McMillan and Bob Hewitt, South Africans, to play in the $100,000 World Championship Tennis doubles tournament, which starts tomorrow.

title: Kodak Demonstrates a Copier That Uses Plain Pager
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., April 29The Eastern Kodak Company today demonstrates new plainpaper copierduplicator and disclosed progress in its plan to enter the instantphotography field.

title: Milstein to Fill Vacancy On United Brands Board
description: Seymour Milstein, a Manhattan real estate developer, was elected Monday to the board of directors of the United Brands Company, the concern that has admitted paying $2million in bribes to Honduran and European officials.

title: Market Place
description: Shares of the A. E. Staley Manufacturing Company have soared as record sugar prices have led softdrink bottlers and other major users to substitute corn sweeteners for cane and beet sugars.

title: Merrill Lynch to Raise Individual Fees By 3% as Fixed Brokerage Rates End
description: Responding to a Government directive that, beginning tomorrow, stockbrokers eliminate fixed commission fees on stock transactions, Merrill Lynch; Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the nation's largest brokerage house, said yesterday it would raise commission rates by an average of 3 per cent for most individuals.

title: People and Business
description: The presidentelect of the American Bankers Association, J. Rex Duwe, has come to the bleak conclusion that the average American family can no longer comfortably afford the average American house even if, as he observed, they could get an interestfree mortgage loan.

title: Backlog Is Shrinking
description: WILMINGTON, Del., April 29 The Bethlehem Steel Corporation's earnings in the first quarter were almost double those of the first three months of 1974, according to figures released at the annual meeting here today by Lewis W. Foy, chairman of the company.

title: Glover and Eagles Reach Agreement
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 29 (UPI)  The Philadelphia Eagles announced today a contract agreement with Rich Glover, a former AllAmerica defensive lineman who was the New York Giants' thirdround draft choice in 1973.

title: The Mood Is Indigo and Nostalgia As Pews Fill to Honor the Duke
description: For 24 hours yesterday from midnight to midnight the music of Duke Ellington filled the main sancturay of the Central Church at Park Avenue at 64th Street as a seemingly endless flow of jazz musicians celebrated what would have bee nthe Duke's 76th birthday.

title: Film: 'Bobby and Rose':Le Mat and Dianne Hull Run Afoul of Life
description: "Aloha, Bobby and Rose," which opened yesterday at the Columbia 2 Theater, is a sentimental, noisy, very bad movie about a young Los Angeles couple whom Floyd Mutrux, the director and writer of the screen play, describes as star-crossed though they seem less star-crossed than accident-prone.Bobby (Paul Le Mat) and Rose (Dianne Hull) get into trouble when a clerk is fatally shot while Bobby is pretending to stick up a liquor store. The only tragic thing in a film like this is the quality of stupidity the characters are forced to exhibit in order to keep the plot going.Although the story is contemporary, the film opens with Artie Shaw's classic "Begin the Beguine" playing on the soundtrack. Thereafter, the director does his best to stir up a little nostalgia for what actually is last week. "Aloha, Bobby and Rose" wants to have it eight different ways at once.The film is full of what seem to be witting references to that harmless nineteen-sixties binge, "American Graffiti," which also starred Mr. Le Mat. Much of "Aloha, Bobby and Rose" was photographed in and around Los Angeles, in its streets, driveins and filling stations, a lot of the time at night.William A. Fraker, a very good cameraman with the right director, over-indulges a fancy for shooting directly into headlights, sunrises and sunsets, resulting in more halos than you would ever see at a convention of saints.In claptrap of this order it's impossible to judge fairly lead performances that are so much a part of the method of the film. In subsidiary roles Tim McIntire and Leigh French are appealing as a pair of good-natured, free-spending Texans who, briefly, befriend dim-witted Bobby and dopey Rose.

title: Some U.S. Correspondents Stay In Vietnam Despite Evacuation
description: A number of American correspondents elected yesterday to pass up seats on the United States evacuation shuttle and stay in Saigon, but a check of news organizations showed that most had ordered their American personnel to leave Vietnam.

title: RETURNING TO HER ANGELS: Kathleen Flynn, her arm in cast from wound inflicted by gunman at St. James School in Penns Grove last February, greeting Sherry
Arkansas Post Ready
description: FORT CHAFFEE, Ark., April 29Dozens of wooden barracks and mess halls at this Army base were prepared today for Vietnam refugees, but there was no word when the first group might be flown in.

title: Cosmos in Opener; Pele Spurns Offer
description: The New York Cosmos, without Pel or Georgie Best, open their North American Soccer League season at Randalls Island Stadium tonight against the Miami Toros, who have already played two games, winning both by shutouts.

title: 2 IN WESTCHESTER OUSTED BY COUNTY
description: WHITE PLAINS, April 29The top welfare officials in Mount Vernon and Yonkers were replaced today as Westchester County began a major reorganization of its Social Services Department amid charges of fraud and mismanagement.

title: REUSS AND BURNS SET COMPROMISE
description: WASHINGTON, April 29  A key member of Congress backed away today from earlier Democratic proposals for mandatory Government allocation of credit in the economy in return for reluctant agreement by the Federal Reserve Board to a new system of reporting by banks on where their loans go.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Duong van Minh announced the unconditional surrender of the Saigon Government to the Vietcong. Addressing himself to its Provisional Revolutionary Government in a radio broadcast, he said, We are here to hand over to you the power in order to avoid bloodshed. He ordered the Saigon army to stop firing and remain in place. The speech came several hours after the completion of the American evacuation, with only some newsmen and missionaries remaining. [Page 1, Columns 18.]

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GROWING UP This year's main theme at the Gramercy Park Flower and Horticulture Show, today and tomorrow, is ballet, with over 100 competitive arrangements of cut specimens suggesting such works as Fancy Free, Jewels, Swan Lake and Theme and Variations, and a division for junior entrants with such labels as Rodeo and Sleeping Beauty. The show also has seven divisions for city  grown plants, among them an avocadopit growing contest and a new group, common to exotic, called Anything Grows.

title: Looking at U.S. Role in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, April 29For many Americans it may have been a day of simple emotions  relief, perhaps, that the long war in Vietnam was near an end, or bitterness that the United States and its ally had in the end lost.

title: 123 LAND AT CLARK WITHOUT CLEARANCE
description: CLARK AIR BASE, Philippines, April 29Some 123 South Vietnamese men, women and children, including soldiers still in uniform, arrived today at this base in a plane that landed without clearance from the Philippine authorities.

title: SENATE UNIT TOLD OF SALE OF BABIES
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (UPI)A California lawyer said today that black market baby trade had, grown rapidly in states that do not allow healthy competition between independent placements and private adoption agencies.

title: Pacific Gas Is Refunding $41.8Million to Customers
description: The Pacific Gas and Electric Company, one of the nation's largest electric utilities said yesterday that it was refunding $41.8million to its customers as a result of a reduction in the rate increase one of its major natural gas suppliers was allowed by the Federal Power Commission.

title: NEW MARINE CHIEF REPORTEDLY CHOSEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP)Lieut. Gen. Louis H. Wilson, a World War II Medal of Honor winner, is reported to be in line to become the new commandant of the Marine Corps.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: Islanders vs. Philadelphia April 29Phila. 4, Islanders 0.

title: HEALTH AID FOR IDLE VOTED BY HOUSE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP)  Health insurance for the unemployed was approved today by the Commerce Committee in an attempt to kill another version of the measure on the House floor.

title: Namath Meeting Asked by W.F.L.
description: MEMPHIS, April 29 (AP)Chris Hemmeter, president of the World Football League, said today he had asked for a meeeting with Joe Namath to discuss the W.F.L.'s offer of a $4million contract to the New York Jets quarterback.

title: MAX GLUCKMAN DIES; ANTHROPOLOGIST, 64
description: Dr. Max Gluckman, a prominent legal anthropologist, died April 14, apparently of a heart ailment, in Jerusalem. He was 64 years old and lived in Cheshire, England.

title: Panel Blocks Bid to Exempt Texas From '65 Vote Law
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP) The House Judiciary Committee overwhelmingly rejected today a proposal that would have exempted Texas from coverage by the Voting Rights Act.

title: Prosecutor Says He Got No Facts on Attica Defense Strategy
description: BUFFALO, April 29  The chief Attica prosecutor testified today that his office had received no information from anyone regarding the strategy of the Attica legal defense team.

title: About Education
description: The New York State Board of Regents has its own domino theory to worry about. If Governor Carey and the medical profession succeed in transferring the Regents' power to discipline physicians to the State Health Department, Regents' reasoning goes, then the board's power to control the 21 other professions, not to mention their control over many other aspects of education, training, licensing and discipline in the state, will also be vulnerable to annexation by expanding executive agencies.

title: Tourist Business Is Off
description: SAN JUAN, P.R. (UPI)Puerto Rico's luxury hotels reported their worst March lever, with occupancy rates in some cases as low as 35 per cent. March traditionally is winter season months for tourism in Puerto Rico.

title: MARKET DECLINES AS TRADING SLOWS
Upstate Killer Is Acquitted After He Is Found Insane
description: ALBANY, April 29 (AP)A 42yearold man accused of killing a mail carrier and wounding two police officials in nearby Cohoes last Dec. 31 has been acquitted by reason of insanity.

title: Music: LaSalle Quartet
description: To an astonishing extent, as we look back, the seeds of 20thcentury thought and art seem to have been sown in one place and at one time: Vienna in the decade immediately preceding World War I. Merely to list some of the seminal names active in that time and at that place suggests the excitement being generated: Freud, Mahler, Wittgenstein, Reinhardt, Kokoschka  and, of course, Schoenberg, Webern and Berg.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Notes on People
description: David R. Scott, the Apollo 15 lunarlanding commander who was dropped from the astronaut corps in a controversy over unauthorized moon souvenirs, has been named director of NASA's flight research center at Edwards, Calif. Mr. Scott, 42 years old, had been deputy director since 1973. He retired from the Air Force as colonel in March to take the civilian appointment, suc ceeding Lee R. Scherer, who left to become director of the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

title: Confusion Mars Arrival of American and Vietnamese Refugees in California
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., April 29Hundreds of Americans and their Vietnamese dependents settled into temporary quarters in a remote corner of this 125,000acre Marine Corps base todayhot dusty, bonetired and angry that the Government was preventing them from making the final leg of their long journey home.

title: Four Killed in Explosions In Greek Munitions Plant
description: ATHENS, April 29 (UPI)Explosions ripped through a munitions factory at Lavrion, 40 miles south of Athens, early today, killing at least four persons and injuring 60.

title: END OF DEFENSE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 30President Duong Van Minh announced today the unconditional surrender of the Saigon Government and its military forces to the Vietcong.

title: Brandeis Students Take Over Building
description: WALTHAM, Mass., April 29Students at Brandeis University took over a campus building this morning in protest against pending budget cuts.

title: The Way They Stand Today
description: Wednesday, April 30, 1975

title: SILVER FUTURES SCORE ADVANCES
description: Silver futures prices on the Commodity Exchange here showed a strong rise early yesterday, partly because of higher gold prices. The July contract touched a recent chart point high of $4.50 and then declined. Part of the drop came with selling following Treasury Secretary William E. Simon's comment during testimony before a Senate commit tee that the Treasury might sell more gold. The last Treasury gold sale was in January.

title: STEIN FILES A SUIT ON NURSING HOMES
description: Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein filed suit yesterday to halt Medicaid payments to scores of New York nursing homes that have been found in violation of safety and health codes.

title: MALPRACTICE BILLS SIGNED IN MARYLAND
description: ANNAPOLIS, April 29 (AP)Gov. Marvin Mandel signed today three bills designed to avert a possible health care crisis in Maryland by protecting physicians against malpractice suits.

title: Ky and Mrs. Martin Fly To a Ship Off Vietnam
description: ABOARD U.S.S. BLUE RIDGE, April 29 (Reuters)Nguyen Cao Ky, former South Vietnamese Premier, and Mrs. Graham A. Martin, wife of the United States Anilbassador to South Vietnam, were among the first group of evacuees ferried from Saigon by helicopters to an American naval armada off the Vietnam coast, a Navy spokesman said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, APRIL 30, 1975

title: BYRNE STUMPING FOR LIBERTY PARK
description: NEWARK, April 28In an apparent effort to muster business community support for his administration's ambitious Liberty State Park plan for the Jersey City waterfront, Governor Byrne and two of his cabinet officers staged a slide show and progress report for corporate executives in the Prudential Insurance Company today.

title: Article 4  No Title
Soglow Memorial Today
description: A memorial service for Otto Soglow, the King Features Syndicate cartoonist who created The Little King, will be held by members of the National Cartoonists Society today at 5 P.M. at the Society of Illustrators clubhouse, 128 East 63d Street. Mr. Soglow died at the age of 74 on April 3.

title: Proxmire Backs Disclosure Act to Protect Federal Employes
description: WASHINGTON, April 29Seven persons, including Senator William Proxmire, testified today on behalf of proposed legislation that would make it easier for the public and the press to get information from Federal employes.

title: Phillips Petroleum Backs Reelection of Directors
description: BARTLESVILLE, Okla., April 29 (AP)Stockholders of the Phillips Petroleum Company overwhelmingly turned down efforts today at the company's annual meeting to defeat the board of directors for reelection. At least 90 per cent of the votes favored the directors.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 2 More Dead Found in Snow
description: STEVENSON, Wash., April N (UPI) The bodies of two college students who died in weekend avalanche on Mount St. Helens were found today. The bodies of three others were found yesterday. The bodies recovered today were believed those of Erick Spurrell of Denver and Phil Burdick of Eatonville, Wash. The other dead were Karen Moniot and Nina C. Engbertson of Tacoma and Dick Pfeffer of Federal Way Wash.

title: Charges Due in Inquiry on Sports Betting
description: Indictments against 20 gamblers allegedly involved in an illegal sportsbetting network with a yearly turnover of $100!million are expected to be announced today by the office of the Manhattan District Attorney, Robert M. Morgenthau.

title: Watergate Ordeal Called Moral Education for U.S.
description: Whatever else it may have been, the ordeal of Watergate was, in the eyes of Lawrence Kohlberg, an exercise in moral education for the American people.

title: NIXON RALLY TRIAL DROPS 2 FROM SUIT
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., April 29The director of the Secret Service, H. Stuart Knight, and a local police officer were dropped today from a $1.08million civil damage suit by order of the judge hearing the case. The action was by mutuall agreement of both sides.

title: White House Considered The Surrender Inevitable
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 A White House spokesman said tonight that President Ford had no comment on the surrender of the South Vietnamese Government to the Vietcong, but officials said that they had viewed the developments as inevitable.

title: Nun Pleads Not Guilty
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, Ill., April 29 (AP)Sister Annalinda Hellman, a nun and a former member of the East St. Louis School District 189 Board of Education, and William Little, a district employe, pleaded not guilty today to Federal extortion and conspiracy charges. Both are charged with conspiracy to extort more than $2,000 from St. Louis school supply company that had contracts with the district.

title: American Families: Worried But Resolute
description: Are there still chickens in every pot and cars in American garages? On the whole, yes, but there are some disquieting attitudes in the mind of the public.

title: 74 Saigon Planes Fly 2,000 to Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 29At least 74 South Vietnamese Air Force planes fleeing the country streamed into U Taphao air base in southern Thailand without warning this afternoon.

title: Excerpts From News Briefing by Kissinger
description: MR. KISSINGER: Over the past two weeks, the American personnel in Vietnam has been progressively reduced. Our objective was to reduce at a rate that was significant enough so that we would finally be able to evacuate rapidly; but this would not produce a panic which might prevent anybody from getting out.

title: Lonborg 3Hitter Sets Back Expos
description: Jim Lonborg, who once toiled brilliantly in Boston until a ski accident almost ended his career, seems to have recaptured his former talents.

title: Food Here Rises 1 Per Cent As 3Week Price Slide Ends
description: A 62cent rise, for a 1 per cent increase, was reported yesterday in the cost of the city's 38item market basket for a family of four during This almost swallowed up declines for the preceding the week ended last Friday. three weeks that had amountd to 72 cents.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Long Island

title: Concert: Chicago/Solti
description: If the Chicago Symphony Orchestra and its music director, Sir Georg Solti, have a faultnotice, please, how cautious one must beit may be that the listener tends too much of the time being aware of how superbly they are performing, to the point of overlooking the content of the music at hand. Still, it is one's happy duty to report the return of Chicago/Solti to Carnegie Hall last night to open the orchestra's annual series, and to note that the two works on the program have not recently received such consummate performance hereabouts.

title: Round Stake, $2.60, Wins Derby Trial Mile by Head
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 29 Round Stake of the Hobau Farm won the onemile Derby Trial today as expected. However, the victory was not a particularly easy one for the son of JeanPierre, and was not calculated to throw a scare into any of the topflight candidates for the Kentucky Derby on Saturday.

title: PARK SAYS SEOUL CAN REPEL ATTACK
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 29President Park Chung Hee asserted today that South Korea's armed forces were prepared to repel aggression from North Korea.

title: Clemency Is Denied To 50 Participants In Rutgers Protest
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, April 29 Rutgers University has refused to waive possible penalties for the 50 students who stormed the Livingston College cafeteria last Thursday to protest a university rule requiring students to purchase a meal contract to get first priority for a dormitory room.

title: MRS. GEORGE CATHCART
description: Mrs. George M. Cathcart, the former Helen Drude, president and superintendent of the Lutheran Cemetery, Middle Village, Queens, died at home yesterday. She was 63 years old and lived in Middle Village.

title: Commission Structure Changed for Avon Lady
description: Avon Products, Inc., yesterday announced price cuts on one line of its wares and changes in its traditional commission structure for its doortodoor salespeople.

title: Briton Led a Full Life
description: WISBECH, England (AP)James Chapman was a happy man when he died recently at age 103, according to his housekeeper. At age 100, he decided to put some excitement in his life and spent his last three years riding gliders, helicopters, balloons, training planes and racing cars. His last ride was in a submarine.

title: Mrs. Ky Flies to Coast. From Guam With Party of
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 29 The wife of former Premier Nguyen. Cao Ky of South Vietnam arrived here late last night with about 15 relatives and friends aboard a refugee flight from Guam to Travis Air Force Base north of here.

title: Domestic Tranquility
description: President Ford picked an appropriately significant topic when he chose to talk about crime at the sesquicentennial celebration of the Yale Law School. The corrosive impact of violent crime is almost tangible in most of this country's major cities and its effects reach far beyond the immediate circle of fear it creates. Unfortunately, howeverthough Mr. Ford deliberately changed the anticrime rhetoric from law and order to domestic tranquilitythe basic line sounded almost as unsophisticated as the NixonMitchell campaign theme of 1968.

title: GEORGE LOWTHER, TV WRITER, DEAD
description: George F. Lowther, a radio and televsion writer, director and producer, died Monday at his home in Westport, Conn. He was 62 years old and lived at 15 Hitchcok Road.

title: Senate Defeats Bid by Buckley To Cut Spending by $25Billion
description: WASHINGTON, April 29The Senate decisively defeated today a move by conservatives to. cut $25billion from next year's Federal spending and increase certain taxes, thereby reducing the deficit to $34.7billion.

title: U.S., GREECE AGREE TO END HOME PORT FOR THE 6TH FLEET
description: ATHENS, April 29United States and Greek officials announced today the termination of the homeport arrangement for Sixth Fleet ships at the port of Eleusis near Athens and the closing of the American air base at Athens airport.

title: Boom and Bust Again?
description: If the slump is almost over, can another slump be far behind? Or is this too grim a forecast? Many American businessmen have been worried about just such a cycle. And Alan Greenspan, for one, chairman of President Ford's Council of Economic Advisers, told them this week that they were worrying about the right thing.

title: Article 1  No Title
Fiscal Summitry At Hand as Beame Arrives in Albany
description: ALBANY, April 29Expressing some concern that things are different this year, Mayor Beame set the stage today for a fiscal summit confrontation with the state.

title: CBS Will Drop Gunsmoke and Introduce Nine Series for the Fall
description: An American version of Upstairs, Downstairs, the British series, will appear on CBSTV this fall, but Gunsmoke, network mainstay for 20 years, ?? ?? the dust.

title: Boston School Chief Out; Heeded Integration Order
description: BOSTON, April 29 (AP)William Leary, who oversaw Boston schools during the first year of sometimes violent courtordered integration, was ousted as superintendent today by the Boston School Committee.

description: Film

title: CONGRESS PLANS AID FOR REFUGED
description: WASHINGTON, April 29Members of Congress began today to make plans for new legislation to pay for the evacuation of Saigon and the relocation of Vietnamese refugees in the United States.

title: Portugal Ready to Resume Talks With U.S. on Azores
description: LISBON, April 29  Portuguese officials, apparently worried about a possible breakaway of the Azores, have in, formed the United States that they are ready to resume negotiations on the Americanheld air base there.

title: Ullman to Speak to Writers
description: Representative Al Ullman, Democrat of Oregon, who is chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, will be the guest speaker at the annual spring dinner of the New York Financial Writers Association on June 4. Tickets for the dinner, to be held at the Americana Hotel, are available from the association, P.O. Box 4306, New York, N. Y. 10017.

title: Advertising

title: Abram Offers Bills To Curtail Abuses Of Nursing Homes
description: ALBANY, April 29Morris B. Abram proposed today a series of changes in the laws governing nursing homes to deal with the most serious immediate problems uncovered during his monthlong investigation.

title: Indians Set Back Yanks, 31
description: The Cleveland Indians, most notably Don Hood and Frank Duffy, won the battle of the pregame diets last night, defeating the Yankees and Larry Gura, 31, at Shea Stadium.

title: Massachusetts Bill For a Death Penalty Vetoed by Governor
description: BOSTON, April 29 (AP)Gov. Michael S. Dukakis vetoed today legislation that would have restored capital punishment in Massachusetts.

title: Four Dead as Johannesburg Siege Ends
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, April 29 (UPI)Four persons were dead and 32 wounded today when firing ended at the Israeli Consulate with the surrender of a South African Jew who had held it for 16 hours, the police reported.

title: This School Cafeteria Menu Gets 3 Stars From Students
description: MAPLEWOOD, N.J.  It's 7:15 A.M. and the cook, baker, and head salad maker have just arrived to begin preparations for the day'smenu at Maplewood Junior High School.

title: The End of the Tunnel
description: WASHINGTON, April 29In happier Vietnamese days, some cartoonist joked: Will the last man through the tunnel please turn out the light? But it is an interesting sidelight on the tragedy that the last Americans remaining in Saigon were the first Americans almost a generation ago to go therethe reporters who stayed behind.

title: CAMBODIA ORDERS FOREIGNERS OUT
description: PARIS, April 29The French Government said today that the people who have been isolated in its Phnom Penh embassy since the Cambodian Communists took over two weeks ago had been ordered expelled in the worst possible conditions.

title: Walston Is Fined For Discrimination
description: Walston & Co., Inc., formerly a major Wall Street brokerage firm, was fined $22,855 yesterday by the city's Human Rights Commission after it was found guilty of sex discrimination charges, The American Press reports.

title: Physicists Are Told of Canadian Reactor That Can Be Fueled Indefinitely by Nonfissionable Material
description: WASHINGTON, April 29American physicists heard today an enthusiastic account of a Canadian reactor that is basically different from any projected for American nuclear power plants.

title: A Snow of Blossoms
description: The city's major parks have been transformed in recent days into what a poet once described as a snow of blossoms and a wild of flowers. In Central Park, for example, the magnolias are in full bloom behind the Metropolitan Museum; the Japanese cherries are flowering; the azaleas are beginning. In a few days, the pink and white of flowering crab will burst out at the zoo.

title: Public Health Association To Honor Mt. Sinai Doctor
description: The Public Health Association of New York City will present its Haven Emerson Award to Dr. Irving Selikoff, professor of community medicine at Mount Sinai Hospital, at the luncheon session of its annual meeting on May 28 at the Biltmore Hotel.

title: The Mood Is Indigo and Nostalgia As Pews Fill to Honor the Duke
description: For 24 hours yesterday from midnight to midnight the music of Duke Ellington filled the main sanctuary of the Central Church at Park Avenue at 64th Street as a seemingly endless flow of jazz musicians celebrated what would have been the Duke's 76th birthday.

title: Karpov Won't Play Fischer For Title, Chess Aide Says
description: MOSCOW, April 29 (UPI) Max Euwe, president of the International Chess Federation, said in an interview published today that any match betwen the world champion, Anatoly Karpov, and his predecessor, Bobby Fischer ,must be a nontitlte event.

title: OTB Parlor In Suffolk Is Picketed
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., April 29Frank Greene was up earlier than usual today so he could drive down to the Suffolk Offtrack Betting Corporation's second new parlor and place his bets before it got too crowded. But when he got to the location, there already was a crowdmore than 50 women and children were protesting today's opening of the parlor.

title: Contract Awards
description: An order worth more than $20million has been re ceived by ResearchCottrell, Inc., Bound Brook, N.J., from an unidentified southwestern utility for the design and materials for electostatic precipitators.

title: Albany Houses Vie on Malpractice Insurance Measures
description: ALBANY. April 29  The houses of the Legislature went separate ways on the medical malpractice issue tonight, as the Republicancontrolled Senate passed one program and the Democraticcontrolled Assembly bogged down in its attempt to pass a rival measure.

title: Construction Halted
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., April 29The construction of temporary housing for Vietnamese refugees was halted here today after military authorities said they were not certain that any would arrive.

title: Dishes From the Abruzzi Region, Cradle of Great Italian Chefs
description: When Luigi Nanni, whom we consider to be one of the best Italian chefs in Manhattan, came into our home to cook one day recently, we recalled an anecdote related by an Italian journalist of the last century.

title: HEAVY USERS FACE CON ED INCREASE
description: The state's Public Service Commission ordered the Consolidated Edison Company yesterday to raise its rates for those customers who accounted for the heaviest summer power demands and to cut the rates for customers whose usage did not create excess power demand.

title: Trading in Javelin Halted
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (Reuters) The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it had suspended trading in all securities of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., pending dissemination of information concerning regulatory action by Canadian authorities.

title: The Ash Can School Graduates to City Hall
description: It began five weeks ago when First Deputy Mayor James A. Cavanagh looked up from his desk at the laminated awards and citations, the paintings of Trinity Church, the Eiffel Tower and Venice, and the O.T.B. daily handle charts he had hung on his City Hall office wall. I'm tired of looking at these, he grumbled to his executive assistant, Florence Daniels, Let's get some different pictures.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
description: Horses listed in order of most positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: C.I.A. PLOT TO KILL CASTRO DESCRIBED
description: WASHINGTON, April 27, (AP) The Central Intelligence Agency flew a twoman assassination team into Cuba in an unsuccessful attempt to kill Premier Fidel Castro, a retired Air Foree colonel said today.

title: Call for Pullout, Then a Night's Vigil at White House
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The United States exit from South Vietnam, like so much that preceded it, was dictated by events in Saigon that outpaced hopes in Washington.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: DEFERRALS FACED BY 3 BOND ISSUES
description: Uncertainty over details of the Treasury's May refunding resulted yesterday in the temporary deferral of three bond issues scheduled for public offering this week. The postponement reflected the reluctance of institutional buyers to commit themselves to longterm investments until the Treasury clears the air tomorrow by announcing its plans.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Highpressure airless paint spray guns may be hazardous and lead to finger amputations, the United States Consumer Products Safety Commission warns. Because the guns eject paint with a great deal of pressure and at a high velocity, the user's skin may be penetrated and paint injected into the underlying tissues, if the user's hand, finger or other parts of the body come into contact with the jet spray, it said.

title: New Techniques Help Pupils Develop Values
description: In the brightly decorated library of the Gould Avenue School in North Caldwell, N.J., a group of fifth graders recently acted out a moral dilemma. The issue was whether a 12yearold, finding himself short of funds at a movie theater, should lie about his age to get in at a reduced rate.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 30, 1975

title: Hazel Felleman, Queries Editor For Times Book Review, Dead
description: Hazel Felleman, who conducted the Queries and Answers column in The New York Times Book Review for many years, died yesterday at her home in the Beacon Hotel, Broadway at 74th Street. She was in her eighties. She retired in 1951 after 46 years with The Times.

title: MOHAWK DATA SETS CLAIM SETTLEMENT
description: The Mohawk Data Sciences Corporation said yesterday that it had reached an agreement to settle the claims against it in the pending class action begun in 1971 by Michael G. Gilman against the company, its former independent public accountants and certain former I directors and officers.

title: TV: Pirthldello's Rules of the Game
description: While Italy's Luigi Pirandello has been one of the most influential playwrights of this century, that winner of a Nobel Prize can also be one of the most exasperating. His plays are carefully constructed scaffoldings for philosophical treatises, intellectual exercises. For some people, including myself, the results are fascinating. For others, a good many others, they merely produce murmurs of impatience.

title: Snag Develops in Albany On U.D.C. Fiscal Trouble
description: ALBANY, April 29A lastminute snag in the final settlement of the Urban Development Corporation's financial problems developed today as the Senate Republicans accused the Democrats of making their support for an $88million state appropriation for the U.D.C. contingent on Republican support for a series of bills that would make it harder to raise rents in the agency's housing projects.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Authorities said yesterday that overloaded electrical circuits were the probable cause of a fire in Newark on Monday that killed a woman, her 2yearold daughter and an 18monthold boy. The authorities identified the victims as Edith Harris, 24 years old, her daughter, Leona, and 18monthold Gerard Francis, whose mother reportedly left her with a babysitter in the building four months ago and disappeared.

title: UNION CARBIDE SETS ICELANDIC VENTURE
description: The Union Carbide Corporation said today it had agreed with the Government of Iceland to build a $75million ferroalloy plant at Hvalfjordur, on the west coast of Iceland. A new company has been formed, Icelandic Alloys, Ltd., which will be owned 55 per cent by Iceland and 45 per cent by Union Carbide.

title: MINH OFFERS UNCONDITIONAL SURRENDER; 1,000 AMERICANS EVACUATED FROM SAIGON IN COPTERS WITH 5,500 SOUTH VIETNAMESE
description: WASHINGTON, April 29The United States ended two decades of military involvement in Vietnam today with the evacuation of about 1,000 Americans from Saigon as well as more than 5,500 South Vietnamese.

title: POSTAL FEE HELD THREAT TO PRESS
description: Scheduled postal rate increases of up to 251 per cent for periodicals and books present a serious threat to First Amendment guarantees of free speech and a free press, Andrew Heiskell, chairman of Time Inc., warned last night.

title: When the Niceties Go
description: BALTIMOREIt was Tuesday noon, when I heard the familiar voice over the P.A. system. Ric Pfeffer, Ric Pfeffer, call 660. Responding dutifully, I parked my fork lift and dialed. Come to the office, the answering voice said, and soon I was handed my job performance review.

title: 2d Key Met Museum Aide Quits In Dispute Over Hoving Methods
description: With an attack on Thomas P. F. Hoving's administration at the Metropolitan Museum of Art alleging its inability to function in any way that creates or preserves trust, confidence and decency, Anthony M. Clark, chairman of the museum's department of European paintings, has resigned.

title: Connecticut Governor Throws Line to Whale
description: HARTFORD, April 29The Connecticut State Senate today voted by 2412 to designate the sperm whale as the state animal after receiving favorable word on the choice from the Governor.

title: Guam Refugees' Host
description: AGANA, Guam, April 29In the closing days of World War II a young naval officer named G. Stephen Morrison pushed the stick of his Hellcat forward and dived on some Japaneseoccupied islands from 1,500 feet. Now a rear admiral, he is the military commander for those sandy specks. And last Wednesday the lives of up to 50,000 South Vietnamese refugees sent here to Guam became his responsibility.

title: Republicans Expect President to Act Soon to Eliminate Remaining Price Controls on Domestic Crude
description: WASHINGTON, April 29Republican sources in Congress said tonight that they expected President Ford to take executive action soon to begin a gradual elimination of the remaining price controls on domestic crude oil.

title: CITIES DISPUTE FORD ON REVENUE SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, April 29A spokesman for the nation's cities said today that President Ford's proposed legislation to extend general revenue sharing is inadequate because it would not provide enough aid to meet rises in the rate of inflation.

title: Article 2  No Title
STORE CHAIN IS TOLD TO DIVEST AYRWAY
description: The Federal Trade Commission ordered the Associated Dry Goods Corporation yesterday to divest itself of 27 AyrWay discount stores within two years.

title: Saigon Copter Lands on Another In Stampede to U.S. Ship's Deck
description: ABOARD U.S.S. BLUE RIDGE, in South China Sea, April 29Scores of South Vietnamese helicopters filled with military men and civilians fled Saigon today and headed out to sea to search for the carriers of the United States Seventh Fleet.

title: Red Smith
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 20All night long thunderstorms howled through the area but by order of the Kentucky State Racing Commission they avoided Churchill Downs, and the morning sun shone impartially on just and unjust, on horses and their trainers and on the flower American letters who trooped through the stable area before breakfast to stare at the horses and buffet the trainers with questions. This is how it was in 1875 when a trainer named Andy Anderson was honing a little red horse named Aristides to a winning edge tor the first Kentucky Derby and this is how it was last year when Woody Stephens was getting Cannonof ade ready to win the 100th. Presumably this The Times is how it will always be in the week leading up to the first Saturday of May. The names change, the horses and the people, but scene and questions ??. Aristides to a winning edge tor the first Kentucky Derby and this is how it was last year when Woody Stephens was getting Cannonof ade ready to win the 100th. Presumably this The Times is how it will always be in the week leading up to the first Saturday of May. The names change, the horses and the people, but scene and questions ??.

title: Saigon Refugees Land Here Exhausted
description: In the dimly lit back room of Mina's restaurant on Park Avenue South, two Vietnamese children lay their heads down next to their dishes of rice yesterday afternoon and fell asleep.

title: Lacrosse Game Here Tonight
description: With their National Lacrosse League championship banner already installed, the Long Island Tomahawks will make their debut in the Nassau Coliseum tonight by facing the Montreal Quebeois.

title: I.O.S. CLASS ACTION REJECTED BY COURT
description: A United States Court of Appeals decision involving a $110million classaction suit for losses in the defunct Investors Overseas Services mutual fund has denied the protection of Federal securities law to foreigners for whom redress was sought.

title: Refugees Grateful for Guam Amenities
description: OROTE POINT, Guam, Wednesday, April 30  I think, said Huynh Thach Thanh, perhaps your government spend too much money on us refugees. We never expect electricity and water and everything.

title: Council Backs Cab Fee Rises And Ads on Exteriors of Taxis
description: The City Council, in an atmosphere of give and take, approved yesterday a $1.4million increase in fees for the taxicab industry, then voted to permit exterior taxicab advertising that could net the industry $1.7million a year.

title: FORD UNITY PLEA
description: WASHINGTON, April 29The United States ended two decades of military involvement in Vietnam today with the evacuation of about 1,000 Americans from Saigon as well as more than 5,500 South Vietnamese.

title: Canada Plans Action on U.S. Publishers
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., April 29J. Hugh Faulkner, the Canadian Secretary of State, announced to the annual meeting of the American Association of Publishers here today that his Government would soon subject foreign publishers to careful scrutiny and would adopt as yet unspecified measures to insure the health of the Canadian book publishing industry.

title: JobStarved City
description: The disclosure that total employment in New York City has dropped to the lowest level in more than twenty years casts a shadow even deeper than the recession.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: U.S. Planes in Action
description: SINGAPORE, Wednesday, April 30 (Reuters)  United States Navy fighter planes went into action over South Vietnam yesterday to protect fleeing refugees from marauding helicopters, according to military and civilian communications reports monitored here.

title: What Kind of Brothers?
description: ANKARA, TurkeyMore than fifty years ago Prof. Arnold Toynbee wrote: Western sentiment about the Greeks and the Turks is for the most part illinformed, violently expressed and dangerously influential.

title: Carey, Noting These Austere Times, Rejects 6% Pay Rise for State Workers
description: ALBANY, April 29Putting political pressure on the Legislature, Governor Carey rejected as unacceptable today a factfinding panel's recommendation of 6 per cent raises for state workers.

title: State Court Investigating Judge Wright
description: Judge Bruce McM. Wright of Civil Court here is under investigation by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court because of complaints by the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association and unidentified parties protesting the judge's bailsetting policies, his lawyers disclosed yesterday.

title: Article 5  No Title
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP)The Commerce Department announced today it was backing a $22.5million loan for one shipbuilding and repair company and was considering urgent financial aid for a second company to help ease problems in the industry.

title: State School Death Laid To Choking on Styrofoam
description: The death of a retarded resident of the New Lisbon State School Sunday was caused by choking on stryofoam he accidentally swallowed, the state police reported yesterday.

title: Ashe Gets Chance For Major Title
description: Arthur Ashe's big chance is at hand. Without a major title in a long time, he has won the bonus for the best singles record on the justended World Championship Tennis tour that started in January with 84 top players. Ashe will now make his fifth attempt to win the W.C.T. crown in the eightman $100,000 playoff May through 11 at Dallas.

title: Rumanian Victor In Eastern Tennis
description: WOODBURY L.I., April 29  Willie Oropez of New York overcame 15yearold Marcel Freeman of Port Washington, 60, 60, and Peter Marmuraneau of Rumania defeated Tom Simcik of Elmhurst, Queens, 64, 63, pacing the field into the quarterfinals of the Eastern men's hardcourt tennis championships today at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: Bridge:
description: When choosing between two trump suits for slam purposes, it is usually right to select the stronger. This advice is easier to state than it is to execute, as the diagramed deal from the Long Island regionals last weekend demonstrates.

title: District 9 Election Is in the Spotlight
description: Just as it has for most of the current academic year, Community School District in the Bronx is attracting more than the usual share of attention as the local school board election campaigns in the city enter the final stage.
